Recipe.Name: Apple Brown Betty
Method: 1 Combine the bread crumbs, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Cut in the butter. Slowly add the water and mix.
2 Pour the apples into a 9x9" baking dish. Cover with the bread crumb mixture.
3 Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 30 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Apricots, candied
Method: In large bowl, mix together 4qts water and baking soda. Add fruit. Soak for 10 minutes, then drain. In large sauce pan, combine sugar and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Add fruit and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool. Simmer mixture for 20 minutes each day until syrup is absorbed. Dry fruit on waxed paper on trays in the sun. Dredge fruit with sugar and store in airtight container.

Recipe.Name: Bread, pumpkin
Method: 1. Preheat oven to 350° F. Grease two loaf pans.
2. In a medium mixing bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt, baking powder, nutmeg, allspice, cinnamon and cloves.

3. In a large bowl with an electric mixer, blend sugar, oil and beaten eggs. Stir in pumpkin. Slowly blend the flour mixture into pumpkin mixture. While blending the mixture add water incrementally. Pour the batter into two prepared loaf pans.
4. Bake in a preheated 350° F oven for 90 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pans.

Recipe.Name: Bread, sourdough starter
Method: 1  Dissolve the yeast in 1/2 cup lukewarm water.
2  Gradually stir in the powdered milk and flour using a non-metal utensil.
3  Let stand uncovered at 80 to 90 degrees F for 4-7 days, or until it bubbles. During this period, stir down once per day.
3  When ready, use at once in a sourdough starter bread recipe.

Recipe.Name: Cake, chocolate w/cream cheese icing
Method: Chocolate Cake:

Grease and flour a 10x15" jelly roll pan. In a large bowl, sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. In a saucepan, combine margarine, shortening, cocoa, and water. Bring to boil. Cook for 1 minute. Pour over the dry ingredients. Stir well. Blend in beaten eggs and buttermilk. Pour into the jelly roll pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes, or until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean. Let cool.
Cream Cheese Icing:
In a saucepan, on meadium-low heat, melt butter and cream cheese. Take off heat and combine with the vanilla extract and powdered sugar. Mix until smooth and spread on cake.
Cut into 12 slices before serving.

Recipe.Name: Cake, chocolate w/vanilla icing
Method: Chocolate Cake:

Grease and flour a 10x15" jelly roll pan. In a large bowl, sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. In a saucepan, combine margarine, shortening, cocoa, and water. Bring to boil. Cook for 1 minute. Pour over the dry ingredients. Stir well. Blend in beaten eggs and buttermilk. Pour into the jelly roll pan. Bake in a 350 degree F. oven for 30 minutes, or until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean. Let cool.
Vanilla Icing:

In large bowl combine powdered sugar, shortening, milk, flour, salt and vanilla extract. Beat at low speed with an electric mixer for 45 seconds or until blended. Increase to high speed and beat for 3 - 5 minutes or until smooth and creamy. Spread on cake.
Cut into 12 slices before serving.

Recipe.Name: Cake, chocolate, pudding
Method: 1. Preheat oven to 350° F. Grease and flour a 9 x 13-inch pan.

2. In a large saucepan combine the non-instant pudding mix with milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the pudding is thickened. Remove from heat. Pour the dry cake mix into the saucepan and mix until smooth. Pour batter into prepared pan and sprinkle with chocolate chips.
3. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.

Recipe.Name: Cake, chocolate, w/fluffy white icing
Method: Chocolate Cake:

Grease and flour a 10x15" jelly roll pan. In a large bowl, sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. In a saucepan, combine margarine, shortening, cocoa, and water. Bring to boil. Cook for 1 minute. Pour over the dry ingredients. Stir well. Blend in beaten eggs and buttermilk. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes, or until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean. Let cool.
Fluffy White Icing:

In a saucepan, combine the sugar, water, and cream of tartar. Cook over medium-high heat until sugar is dissolved and the mixture is bubbly. In a medium bowl, whip egg whites and vanilla to soft peaks. Slowly add the sugar mixture while whipping constantly until soft peaks form, about 7-10 minutes. Spread on cake.
Cut into 12 slices before serving.

Recipe.Name: Cake, marble, w/chocolate icing
Method: Marble Cake:

Grease and flour 2 - 8" or 9" round pans. In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, softened butter, eggs, vanilla and milk. By hand, beat slowly to moisten, then beat with an electric mixer at medium speed for about 2 minutes or until smooth. Remove 3/4 cup batter. Set aside. Divide remaining batter into the two greased and floured round pans. Stir the cocoa powder into the 3/4 cup batter that was removed earlier. Drob by spoonfuls over top of white batter. Using a knife, swirl the cocoa batter into the white batter, making a marble-type effect. Bake at 350 degree F for 30 to 35 minutes, or until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean. Let cool.
Chocolate Icing:
In a saucepan, bring to boil margarine, milk, and cocoa. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Mix in powdered sugar. Spread on cake.
Cut cake into 12 slices before serving.

Recipe.Name: Cake, white, w/chocolate icing
Method: 1 Make the cake mix according to the box instructions.
2 Melt the chocolate, slowly, in a saucepan. Mix with the softened butter. Add the powdered sugar, vanilla, and cream. Spread on top of the cake. Cut and serve.

Recipe.Name: Candy, divinity
Method: 1. In a heavy 2 quart saucepan, combine the sugar, syrup, hot water and salt. Cook and stir until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to a boil.
2. Cook to hard ball stage (250° F.) without stirring; wipe crystals from sides of pan often. Remove from heat.

3. Pour hot syrup slowly over stiff beaten egg whites, beating constantly at high speed of mixer for about 5 minutes. Add vanilla and continue beating until mixture forms soft peaks and begins to lose its gloss. If it is too stiff, add a few drops hot water.
4. Drop and twirl onto wax paper.

Recipe.Name: Candy, pralines
Method: 1. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

2. In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine pecans, sugar, butter, brown sugar, milk and vanilla. Heat to between 234° F and 240° F, or until a small amount of syrup dropped into cold water forms a soft ball that flattens when removed from the water and placed on a flat surface.
3. Drop by spoonfuls onto prepared baking sheet. Let cool completely.
(Note: Recipe calls for toasted pecans, dried pecans substituted above.)

Recipe.Name: Candy, taffy
Method: 1. Butter one 8 x 8-inch square pan; set aside.

2. In a 2 quart saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, corn syrup, water, butter, cornstarch and salt. Mix together well and bring to a boil. Heat without stirring until a candy thermometer reads 250° F.

3. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla, almond extract, almonds and 10 drops of green food color. Pour into pan. Let stand until cool enough to handle. (Taffy should be lukewarm in center as well as at the edges.)

4. At this point, fold, double and pull the taffy until it is light in color and stiff. Butter hands lightly if taffy begins to stick. Cut taffy into pieces with scissors and wrap the pieces with plastic wrap to maintain shape.

Recipe.Name: Cookie, snickerdoodle
Method: 1  Cream together the butter and 1-1/2 cups sugar. Set aside.
2  Mix together the salt, flour, soda, and cream of tartar. Add slowly to the butter mixture.
3  Mix together the egg, milk, and vanilla. Add to the mixture.
4  Bake in a 350 degree oven for 7-10 minutes, or until lightly browned.
5  Mix together the 3 T sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle on top of the warm cookies.

Recipe.Name: Crisp, apple
Method: 1. Preheat oven to 350° F.

2. Place apples in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. In a bowl, cream together butter and sugar. Stir in flour, instant oatmeal and salt. Fold in walnuts. Sprinle oatmeal mixture evenly over apples. Drizzle with syrup.
3. Bake in preheated oven 50 to 70 minutes, until apples are tender and topping is golden.

Recipe.Name: Crisp, apricot
Method: 1 Combine the flour, sugar and cinnamon. Cut in the margarine. Stir in the lemon juice.
2 Pour the apricots into a 9x9" baking dish. Cover with the flour mixture.
3 Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Crisp, peach
Method: 1 Combine the flour, sugar, and cinnamon. Cut in the margarine. Stir in the lemon juice.
2 Pour the peaches into a 9x9" baking dish. Cover with the flour mixture.
3 Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 30 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Dish, crepe, meat filled
Method: Crepes:

In a medium bowl, thoroughly beat eggs. Add milk and melted butter. Beat in flour and salt. Mix until smooth. Let batter set .5 hour. Pour batter into medium hot skillet, making 8 crepes, 6-8 inches in circumference. Brown and set aside.
Meat Filling:

In a large skillet, over medium heat, brown veall, ground chicken (substituted roasted, chopped chicken in recipe), and 1/2 lb raw beef in butter. Stir in minced parsley, cheese, salt, ground pepper, and nutmeg. Let cool.
White Sauce:
In a small saucepan, over medium heat, cook flour and butter together for 1 minute. Stir in salt, ground pepper, and nutmeg. Then, stir in milk and continue to cook until thick.
Presentation:

Spread one-half of the 32 oz. jar tomato pasta sauce (substituted Ready-To-Serve Spaghetti/Marinara Sauce in recipe) in bottom of baking dish. Fill crepes with meat mixture, folding over all sides of crepe to form palm-sized bundles. Place seam side down in baking dish. Cover with remaining tomato pasta sauce and pour White Sauce over everthing. Cover with mozzarella cheese first, then with parmesan cheese. Bake in a 9x13" baking pan, in a 375 degree F oven for 20 to 30 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly and brown on the edges. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Dish, manicotti w/cheese filling
Method: 1. Boil manicotti shells according to package directions.
2. Combine other ingredients except the spaghetti sauce. Spoon 1 tablespoon cheese mixture into each shell.
3. Place shells close together in a greased baking dish. Cover with the spaghetti sauce. Heat in a 350° F. oven for 30 minutes, or until hot and bobbly.

Recipe.Name: Dish, moussaka, lamb & eggplant
Method: 1 Slice the eggplant. Combine the milk and egg. Dip the eggplant pieces in the egg and milk mixture, and then in the flour. Fry in margarine until soft. Arrange as one layer in a baking dish.
2 Combine the lamb, onion, parsley, wine, tomato paste and salt. Heat. Pour over the eggplant. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Dish, souffle, cheese
Method: Mix all of the ingredients together. Pour into a deep baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. Serve immediately.
Note: use raw eggs for making the recipe. Boiled eggs used above for the nutritional analysis.

Recipe.Name: Dish, spaghetti w/meatballs
Method: Spaghetti Noodles:
Fill large cooking pot with 7qts water. Bring to boil. Add pasta to boiling water. Cook 8 - 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain. Do not rinse.
Spaghetti Sauce:

Heat olive oil in Dutch oven. Cook and stir onion and finely chopped garlic until onion is tender. Stir in 3-8oz cans tomato sauce, 1-4oz can mushrooms with liquid, green pepper, parsley, salt, ground pepper, sugar, dry basil leaves, and oregano. Heat to boiling, reduce heat. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1 hour. Stir in dry red wine. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.
Meatballs:

Mix together 1.5 lb raw ground beef, bread crumbs, finely chopped onion, milk, dry red wine, egg, parsley, salt, Worcestershire Sauce, and ground pepper. Shape into rounded tablespoon size balls. Heat 1/4 cup canola oil (2 tablespoons used in nutritional anaylsis) in 10-inch skillet. Cook meatballs in hot oil until done, about 20 minutes.
Presentation:
Put meatballs onto spaghetti, cover with sauce, and top with 1 tbsp grated parmesan cheese.

Recipe.Name: Figs, candied
Method: In large bowl, mix together 4qts water and baking soda. Add fruit. Soak for 10 minutes, then drain. In large sauce pan, combine sugar and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Add fruit and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool. Simmer mixture for 20 minutes each day until syrup is absorbed. Dry fruit on waxed paper on trays in the sun. Dredge fruit with sugar and store in airtight container.

Recipe.Name: Fudge, peanut butter
Method: 1. Butter one 9 x 9-inch pan and set aside.
2. In a 3 quart saucepan, combine white sugar, brown sugar, milk and butter. Cook to soft ball stage, 234° F. Remove from heat.
3. Stir in peanut butter, vanilla and marshmallows; continue stirring until marshmallows are melted. Pour into prepared pan and cool. Cut into squares and serve.

Recipe.Name: Fudge, w/marshmallows
Method: 1. Butter a 7 x 11-inch pan. Set aside.
2. In a 3 quart saucepan, mix together sugar, condensed milk, butter and marshmallows. Cook over low heat and bring to a boil. Boil 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat.
3. Add vanilla, nuts and chocolate chips. Stir until chips are melted.
4. Pour into prepared pan. Cool. Cut.

Recipe.Name: Fudge, w/nuts brown sugar
Method: 1. In a medium saucepan, combine brown sugar, cream and butter. Stir until dissolved. Heat to between 234° F. and 240° F., or until a small amount of syrup dropped into cold water forms a soft ball that flattens when removed from the water and placed on a flat surface. Remove from heat and stir vigorously until mixture loses its gloss, or process in a food processor 30 seconds. Quickly stir in vanilla and nuts and spread into a 9 x 9-inch dish. Chill before cutting into squares.

Recipe.Name: Gelatin Pops, fzn
Method: Disolve gelatin, Kool-Aid drink mix and sugar in 2 cups of boiling water. Stir in 2 cups of cold water and pour into popsicle molds or small plastic drinking cups. Freeze until hard. (If using plastic drinking cups, freeze until firm, insert popsicle sticks, then freeze completely.)

Recipe.Name: Instant Breakfast, prep w/1% milk
Method: Open envelope and pour into large glass. Add milk. Stir until well blended.

Recipe.Name: Mixed Drink, Bloody Mary
Method: 1. Combine the tomato juice, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce,  and a dash of salt and pepper. Stir to mix well.
2. Pour into container and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled. Put 2 cubes in each 8 ounce glass, add 1-1/2 ounces vodka and 5 ounces tomato juice mixture. Garnish with a slice of lemon.

Recipe.Name: Mixed Drink, Gin & Tonic
Method: 1. Stir gin and tonic; strain into a chilled tumbler with ice.

Recipe.Name: Mixed Drink, Manhattan
Method: 1. Combine the whiskey, vermouth, a dash of bitters, and ice cubes in a mixing glass and stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the cherry.

Recipe.Name: Mixed Drink, Martini
Method: 1. Combine all ingredients, exept the olive, in a mixing glass and stir. Strain into a well-chilled cocktail glass. Add olive.
(Note: Recipe calls for dry vermouth, sweet vermouth substituted above.)

Recipe.Name: Mixed Drink, Tom Collins
Method: 1. In a tall glass stir together the lemon juice and superfine sugar until the sugar is dissolved, add the gin and ice cubes to fill the glass and stir the drink well.
2. Top off the drink with the club soda, stir it well, and garnish it with the lemon slice.

Recipe.Name: Pears, candied
Method: In large bowl, mix together 4qts water and baking soda. Add fruit. Soak for 10 minutes, then drain. In large sauce pan, combine sugar and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil. Add fruit and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool. Simmer mixture for 20 minutes each day until syrup is absorbed. Dry fruit on waxed paper on trays in the sun. Dredge fruit with sugar and store in airtight container.

Recipe.Name: Pie, butterscotch
Method: 1. In a large bowl, mix pudding mix and milk according to  package directions. Fold half of the thawed whipped topping into pudding. Pour mixture into graham cracker crust. Spread remaining whipped topping on top of pudding layer. Cover and refrigerate for about an hour.
2. Serve cold with a drizzle of butterscotch topping over top of pie.

Recipe.Name: Pie, lemon chiffon
Method: Mix gelatin and cold water. Set aside.

Separate eggs. Set aside egg whites. Beat egg yolks until thick. In a heavy sauce pan, combine egg yolks with sugar, grated lemon rind (lemon peel in recipe), lemon juice, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes, or until thickened, over medium heat. Stir constantly. Remove from heat, add gelatin mixture. Stir until gelatin dissolves. Set aside. Let cool.

Beat room temperature egg whites until foamy. Gradually add the last .5 cup of sugar, one spoonful at a time, while beating until soft peaks form. Carefully fold egg whites and whipped cream into cooled lemon mixture. Pile into 9" cooled pie crust. Chill until set. Cut into eight slices. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Pie, rhubarb
Method: In a small bowl, combine sugar and flour. Sprinkle one-quarter of mixture over pastry in 9" pie plate. Heap chopped rhubarb in pie plate. Sprinkle with remaining sugar mixture. Dot with small pieces of butter. Cover with top crust.

Place pie on lowest rack in oven. Bake for 15 minutes at 450 degrees F, then reduce oven temperature to 350°F. Bake an additional 40 to 45 minutes, until crust is golden. Cut into eight slices before serving. Serve warm or cold.

Recipe.Name: Pie, strawberry chiffon
Method: 1  Place strawberries, sugar, and gelatin in a blender, blend until smooth, and pour into the pie crust. Chill until firm.
2  Beat the whipping cream until stiff and spread on top of the pie and serve.

Recipe.Name: Popover, w/2% milk
Method: 1. Preheat oven to 425° F.
2. Spray a popover pan with nonstick cooking spray. Place pan on center rack of oven and preheat for 2 minutes.
3. Blend flour, salt, eggs, milk and 1 tablespoon of melted butter until it looks like heavy cream, about 1 to 2 minutes.
4. Cut 2 tablespoons chilled butter into 6 even pieces. Place 1 piece of butter in each cup and place pan back in the oven until butter is bubbly (about 1 minute).
5. Fill each cup half full with batter and bake 20 minutes. Reduce heat to 325° F and bake for another 15 to 20 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Pudding, bread
Method: 1. Heat oven to 375° F.
2. Combine bread cubes, margarine, raisins and cinnamon; mix well and place in a 2 quart dish.
3. Slightly beat eggs. Stir in sugar, vanilla and salt. Beat until sugar is dissolved. Add hot milk to eggs; beat well. Pour over bread cubes and let soak for 5 minutes.
4. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Bake for 25 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Salad, gelatin, fruity
Method: 1. In a non-reactive sauce pan, combine the lemon-lime soda pop and marshmallows; heat until dissolved stirring constantly. Add gelatin and stir until dissolved.
2. Add cream cheese and blend by hand or with electric mixer until smooth.
3. Add pineapple and juice, pecans, mayonnaise and whipped topping. Pour into a 7 x 11-inch dish, chill until set.

Recipe.Name: Salad, waldorf
Method: 1  Mix all of the ingredients together.
2  Chill until ready to serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, avocado & cheese, on white
Method: Spread the mayonnaise on one slice of bread. Layer the sprouts, avocado, cheese and tomato on top of the mayonniase. Top with the remianing slice of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, beef, patty melt, on rye
Method: Spread the mayonnaise on one slice of bread and the margarine on the other. Layer the cooked hamburger patty and the cheese between the slices of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, BLT, on part whole wheat
Method: Spread the mayonnaise on one of the slices of bread. Layer the tomato, lettuce, and bacon on the mayonniase. Top with the remaining slice of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, chicken salad, on part wheat
Method: Make the chicken salad according to the recipe instructions. Spread the mayonnaise on the bread. Spread the chicken salad on one slice of bread. Cover with the other slice of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, corned beef & swiss, on rye
Method: Spread the mayonnaise on one slice of bread. Spread the mustard on the other slice of bread. Layer the cheese and corned beef between the slices of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, egg salad, on part wheat
Method: Make the egg salad according to the recipe instructions. Spread the mayonnaise on one slice of bread. Spread the egg salad on top of the mayonnaise. Top with the remaining slice of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, grilled cheese, part wheat
Method: Place the cheese between the two slices of bread. Spread 1 tsp margarine on the outside of each slice of bread. Grill the sandwich until each side is lightly browned. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, ham & cheese, on part wheat
Method: Spread the mayonnaise on one slice of bread and the mustard on the other slice. Layer the cheese and ham between the slices of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, ham & swiss, on rye
Method: Spread the mayonnaise on one slice of bread and mustard on the other. Layer the ham and cheese between the slices of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, ham, on part wheat
Method: Spread the mayonnaise on one slice of bread and the mustard on the other slice. Place the ham between the slices of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, peanut butter/jam, on white
Method: Spread the peanut butter on one slice of bread. spread the jam on top of the peanut butter. Cover with the remaining slice of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, roast beef, on part wheat
Method: Spread the mayonnaise on both slices of bread. Place the beef between the slices of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, tuna salad, on part wheat
Method: Make the tuna salad according to the recipe instructions. Spread the mayonnaise on the two slices of bread. Spread the tuna salad on one slice of bread. Cover with the other slice. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, turkey ham, on part wheat
Method: Spread mayonnaise on one slice of bread. Spread mustard on the other slice of bread. Place the turkey ham between the two slices of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, turkey ham, on rye
Method: Spread mayonnaise on one slice of bread. Spread mustard on the other slice of bread. Place the turkey between the slices of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sandwich, turkey ham/cheese, on rye
Method: Spread the mayonnaise on one slice of bread. Spread the mustard on the other slice of bread. Layer the cheese and turkey ham between the two slices of bread. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sauce, bearnaise
Method: Melt butter slowly in a double boiler. Slowly add the egg yolks, stirring constantly. Add the other ingredients. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sauce, bechamel
Method: Slowly melt the butter in a saucepan. Gradually add the flour, stirring constantly. Slowly add the chicken broth, salt and pepper, stirring constantly. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sauce, bordelaise
Method: Slowly melt the butter in a saucepan. Gradually add the flour, stirring constantly. Gradually add the broth, stirring constantly. Add the other ingredients. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sauce, curry
Method: Melt the margarine in a saucepan over low heat.  Gradually add the flour, stirring constantly. Slowly add the chicken broth, stirring constantly. Add the curry powder. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Sauce, mornay
Method: Make the white sauce according to the recipe instructions. Gradually add, stirring constantly, the melted butter and egg yolk. Add the cheese, onion, and salt. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Soup, beef stock
Method: Slice 1 large onion. Chop 2 stalks celery including leaves, and 3 large carrots into 1-inch chunks. Place carrots, onion, celery, and 6 lbs beef soup bones in large, shallow roasting pan. Bake, uncovered & turning occasionally, for 30 minutes or until bones are well browned.

After bones are browned, drain off excess fat. Place contents of roasting pan into large soup pot or Dutch oven. Pour .5 cup water into roasting pan and rinse. Pour this liquid into soup pot. Add l large tomato, 1/2 cup chopped parsnip, 1/2 cup cubed potatoes, 8 whole black peppercorns, 4 sprigs fresh parsley, 1 bay leaf, 1 tbsp salt, 2 tsp dried thyme, 2 cloves garlic and 12 cups water. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5 hours. Strain stock. Discard meat, vegetables, and seasonings.
TO CLARIFY STOCK:

To remove pieces too small to be strained out with cheesecloth, combine .25 cup cold water, 1 egg white, and 1 crushed eggshell. Add to strained stock. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Strain again through sieve lined with cheesecloth.

Recipe.Name: Soup, menudo, Mexican beef soup
Method: 1 Cut the beef into bite-sized pieces.
2 Slice the onions, garlic, and cilantro.
3 Pour the water into a large soup pot. Add the other ingredients. Simmer for 1 hour, until the flavors are blended.

Recipe.Name: Stew, Brunswick
Method: 1. In a large pot over high heat, combine the diced salt pork, chicken, and water and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 45 minutes, or until chicken is tender.
2. Remove chicken and allow to cool until easy to handle. Remove meat and discard the skin and bones. Chop meat into bite size pieces and return to the soup.
3. Add the cubed potatoes, chopped onions, diced tomatoes, corn, lima beans, Worchestershire sauce, salt and ground black pepper. Stir well and simmer, uncovered, for 1 hour.

Recipe.Name: Sweet Roll, cinnamon, w/raisins walnuts
Method: 1. In saucepan, heat 1 cup milk, water and 1/4 cup butter until very warm (butter doesn't need to be completely melted). Remove from heat.
2. Mix together salt, flour, yeast, 1/2 cup sugar, eggs and 1/3 cup softened butter in a medium bowl. Add the heated mixture until mixed well.

3. Divide dough into two parts. On a floured surface, roll each part into a large rectangle. Smear each rectangle with softened butter. Combine the cinnamon and 3/4 cup sugar. Sprinkle over the rectangles. Generously sprinkle the raisins and nuts over the top.

4. Roll the dough up into two logs starting at the long side. Cut each log into 12 slices. Place the rolls cut side down into to a  9 x 13-inch greased baking pans. Cover, and let rise in a warm place until almost doubled (about 30 minutes).
5. Bake in a preheated 375° F oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
6. To make the frosting: Combine the powdered sugar, 3 tablespoons melted butter, vanilla and 3 tablespoons milk. Frosting should be thick. Spread over baked rolls.
(Note: Recipe calls to use bread machine to mix dough, mixing by hand substituted above.)

Recipe.Name: Taco, chicken
Method: 1. Heat the taco shells in the oven according to the package directions.
2. Saute the onion in the butter until golden brown. Add the remaining ingredients (except the taco shells) and simmer about three minutes, until the liquid has been absorbed.
3. Divide the chicken mixture into the taco shells and serve.

Recipe.Name: Torte, cherry & cream cheese
Method: Spread the softened cream cheese in the bottom of the graham cracker crust. Combine the milk, cornstarch, lemon juice, and sugar. Heat until thickened. Add the cherries and pour the mixture over the cream cheese. Chill until set.

Recipe.Name: Tostada, bean & chicken
Method: Heat the beans and chicken. Layer on the tostada shell, the beans, chicken, cheese, lettuce, and picante sauce. Serve.

Recipe.Name: Apples, baked
Method: STEP 1:
Score cored, unpeeled apples once around middle to prevent bursting.  Place apples on pans.
STEP 2:
Mix sugar, cinnamon, and salt thoroughly.
STEP 3:
Combine with water and butter or margarine.  Pour 1½ qt syrup over apples in each pan.
STEP 4:
Bake 45 minutes or until tender, basting occasionally.
STEP 5:
Serve each apple with 2 tbsp. (1-AA ladel) syrup.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 40 lb fresh apples A.P. will yield 33 lb 14 oz cored apples.
2.  In Step 4, if convection oven is used, bake at 325° F for 30 minutes or until tender.  Use low fan, closed vent.
3.  In Step 4, baking time will vary depending on variety and size of apples.
VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKED APPLES WITH RAISIN NUT FILLING:  Follow Step 1.  Mix 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) raisins with 1 lb 4 oz (1½ qt) finely chopped unsalted nuts.  Fill cavity in center of each apple with 1-2/3 tbsp mixture.  Follow Steps 2 through 5.  EACH PORTION:  1 Apple with 2 tbsp syrup (6½ oz).

2.  BAKED APPLES WITH RAISIN COCONUT FILLING:  Follow Step 1.  Mix 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) raisins with 8 oz (3 cups) prepared sweetened flaked coconut.  Fill cavity in center of each apple with 1 tbsp mixture.  Follow Steps 2 through 5.  EACH PORTION:  1 Apple with 2 tbsp syrup (6 oz).

Recipe.Name: Bacon, oven fried
Method: STEP 1:
Arrange slices in rows (about 2 lb 8 oz per pan) down the length of pan, with fat edges slightly overlapping lean edges.
STEP 2:
Bake 25 minutes.  Drain excess fat.  Bake additional 5 to 10 minutes or until bacon is slightly crisp.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.
STEP 3:
Drain thoroughly.  Place on absorbent paper or in perforated steam table pan.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 12 lb slab bacon may be used.  Slice bacon 18 to 20 slices per pound.
2.  In Step 1, 18 lb bacon may be used.  EACH PORTION: 3 Slices (3/4 Ounce).
3.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 25 minutes on high fan, open vent.  Drain fat.  Bake additional 5 to 10 minutes.
VARIATIONS:

1.  OVEN FRIED CANADIAN BACON:  In Step 1, use 12 lb 8 oz Canadian style bacon.  Slice into 1 oz slices (200 slices).  Place slices shingled down length of sheet pan (4 pans), with lean edges overlapping fat edges.  Omit Step 2.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes or in 325°F. convection oven 6 to 8 minutes on high fan, open vent.  In Step 3, reserve cooking juices; pour 3/4 cup juices over bacon in each pan.  EACH PORTION:  2 Slices (1½ Ounces).

2.  GRILLED BACON:  In Step 1, place slices on 350°F. griddle.  Grill 5 minutes, turning once after 3 minutes, until slightly crisp.  Remove excess fat as it accumulates on griddle.  Omit Step 2.  Follow Step 3.

3.  GRILLED CANADIAN BACON:  In Step 1, use 12 lb 8 oz Canadian bacon.  Slice into 1 oz slices (200 slices)  Grill on lightly greased 350°F. griddle about 1 minute on each side.  Omit Step 2.  Follow Step 3.

Recipe.Name: Bagel, w/cream cheese
Method: STEP 1:
Place softened cream cheese in mixer bowl; beat at medium speed 3 to 4 minutes.
STEP 2:
Cut bagels in half.  Place in rows, 5 by 7, on ungreased sheet pans.  Toast 7 to 8 minutes until warm but still soft.
STEP 3:
Spread each bagel half with 1 tbsp cream cheese.  Serve immediately.
NOTE:
In Step 2, if convection oven is used, toast at 325°F. 3 to 4 minutes.
VARIATIONS:
1.  CREAM CHEESE AND TOMATO BAGEL:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Thinly slice 11 lb 2 oz (200 slices) tomatoes, fresh (11 lb 6 oz A.P.).  Place 1 slice tomato on each half.
2.  CREAM CHEESE AND OLIVE BAGEL:  In Step 1, use
6 lb (3 qt) cream cheese.  Add 1 lb (3/4 - 1 qt jar) finely chopped olives, green; beat an additional 2 minutes at medium speed.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

Recipe.Name: Bagels
Method: STEP 7:
FERMENT:  Cover.  Set in a warm place (80°F.) about 15 to 20 minutes or until dough increases slightly in bulk.
STEP 8:

MAKE UP:  Shape bagels like a doughnut; flatten to 2½ inch circles, 3/4-inch thick.  Pinch center of each bagel with thumb and forefinger and pull gently to make a 1-inch diameter hole and a total 3½-inch diameter, keeping uniform shape.  Place on 4 ungreased sheet pans in rows 4 by 6 per pan.
STEP 9:
PROOF:  At 90°F. until bagels begin to rise, about 20 to 30 minutes.
STEP 10:
Lightly grease 5 sheet pans; use 13-1/3 oz (2½ cups) cornmeal, sprinkle each pan with 1/2 cup cornmeal.
STEP 11:

Add 4 gal water to steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; bring to a boil; reduce heat to a simmer.  Add 3½ oz (½ cup) granulated sugar to water.  Stir until dissolved.  Gently drop bagels, one at a time, into water.  Cook 30 seconds; turn; cook 30 seconds.  Remove bagels with slotted spoon; drain.  Place on sheet pans in rows 4 by 5.
STEP 12:
BAKE:  30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown and crisp.  Remove from pans; cool on wire racks.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, a 60 qt mixer should be used for 100 portions as dough is very stiff.  If using 20 to 30 qt mixers, prepare no more than 50 portions at a time.
2.  In Steps 7 and 9, bagels should NOT double in bulk.
3.  In Step 12, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 15 to 20 minutes on high fan, open vent.

Recipe.Name: Banana Split
Method: STEP 1:
Peel and slice bananas lengthwise into quaters;  place on pan.
STEP 2:
Pour juice over bananas;  cover with waxed paper;  refrigerate until ready to serve.
STEP 3:

Make banana splits to order.  Place ½ cup (1 No. 8 scoop)  ice cream in soup bowl.  Drain 2 banana quaters;  place 1 on each side of ice cream.  Ladle 2 tbsp (1-0 size ladle)  sauce over ice cream.  Top with 1 tbsp whipped topping, 1 tsp chopped nuts and ½ maraschino cherry.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2,  4 lb (8 oranges)  fresh oranges A.P. will yield 2 cups juice.
2.  In Step 2,  1/2 cup frozen orange juice concentrate combined with water or ½ No. 3 cyl cn canned orange juice or ½ No. 3 cyl cn canned pineapple juice may be used.
3.  If desired, in Step 3, bananas may be peeled and sliced to order.  Omit Step 2.
4.  In Step 3,  Chocolate Sauce (Recipe No. K-5)  or Chocolate Syrup or Topping, Ice Cream, Butterscotch, Fudge, Marshmallow, Pineapple, or Strawberry may be used.
5.  In Step 3, Whipped Topping (Recipe No. K-2)  may be used.
6.  In Step 3, hard or soft serve ice cream or soft serve may be used.

Recipe.Name: Bar, hermits
Method: STEP 1:
Blend sugar, shortening, baking soda, 1-2/3 cups eggs (about 9), nutmeg, and cinnamon in mixer bowl at low speed 1 to 2 minutes or until well blended.  Scrape down bowl.
STEP 2:
Add molasses, water, and raisins; mix at medium speed about 1 minute or until blended.
STEP 3:
Add flour gradually; mix at low speed only until ingredients are combined.
STEP 4:

Divide dough into 12 pieces weighing about 1 lb 1 oz each; form into strips about 22 inches long.  Place 3 strips on each lightly greased pan.  Press down until each is 3 inches wide, and 3/8 inches thick.
STEP 5:
Bake about 25 minutes or until done.
STEP 6:
Loosen baked strips from pans while still warm; cut each strip into 16 bars.
NOTE:
In Step 5,  if convection oven is used, bake at 325° F. 10 to 12 minutes or until done on low fan, open vent.

Recipe.Name: Bar, nut, chewy
Method: STEP 1:
Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Place brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla in mixer bowl.  Beat at low speed 1 minute, then at medium speed 2 to 3 minutes or until smooth.
STEP 3:
Add flour mixture; mix at low speed 1 minute or until well blended.
STEP 4:
Add nuts; mix 1 minute at low speed.
STEP 5:
Spread about 6 lb 10 oz batter into each well greased pan.
STEP 6:
Bake 30 minutes or until done.
STEP 7:
Cook; cut 6 by 18.
NOTE:
If convection oven is used, bake at 325° F. 20 minutes on low fan, open vent.
VARIATION:

CONGO BARS: In Step 1,  increase flour to 3 lb (3 qt).  In Step 2, reduce eggs to 2 lb (3-3/4 cups).  Add 1 lb 8 oz (3 cups) salad oil.  In Step 4, reduce nuts to 8 oz (2 cups).  Add 1 lb 8 oz (two, 12 oz pk) semisweet chocolate baking chips or chocolate flavored baking chips to mixture.  In Step 5, spread about 6 lb 11 oz batter into each well greased pan.  Follow Steps 6 through 7.
NOTE:  If convection oven is used, bake at 325° F. 25 minutes on low fan.  Open vent.

Recipe.Name: Bar, raisin nut
Method: STEP 1:

Place ingredients in mixer bowl in order listed (the 1½ cups of eggs (about 8)  need to be slightly beaten before adding).  Beat at low speed 1 to 2 minutes or until thoroughly blended.  Scrape down bowl once during mixing.
STEP 2:

Divide dough into 9 pieces, about 1 lb 9 oz each; form into strips about 22 inches long on lightly greased pans, 3 strips per pan.  Press strips down until each strip is about 4 inches wide and 3/8 inch thick.
STEP 3:
Mix the egg and water together.  Brush top of each strip of dough with egg and water mixture.
STEP 4:
Sprinkle about 2½ tsp sugar over each strip.
STEP 5:
Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until done.
STEP 6:
While still warm, cut each strip into 12 bars, about 1-3/4 inches wide.
NOTE:
In Step 5,  if convection oven is used, bake at 325° F. 10 to 12 minutes or until done on low fan, open vent.
VARIATIONS:

GINGER RAISIN BARS (OATMEAL COOKIE MIX GINGERBREAD CAKE MIX):  Omit all ingredients in Step 1.  Combine 4 lb 8 oz Oatmeal Cookie Mix, 5 lb Gingerbread Cake Mix, 1 lb (2 cups) water and 1 lb 15 oz (1½ qt) raisins.  Mix as directed in Step 1.  In Step 2,  divide dough into 9 pieces, about 1 lb 7 oz each.  Proceed with remainder of Step 2.  Omit Steps 3 through 5.  Bake at 375° F. 25 to 30 minutes or in 325° F. convection oven 16 to 18 minutes or until done on low fan, open vent.  Follow Step 6.

Recipe.Name: Bar, toffee, crisp
Method: STEP 1:
Place butter or margarine in mixer bowl; cream at medium speed 5 minutes.  Add brown sugar and vanilla; continue to beat 5 minutes or until light and fluffy.
STEP 2:
Add flour to mixture.  Mix 1 minute at low speed or until thoroughly blended.  Mixture will be stiff.
STEP 3:
Fold chips and nuts into mixture.
STEP 4:
Spread 5 lb 8 oz mixture into each ungreased pan; press mixture evenly into pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 25 minutes or until lightly browned.
STEP 6:
Cut 6 by 18 while still warm.  When cool, remove from pans.
NOTE:
1 lb 8 oz (two, 12 oz pk) chocolate flavored baking chips may be used for chocolate, cooking, semisweet chips.

Recipe.Name: Batter, frying
Method: STEP 1:
Sift together flour, sugar, salt, dry milk, and baking powder into mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Combine whole eggs (2-1/8 cups is 11 eggs), and salad oil or melted shortening; add to dry ingredients.
STEP 3:
Slowly add water; beat at medium speed until smooth.
NOTE:

1.  Batter may be used for fruits and vegetables such as apples (7-lb A.P.), eggplant (3-lb 11-oz A.P.), and tomatoes (6-lb 10-oz A.P.).  Moist foods should be dredged in flour before dipping into batter.  When ready to fry, dip into batter, drain slightly; fry in 350°F to 375°F. deep fat until lightly browned.
2.  Use batter the day prepared.  DO NOT SAVE.

Recipe.Name: Batter, tempura
Method: STEP 1:
Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt into mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Add ice cold water to beaten eggs (2-1/8 cups is 11 eggs).
STEP 3:
Add egg mixture to dry ingredients; whip at high speed until smooth.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 5½ oz (1½ cups packed) dehydrated egg mix combined with 1-3/4 cups lukewarm water may be used for whole eggs.
2.  Use batter immediately.  DO NOT SAVE.
3.  Fry is small batches.  Tempura-fried foods lose crispness if allowed to stand on steam table.
4.  Batter may be used for Tempura Fried Shrimp and Tempura Fried Onion Rings.

Recipe.Name: Beans, baked, Boston
Method: STEP 1:
Pick over beans (kidney, pinto or white), removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash beans thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Cover with water (approximately 5 1/2 gallons);  bring to a boil; boil 2 minutes; turn off heat.
STEP 3:
Cover; let soak 1 hour.
STEP 4:
Bring beans to a boil; add more water if necessary to keep beans covered.  Simmer 1½ hours or until tender (not mushy).
STEP 5:
Drain beans; reserve liquid and beans.
STEP 6:
Combine salt, mustard flour, brown sugar, vinegar, molasses, reserved liquid and water (to make 1 gal), and bacon.  Add to beans; mix well.
STEP 7:

Pour about 20 lb 2 oz (7½ qt) bean mixture into each lightly greased pan; cover.  Bake 2 hours or until sauce is just below surface of beans.  Remove cover; bake 15 minutes.  Stir.  Bake 15 minutes or until set.
NOTE:
1.  Alternate Method:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Cover beans with cool water; soak overnight; drain.  In Step 4, use 3½ gal cold water.  Follow Steps 5 through 7.

2.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F., 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes (or until sauce is just below surface of beans) on high fan, closed vent.  Uncover, stir; bake additional 15 minutes or until set; on low fan.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  SAVORY BAKED BEANS:  Follow Steps 1 through 5.  In Step 6, use 2½ qt bean liquid and water; add 3 lb 9 oz (1½ qt - 1/2 No.10 cn) catsup and 10½ oz (2 cups) chopped dry onions (12 oz A.P.)  Follow Step 7.

Recipe.Name: Beans, baked, cnd
Method: STEP 1:
Cook bacon.  Drain.  Finely chop.
STEP 2:
Combine onions, beans, catsup, sugar, mustard, and bacon.  Mix well.
STEP 3:
Pour about 7-3/4 qt bean mixture into each pan.
STEP 4:
Bake, uncovered, 1½ to 2 hours or until browned.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 15 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 12 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 3-1/3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 30 lb 15 oz (12-1/3 No.2½ cn) canned white beans with pork in tomato sauce may be used.
4.  In Step 4, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 1½ hours on high fan, open vent.
5.  In Step 5, if microwave-convection oven is used, bake at 375°F. 1 hour with 100% microwave power throughout.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
7.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKED BEANS (KIDNEY BEANS, CANNED):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 27 lb 8 oz (4 No.10 cn) canned kidney beans.  Increase catsup to 1 lb 7 oz (2-1/3 cups); packed brown sugar to 1 lb 12 oz (3-3/4 cups).  Follow Steps 3 and 4.

2.  BAKED BEANS (PINO BEANS, CANNED):  Follow Step 1. In Step 2, use 28 lb (28 No.300 or 303 cn) canned pinto beans.  Increase catsup to 1 lb 7 oz (2-1/3 cups); packed brown sugar to 1 lb 12 oz (3-3/4 cups).  Follow Steps 3 and 4.

Recipe.Name: Beans, baked, Italian
Method: STEP 1:
Pick over beans (kidney, pinto or white), removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash beans thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Cover with cold water (approximately 3-3/4 gallons); bring to a boil; boil 2 minutes; turn off heat.
STEP 3:
Cover; let soak 1 hour.
STEP 4:
Bring beans to a boil; add more water if necessary to keep beans covered.  Simmer 1½ hours or until beans are just tender (not mushy).
STEP 5:
Drain beans; reserve liquid for use in Step 7; beans for use in Step 8.
STEP 6:
Saute' onions and celery in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 10 minutes or until tender.
STEP 7:

Add parsley, thyme, oregano, salt, pepper, garlic, basil, sugar, tomato paste, and liquids (reserved liquid plus water to make 1 gal) to onion mixture; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 8:
Place 1 gal cooked beans in each pan; add 3-3/4 qt sauce; mix carefully.
STEP 9:
Cover, bake 1 hour.
STEP 10:
Sprinkle cheese over beans.
NOTE:
1.  Alternate Method:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Cover beans with cool water; soak overnight.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
2.  In Step 6, 2-3/4 oz (2/3 cup plus 3 tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 6, 1 lb 6 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 4 oz chopped onions; 2 lb 1 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz finely diced celery.
4.  In Step 7, ½ oz (1-2/3 tbsp 5 cloves) minced dry garlic may be used.  Saute' with onions.
5.  In Step 7, ¼ cup dehydrated parsley may be used.
6.  In Step 7, three 36-oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
7.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
8.  In Step 9, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 45 minutes on low fan, open vent.
9.  On No.8 scoop may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  ITALIAN-STYLE BAKED BEANS (KIDNEY OR PINTO BEANS, CANNED):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, use 20 lb 10 oz (3 No.10 cn) canned kidney beans or 20 lb 10 oz (21 No.300 or No.303 cn) canned pinto beans.  Follow Steps 6 through 10.

Recipe.Name: Beans, green, combo
Method: STEP 1:

Prepare frozen vegetables according to "Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables", and fresh vegetables according to "Guidelines for Simmering Fresh Vegetables".  To cook in steam cooker, follow "Guidelines for Steam Cooking Vegetables.
STEP 2:
Drain; reserve liquid for use in Step 3.
STEP 3:
Combine cooked vegetables; toss lightly; place in serving pans.  Combine melted butter or margarine (optional) and 3 cups reserved cooking liquid (or water).  Pour an equal quantity over each pan.
STEP 4:
Garnish as desired.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 11 lb fresh carrots A.P. will yield 9 lb carrots; 4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb celery.
2.  Other combinations of vegetables (frozen, fresh, or canned) may be used; however, color, shape, and texture should be considered.
3.  If desired, vegetable combo may be served with lemon wedges for margarine or butter.  Use 13 fresh lemons (3 lb 4 oz A.P.).  Cut 8 wedges per lemons.
4.  For other seasoning ideas, see Guidelines for Using Herbs.

Recipe.Name: Beans, green, herbed
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions and celery in margarine or butter until tender.
STEP 2:
Add garlic powder, crushed basil, and ground rosemary to sauteed vegetables; mix well.
STEP 3:
Drain green beans, reserving 2 cups liquid (water substituted in food list above).  Add beans and reserved liquid to onion-herb mixture.
STEP 4:
Simmer about 10 minutes or until flavors are blended.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1: 6 lb dry onions A.P. will yield 6 lb chopped onions; 3 lb 12 oz fresh celery will yield 3 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 1, 12 oz (1-7/8 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.

3.  In Step 3, 2 lb 15 oz (3 No.2½ cn) canned dehydrated compressed green beans may be used.  Prepare according to Guidelines for Heating Dehydrated, Compressed Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-5.  Omit margarine or butter.
4.  In Step 3, 24 lb frozen green beans may be used for canned green beans.  Prepare according to Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3.  Proceed with remainder Step 3.

Recipe.Name: Beans, green, parisienne, f/cnd
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions in butter or margarine until tender.
STEP 2:
Blend soup, water and Worcestershire sauce into onion mixture.
STEP 3:
Drain beans; add beans to mixture; mix lightly.
STEP 4:
Place about 6¼ qt mixture in each pan.
STEP 5:
Combine bread crumbs and melted butter or margarine.
STEP 6:
Sprinkle about 1 cup over mixture in each pan.
STEP 7:
Sprinkle 1 cup cheese over crumb mixture in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 20 minutes or until sauce is bubbling and cheese is melted.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 2¼ oz (2/3 cup plus 4½ tsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
2.  In Step 3, 1 lb 4oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 2 oz sliced onions.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
5.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 15 minutes on high fan, open vent.
VARIATION:

1.  GREEN BEANS PARISIENNE (FROZEN GREEN BEANS):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 16 lb frozen green beans.  Cook according to Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3 or Guidleines for Steam Cooking Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-6.  Follow Steps 3 through 8.

Recipe.Name: Beans, green, w/corn, fzn
Method: STEP 1:
Cook chopped bacon until partially done.  Drain fat; set aside ¼ cup bacon fat for use in Step 2; bacon for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions in bacon fat until tender. Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Add beans to 3 quarts water salted with 1 tablespoon salt; bring to a boil; cover; simmer 10 minutes.  Drain; reserve 2½ qt liquid and beans.
STEP 4:
Combine beans, bacon, onions, red pepper, reserved liquid and corn.  Cover; continue cooking 15 minutes.
STEP 5:
Serve with cooking liquid (pot liquor).
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb sliced onions.
2.  In Step 2, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  GREEN BEANS WITH CORN (BEANS, GREEN, CANNED):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 18 lb 15 oz (3 - No.10 cn) canned green beans. Drain beans.  Reserve 2½ qt liquid.  In Step 4, add reserved liquid.  Follow Step 5.

2.  GREEN BEANS WITH CORN (BEANS, GREEN DEHYDRATED, COMPRESSED):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 1 lb 9 oz (1½ - No.2½ cn) canned, dehydrated, compressed green beans.  Prepare according to Guidelines for Heating Dehydrated, Compressed Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-5; omit butter or margarine.  Drain beans.  Reserve 2½ qt liquid.  In Step 4, add reserved liquid.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION: 1/3 Cup (3½ Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Beans, kidney/pinto/white
Method: STEP 1:
Pick over beans, removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash beans thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Cover with 5 gallons cold water; bring to a boil in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; boil 2 minutes; turn off heat.
STEP 3:
Cover; let soak 1 hour.
STEP 4:
Add bacon, salt, and pepper to beans.
STEP 5:
Bring to a boil; add more hot water if necessary to keep beans covered; cover.  Simmer 1½ hours or until beans are just tender.
NOTE:
1.  Alternate Method:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Cover beans with cool water; soak overnight.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
2.  One No.6 scoop may be used.
VARIATIONS:
1.  SAVORY STYLE BEANS:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Omit Step 4.  Add 1 lb 4 oz (3-3/4 cups) dry chopped onions (1 lb
6 oz A.P.)  1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) chopped fresh celery (2 lb 1 oz A.P.); 2 tsp dehydrated garlic; 2 tsp ground cumin; and 2 tsp black pepper.  In Step 5, simmer 2 hours or until beans are tender.
2.  SIMMERED DRY BEANS (WITHOUT BACON):  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, omit bacon.  Follow Step 5.

Recipe.Name: Beans, lyonnaise/green/wax
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions in butter or margarine until tender.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Add beans (green or wax, frozen) to boiling water salted with 1 tablespoon salt.
STEP 3:
Bring to a boil; cover; simmer 5 to 8 minutes or until just tender.  Drain; reserve 1 qt liquid.
STEP 4:
Combine onions, beans, bean liquid, and pepper.  Mix lightly.
NOTE:
1.  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Use 25 lb 4 oz (4 No.10 cn) canned green or wax beans for frozen beans.  Drain; reserve 1 qt liquid for use in Step 4.

2.  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Use 1 lb 15 oz (2 No.2½ cn) canned dehydrated compressed green beans for frozen beans.  Prepare according to Guidelines For Heating Dehydrated, Compressed Vegetables.  Drain beans; reserve 1 qt liquid.  In Step 4, omit pepper; combine reserved liquid with ingredients.
3.  In Step 1, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb sliced onions.
4.  In Step 1, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
VARIATIONS:
1.  GREEN BEANS CREOLE:  Omit Step 1.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  Omit Step 4.  Add  3/4 recipe (1½ gal) Creole sauce to drained beans.
2.  GREEN BEANS WITH MUSHROOMS:  In Step 1, omit onions; drain 3 lb 9 oz (two jumbo or four 8Z cn) canned mushrooms.  Saute' in butter or margarine.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.

3.  GREEN BEANS NICOISE:  In Step 1, add ½ tsp dehydrated garlic to onions.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  In Step 4, drain 6 lb 5 oz (1 No.10 cn) canned tomatoes.  Crush tomatoes; combine with remaining ingredients.  Mix lightly.

4.  GREEN BEANS SOUTHERN STYLE:  Omit Step 1.  In Step 2, omit salt.  Cook 1 lb bacon until crisp; drain, crumble bacon; reserve 4 oz (½ cup) bacon fat.  Add bacon fat to beans and water.  Follow Step 3.  Add reserved bean liquid, crumbled bacon and 3/4 tsp black pepper.  Mix lightly.  Omit Step 4.

Recipe.Name: Beans, refried, w/cheese
Method: STEP 1:
Drain beans.  Reserve beans for use in Step 2; liquid for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Place beans in mixer bowl; beat at low speed until mashed.
STEP 3:

Add chili powder, garlic, 2 lb shredded cheese (Cheddar or American), onions (minced), hot sauce and 1½ qt bean liquid.  Whip at medium speed, adding more bean liquid to obtain consistency of mashed potatoes.
STEP 4:
Spread an equal quantity of bean mixture in greased pans; bake 30 minutes.
STEP 5:
Sprinkle an equal quantity of cheese (Cheddar or American, shredded) over bean mixture in each pan.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, dehydrated garlic may be increased if stronger garlic flavor is desired.
2.  In Step 3, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb minced onions.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  Refried Beans may be used as a dip for corn chips or tortilla chips.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  REFRIED BEANS (CANNED REFRIED BEANS):  Omit Steps 1 through 3.  Use 24 lb 1 oz (3½ No.10 cn) canned Refried Beans.  Follow Step 4.  Omit Step 5.  If desired, mashed bean mixture may be fried on greased 350°F. griddle.
2.  REFRIED BEANS WITH CHEESE (CANNED REFRIED BEANS):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, omit onions and bean stock.  Use 24 lb 1 oz (3½ No.10 cn) canned Refried Beans.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.

Recipe.Name: Beans, Spanish
Method: STEP 1:
Pick over beans, removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash beans thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Cover with 5 gallons cold water; bring to a boil in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; boil 2 minutes; turn off heat.
STEP 3:
Cover; let soak 1 hour.
STEP 4:
Bring beans to a boil.  If necessary, add more water to keep beans covered.  Simmer 30 minutes.
STEP 5:
Add onions, tomatoes, sugar, mustard flour, cloves, and pepper; simmer 1 hour or until beans are just tender.
NOTE:
1.  Alternate Method:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Cover beans with cool water; soak overnight.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.
2.  In Step 1, 8 lb white dry beans may be used.
3.  In Step 5, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 5, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb finely chopped onions.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

Recipe.Name: Beef, chipped, creamed
Method: STEP 1:
Separate thawed dried beef slices; cut in 1-inch strips.
STEP 2:
Place beef in 1 gallon 190°F. water.  Soak 5 minutes.  Drain thoroughly.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.  Heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 4:
Combine softened butter or margarine with flour and pepper (black or white); add to milk, stirring constantly.  Cook 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 5:
Add beef to sauce; blend well.
NOTE:
1.  If beef is salty, soak in 190°F. water 1 hour.  Drain thoroughly.

Recipe.Name: Beef, cordon bleu
Method: STEP 1:
Slice partially thawed beef into ¼-inch thick slices (4 oz per slice).
STEP 2:
Place ½ slice ham and ½ slice cheese on each slice of beef.
STEP 3:
Fold beef slice in half, enclosing ham and cheese.  Pound edges of beef together to seal.
STEP 4:
Dredge beef in potato granules.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with water; combine with beaten eggs (2 lb is 20 eggs).
STEP 6:
Dip beef in milk and egg mixture.  Drain.
STEP 7:
Dredge in mixture of bread crumbs, salt, and pepper; shake off excess.
STEP 8:
Fry in 1 qt shallow fat on griddle 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. (2 cups corn oil was used for analysis purposes)
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, beef, boneless, frozen, top round, will provide the most uniform slice and portion.
2.  In Step 4, 2 lb (2 qt) flour, wheat, general purpose, sifted, may be used for  potatoes, white, instant, granules.
3.  In Step 5, 10 oz (1¼ qt) dehydrated egg mix combined with 1½ qt warm water may be used for whole eggs.

Recipe.Name: Beef, corned
Method: STEP 1:
Place 43.5 lb raw, whole pieces of corned beef in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; cover with water.
STEP 2:
Bring to a boil.  Cover; reduce heat; simmer 2½ hours.  Remove scum as it rises to surface.
STEP 3:
Remove corned beef from liquid.
STEP 4:
Place corned beef in roasting pans.
STEP 5:
Bake 1 hour or until tender.
STEP 6:
Let stand 15 to 20 minutes before slicing.  Slice into 3/16-inch slices.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, meat may be simmered 5 hours or until tender.  Omit Steps 4 and 5.  After 3 hours, test each piece of meat with fork to determine tenderness.
2.  Because the grain of brisket varies within a cut, turn meat while carving to ensure cutting across grain to prevent shredding.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  In Step 5, corned beef may be placed on racks.
VARIATIONS:

1.  APPLE GLAZED CORNED BEEF:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, combine 4-1/3 qt (3 - No.3 cyl cn) canned apple juice, ½ cup soy sauce, 3/4 cups Worcestershire sauce, 2 cups vinegar, 1 oz (5 tbsp) mustard flour, and 1 lb (2-1/8 cups) packed brown sugar; blend well; pour over meat in roasting pans.  In Step 5, base every 15 minutes.  Follow Step 6.

2.  BAKED CORNED BEEF (PRECOOKED FROZEN):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, place 30 lb thawed precooked corned beef on 2 sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Bake 45 to 50 minutes or in 300°F. convection oven 30 to 35 minutes or until meat thermometer registers 140°F. on high fan, closed vent.  Follow Step 6.

Recipe.Name: Beef, cubes, w/bbq sauce
Method: STEP 1:
Prepare 2 recipes Barbecue Sauce, Recipe No. 0-2.  DO NOT COOK.  Add water.  Stir.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Cook diced, thawed beef in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot 15 minutes, uncovered, stirring constantly.
STEP 3:
Cover; cook 15 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add barbecue sauce mixture; cover; simmer 1 hour or until tender.
NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, Barbecue Sauce Mix may be used for Barbecue Sauce, Recipe No. O-2.  Prepare 3¼ gal sauce according to instructions on container or 3¼ gal prepared barbecue sauce may be used for Barbecue Sauce, Recipe No. O-2.
2.  In Step 2, 30 lb beef, pot roast, diced in 1 to 1½ inch pieces may be used.  Trim beef to remove excess fat and gristle.
3.  Two No.10 scoops may be used.
4.  In Step 2, a tilting fry pan may be used.
VARIATION:
1.  BARBECUED BEEF CUBES (CANNED BEEF CHUNKS):

Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Prepare 1-1/3 recipes Barbecue Sauce, Recipe No. O-2.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Simmer 25 minutes.  Use 29 lb (16--29 oz cn) canned beef chunks with natural juices.  Drain beef.  Add to barbecue sauce.  Mix well.  Cook 15 minutes or until beef is heated thoroughly.

Recipe.Name: Beef, ground, cordon bleu
Method: STEP 1:
Combine bread (day old, diced), garlic, and water.  Let stand 10 minutes until water is absorbed.
STEP 2:
Add 22.5 lb ground beef, minced onions, beaten eggs (6½ oz is 4 eggs), salt, and pepper; mix well.  Shape into 200--2½ oz patties.  See Note 3.
STEP 3:

Cut 50 cheese slices in half.  Place 100--½ slices on 100 patties. Place ½ cheese slice on top of ham.  Fold ham around cheese.  See Note 4.  Add remaining ham slices.  Place remaining patties on top; enclose securely by sealing edges together.
STEP 4:
Grill 4 minutes on each side or until done on lightly greased griddle.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz minced onions.
2.  In Step 2, 3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 2, flatten patties no more than 3½ inch diameter to prevent patties from being too thin and difficult to handle.
4.  In Step 3, fold ham and cheese no longer than 3 by 3 inches to fit inside patties and ensure a good seal.
5.  In Step 4, patties may be baked on 4 sheet pans (18x26-inches) in 375°F. oven 30 minutes or in 350°F. convection oven 15 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.

Recipe.Name: Beef, ground, creamed
Method: STEP 1:

Cook 18 lb thawed beef in its own fat in steam-jacketed kettle or roasting pan until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain or skim off excess fat.  Add onions (optional); saute 3 minutes.
STEP 2:
Combine flour, Soup and Gravy base, salt and pepper.  Sprinkle evenly over beef and onions.  Mix thoroughly; cook about 5 minutes until flour is absorbed.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute milk with warm water.  Add to mixture.
STEP 4:
Add Worcestershire sauce.  Heat to a simmer, stirring frequently.  Cook until thickened.
NOTE:

1.  Alternate method of preparation:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, combine flour, Soup and Gravy base, beef, salt, pepper and water; cook 5 minutes.  In Step 3, use cold water to reconstitute dry milk; gradually blend into flour mixture; cook until thickened.  Add browned beef to sauce.  Heat to serving temperature.
2.  In Step 1, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb diced onions.
3.  In Step 1, 2 oz (9-2/3 tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  For ½ cup portion (4 ounces), use:  13 lb 8 oz beef pattie mix, bulk or ground beef, 12 oz (2¼ cups) dry onions, (13-1/3
oz A.P.), 1 lb 2 oz (4½ cups) flour, 1-3/4 oz (4-2/3 tbsp) Soup and Gravy base, beef, 1½ oz (2-1/3 tbsp) salt, 2¼ tsp black pepper, 1 lb 12 oz (6½ cups) nonfat dry milk and 2 gal water.

Recipe.Name: Beef, ground, hamburger, w/parmesan
Method: STEP 1:
Prepare 1 recipe Pizza Sauce, Recipe No.O-12.  Set aside for use in Step 8.
STEP 2:
Dredge 100 - 3 oz beef patties in flour; shake off excess.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.  Stir to blend well.
STEP 4:
Dip patties in milk and egg mixture.  Drain well.
STEP 5:
Combine crumbs and Parmesan cheese.  Dredge patties in crumb-cheese mixture; shake off excess.
STEP 6:
Fry 2½ minutes or until evenly browned.  Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
STEP 7:
Place 20 patties on each pan.  Top each pattie with 1 slice Mozzarella cheese.
STEP 8:
Pour about 2 tbsp (1 Size-0 ladle) sauce over each pattie in each pan.
STEP 9:
Bake 7 minutes or until cheese is melted and patties are cooked.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, omit all ingredients.  Use 6 lb 9 oz (1--No.10 cn) canned Pizza Sauce.  Heat to a simmer.
2.  In Step 1, omit all ingredients.  Combine 1 lb 10 oz (1-2/3 -

No.2½ cn) tomato sauce basic mix, 3 tbsp crushed oregano, 3 tbsp crushed sweet basil, 1-1/3 tsp ground thyme, 1 tbsp garlic powder, 1 tbsp black pepper with 6½ cups cold water; stir until smooth.  Add tomato mixture to 2½ qt boiling water, stirring constantly.  Cook at medium heat until sauce comes to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 1 minute or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
3.  In Step 7, if cheese is too long or wide, fold in half to evenly fit patties.
4.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 4 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and patties are cooked, on high fan, closed vent.

Recipe.Name: Beef, liver, breaded, fried
Method: STEP 1:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; add beaten eggs (1½ lb is 15 eggs),
STEP 2:
Dip sliced liver in milk and egg mixture.  Drain.
STEP 3:
Dredge liver in mixture of flour, salt and pepper; shake off excess.
STEP 4:
Brown slices on well-greased griddle about 5 minutes per side.
(Using approximately 1-1/2 qt corn oil). ( 33.3 Tbsp corn oil used for analysis).
STEP 5:
Serve immediately.
VARIATION:
1.  BREADED LIVER WITH ONIONS AND MUSHROOM GRAVY:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, serve with 1 recipe Onion and Mushroom Gravy (Recipe No. O-16-9).
EACH PORTION: 1 Slice (4½ Ounces) plus ¼ Cup (2 Ounces) Gravy.

Recipe.Name: Beef, pepper steak
Method: STEP 1:
Cut steaks (Braising Steak, Swiss) into ½ inch strips; brown strips 5 minutes on lightly greased griddle turning frequently.
STEP 2:
Place 9 lb (2 gal) strips in each pan.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Combine water, tomato paste, soy sauce, sugar, pepper, and garlic powder.  Blend well.  Bring to a boil.
STEP 4:
Dissolve cornstarch in cold water; stir until smooth; add to sauce mixture.  Cook until thickened, about 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
STEP 5:
Pour 3 qt sauce over beef strips in each pan.  Cover; bake 1½ hours.
STEP 6:
Add 4 lb (4-3/4 qt) peppers and 1lb 5 oz (1 qt) onions to each pan.  Stir to distribute vegetables.  Cover; bake 30 minutes or until beef is tender.
NOTE:
1. In Step 3, 2 lb 4 oz (1--36 oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
2.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 1 hour 30 minutes on high fan, closed vent; in Step 7, bake 20 minutes or until tender on high fan, closed vent.
3.  In Step 6, 9 lb 12 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 8 lb pepper strips; 3 lb dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb 11 oz chopped onions.
4.  In Step 6, 5 oz (1-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions and 1 lb 4 oz (3 qt) dehydrated green peppers or 8 lb frozen diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
5.  In Step 6, 2-3/4 oz (½ cup - 24 cloves) minced dry garlic may be used.  Add to sauce.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATION:
1.  ORIENTAL STEAK:  Follow Steps 1 through 5.  In Step 6, add 6 lb 6 oz (1--No.10 cn) drained bean sprouts.  Follow remainder Step 6.

Recipe.Name: Beef, pot roast
Method: STEP 1:
Place thawed roasts in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; brown on all sides; add boiling water.
STEP 2:

Add salt, pepper, sliced onions and garlic.  Cover.  Simmer 3½ to 4½ hours or until tender.  Remove scum as it rises to the surface during cooking.  Remove cooked beef.  Skim off excess fat from stock.  Reserve stock (1-1/4 gallons) for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Let stand 20 minutes; slice 1/8 inch thick.
STEP 4:
Combine flour and cold water, stirring until smooth; add to stock, stirring constantly.  Cook 10 minutes or until slightly thickened.
STEP 5:
Serve with sliced meat.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 42 lb 6 oz frozen beef pot roast A.P. will yield 40 lb thawed beef.
2.  In Step 2, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb sliced onions.
3.  In Step 2, 6 oz (1-7/8 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 2, test for doneness;  a fork inserted into roasts will withdraw easily if meat is cooked and tender.  Test each roast separately.
VARIATIONS:

1.  GINGER POT ROAST:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) chopped onions (1 lb 11 oz A.P.); add 6 lb 6 oz (1--No.10 cn) canned diced tomatoes, ½ oz (2-2/3 tbsp) ground ginger, 1/20 oz (1 tsp) ground thyme, and 1/48 oz (4 leaves) bay leaves.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, use 16 lb (2 gal) reserved stock.  Remove bay leaves before serving.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION: 2 to 3 slices (3½ ounces) plus 1/3 cup (2½ ounces) gravy.

2.  YANKEE POT ROAST:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, add 2 lb (1-3/4 qt) diced fresh carrots (2 lb 7 oz A.P.), 2 oz (1 cup) chopped fresh parsley (2 oz A.P.), 6 lb 6 oz (1--No.10 cn) canned diced tomatoes, 1/5 oz (1tbsp) ground allspice, 1/48 oz (4) bay leaves, 1/40 oz (½ tsp) ground thyme, and 8 oz (1 cup) vinegar.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, use 16 lb (2 gal) reserved stock.  Remove bay leaves before serving.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION:  2 to 3 slices (3½ ounces) plus 1/3 cup (2½ ounces) gravy.

Recipe.Name: Beef, rib pot roast
Method: STEP 1:
Rub each roast with pepper (thaw if frozen).
STEP 2:
Place roasts in roasting pan.  DO NOT ADD WATER.  DO NOT COVER.  Insert meat thermometer in center of roasts.  DO NOT touch bone with thermometer.
STEP 3:
Roast 4 to 4½ hours or until roast reaches desired degree of doneness.
STEP 4:
Let roast stand about 20 minutes before slicing.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, racks may be used.
2.  Remove roasts from oven when meat thermometer registers 140°F.- rare; 160°F.- medium; and 170°F.- well done.
3.  Internal temperatures will rise about 10°F. after standing 20 minutes and before slicing.
4.  75 lb beef rib may be used.  EACH PORTION:  6 Ounces.
5.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, roast at 300°F. 3 to 3½ hours or until roast reaches desired degree of doneness on low fan, closed vent.
VARIATIONS:
1.  STEAMSHIP ROUND OF BEEF (BEEF, ROUND, BONE -

IN):  In Step 1, use 75 lb bone-in rounds.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, roast about 8 hours.  Follow Step 4.  EACH PORTION:  6 Ounces.  (NOTE:  50 lb bone-in rounds may be used.  EACH PORTION:  4 Ounces).
2.  STEAMSHIP ROUND OF BEEF (BEEF, ROUND BONELESS):  In Step 1, use 65 lb boneless rounds.  Follow  Step 2.  In Step 3, roast about 8 hours.  Follow Step 4.  EACH
PORTION:  6 Ounces.  (NOTE:  40 lb boneless rounds may be used.  EACH PORTION:  4 Ounces).

3.  ROAST RIB OF BEEF (BEEF, BONELESS, RIBEYE ROLL):  In Step 1, use 65 lb boneless ribeye rolls.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, roast about 2 to 3 hours.  Follow Step 4.  EACH PORTION:  6 Ounces.  (NOTE:  40 lb boneless ribeye rolls may be used.  EACH PORTION:  4 Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Beef, roast
Method: STEP 1:
Place thawed roasts fat side up in pans without crowding.  Sprinkle with pepper.  See Note 1.
STEP 2:
Insert meat thermometer into center of thickest part of main muscle.  DO NOT ADD WATER.  DO NOT COVER.
STEP 3:
Roast 2 to 3 hours, depending on size of roasts (see Note 1), to desired degree of doneness.
STEP 4:
Let stand 20 minutes before slicing.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, arrange roasts in pans by size.  Select one roast in each pan to estimate cooking time.  In Step 4, allow about 20 minutes per pound for medium; about 18 minutes per pound for rare.
2.  In Step 1, roasts may be placed on racks.

3.  In Step 1, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 5 half sheet pans (13x18-inches) with racks.  Place 1 roast on each rack.  Roast at 325°F. 30 minutes with 50% microwave power.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, roast 1 hour without microwave power.  Note 1:  Allow 16 minutes per pound for medium; 14 minutes per pound for rare.  Note 2:  If roasts are frozen, roast at 325°F. 2 hours with 50% microwave power for first 45 minutes.  Allow 22 minutes per pound for medium; 19 minutes per pound for rare.  EACH PORTION:  2 Slices (3½ Ounces).
4.  Frozen roasts will require 1 hour or longer cooking time.
5.  Remove roasts from oven when meat thermometer registers 140°F. - rare; 160°F. - medium; and 170°F. - well done.  Internal temperature will rise about 10°F. during 20 minute standing period.
6.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, roast at 325°F. about 1 hour 45 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
VARIATION:
1.  ROAST BEEF (PRECOOKED):  Omit all ingredients.  Use 26 lb precooked roast beef.  Thaw beef.  EACH PORTION: 4 Ounces.

Recipe.Name: Beef, simmered
Method: STEP 1:
Place thawed roasts in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; brown on all sides; add boiling water to cover.
STEP 2:
Add chopped carrots, chopped celery, chopped onions,  4 bay leaves,  20 whole cloves (optional), salt and pepper.
STEP 3:
Simmer 2½ to 3 hours or until tender.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Remove scum as it rises to surface during cooking.  Remove cooked beef.  Remove bay leaves and cloves.
STEP 4:
Let stand 20 minutes before slicing.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2:  2 lb 7 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped carrots.  2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped celery.  3 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 8 oz (2-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, test for doneness: a fork inserted into roast will withdraw easily if meat is cooked and tender.  Test each roast separately.
4.  DO NOT BOIL meat; boiling toughens meat.  Serve with catsup, horseradish, or mustard.  Broth may be used for soup or gravy.  See Brown Gravy, Recipe No. O-16.
5.  In Step 1, a tilting fry pan may be used.

Recipe.Name: Beef, steak, country
Method: STEP 1:
Dredge steaks in mixture of flour, salt and pepper; shake off excess.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute milk; add slightly beaten eggs (1½ lb is 15 eggs); blend thoroughly.
STEP 3:
Combine bread crumbs, salt and pepper.
STEP 4:
Dip steaks in egg and milk mixture; then in seasoned bread crumbs.
STEP 5:
Brown steaks 1½ minutes on each side using 1 qt salad oil on well-greased griddle.
STEP 6:
Overlap steaks in lightly greased pans.  Cover pans tightly.
STEP 7:
Bake 2 hours or until steaks are tender.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 7½ oz (1-7/8 cups) canned dehydrated egg mix combined with 2¼ cups warm water may be used for whole eggs.
2.  In Step 4, to avoid overwetting crumbs, dredge in small amounts.
3.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 1 hour 30 minutes or until tender on high fan, closed vent.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

Recipe.Name: Beef, steak, grilled
Method: STEP 1:
Preheat grill; lightly grease with shortening.  Grill tempered steaks to desired degree of doneness:
Beef, Top Sirloin, butt, boneless, tempered: (375°F.)
Rare............6 minutes
Medium.......7½ minutes
Well done...9½ minutes
Beef, Ribeye roll, boneless, tempered: (400°F.)
Rare...........3½ minutes
Medium.......4 minutes
Well done...5 minutes
Beef, Strip Loin, boneless, tempered: (400°F.)
Rare...........5 minutes
Medium......6 minutes
Well done..7 minutes
NOTES:
1.  See Recipe No. A-2 for tempering guidelines.
2.  When grilling tempered steaks, use only half of grill space to permit heat recovery.
3.  A broiler may be used instead of a grill.  Follow manufacturers' directions for cooking.
4.  DO NOT hold steaks in ovens, warming cabinets, or on grills after cooking. This will cause steaks to dry out and be tough.
5.  Only approximate times are given.  Slight variations in thickness and grill temperature variations affect timing.

6.  Steaks may be prepared in oven.  Use 1 lb (2 cups) salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil.  Brush both sides of tempered steaks with oil.  Arrange in rows 3 by 5 on rack (19-1/4x13-1/4x1-3/8-inches).  Place racks on sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Cook in 450° to 500°F. oven to desired degree of doneness (see chart below).  DO NOT TURN STEAKS.  If convection oven is used, omit brushing with oil or shortening.  Cook in 400°F. oven to desired degree of doneness.
OVEN TEMPERATURE CHART:
Beef, Top Sirloin, butt, boneless, tempered:
Conventional Oven: (450° to 500°F.)
Rare.............20 minutes
Medium........22 minutes
Well done....24 minutes
Convection Oven:  (400°F)
Rare............14 minutes
Medium.......16 minutes
Well done...17 minutes
Beef, Ribeye roll, boneless, tempered:
Conventional Oven:  (450° to 500°F.)
Rare............16 minutes
Medium.......18 minutes
Well done....20 minutes
Convection Oven (400°F.)
Rare............ 12 minutes
Medium....... 14 minutes
Well done... 16 minutes
Beef, Strip Loin, boneless, tempered:
Convectional Oven: (450° to 500°F.)
Rare............ 18 minutes
Medium....... 20 minutes
Well done....23 minutes
Convection Oven (400°F.)
Rare........... 14 minutes
Medium...... 15 minutes
Well done... 16 minutes
VARATION:

1.  GRILLED TENDERLOIN STEAKS:  In Step 1, use 44 lb thawed beef tenderloin.  Trim excess fat to ¼-inch; slice tenderloins into 6 oz steaks, about 3/4-inch thick.  Grill on 400°F. griddle 3 to 6 minutes for rare, 4 to 7 minutes for medium, and 5 to 9 minutes for well done.  NOTE:  The narrow tail section may be butterflied or flattened to produce steaks of more uniform thickness.  Cooking time varies due to size and variations of tenderlions.

Recipe.Name: Beef, steak, ranchero
Method: STEP 1:
Dredge steaks in mixture of flour, salt, chili powder, paprika and garlic; shake off excess.
STEP 2:
Brown steaks in shallow fat.
STEP 3:
Overlap 50 steaks in each pan.
STEP 4:
Combine onions and peppers; spread 2¼ qt onion-pepper mixture over steaks in each pan.
STEP 5:
Stir Soup and Gravy base into boiling water.
STEP 6:
Add tomato soup, chili powder, garlic and cumin.  Mix thoroughly.
STEP 7:
Pour 6½ cups sauce equally over steaks in each pan.
STEP 8:
Cover pans.  Bake 2 to 2½ hours or until steaks are tender.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 4, 3 lb 11 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped peppers; 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 4, 8 oz (6 cups) dehydrated green peppers or 3 lb (2¼ qt) frozen, diced green peppers, and 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One Size -1 ladle may be used to serve sauce.

Recipe.Name: Beef, steak, teriyaki
Method: STEP 1:
Arrange 25 steaks in each roasting pan.
STEP 2:

Combine pineapple juice, soy sauce, water, ginger, garlic, and pepper.  Pour 2¼ qt sauce over steaks in each pan.  Cover; marinate under refrigeration 3 hours, turning steaks after 1½ hours.  Drain.  Bring marinade to a boil; reserve for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Preheat griddle; grease well with shortening or salad oil.  Grill steaks on each side to desired degree of doneness turning frequently.  See Grilled Steak, Recipe No.L-7.
STEP 4:
Serve immediately with ¼ cup sauce.
NOTE:
1.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
2.  Grill temperature should be 375°F.  Higher temperatures will cause scorching.
3. Steaks should be turned frequently to prevent scorching because of sugar content of marinade.

Recipe.Name: Beets, Harvard
Method: STEP 1:
Drain beets; reserve 4-1/8 qt liquid for use in Step 2; beets for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Add cloves to liquid (reserved liquid + water to make 4-1/8 qt); bring to a boil.
STEP 3:
Dissolve cornstarch in cold water; add to boiling liquid.
STEP 4:
Cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly until thick and clear.
STEP 5:
Add sugar, salt, vinegar, and butter or margarine (optional) to thickened mixture; stir until blended.
STEP 6:
Add drained beets to sauce; heat to a boil.
VARIATION:

1.  BEETS IN ORANGE-LEMON SAUCE:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, omit vinegar.  Use 6 oz (3/4 cup) lemon juice (1 lb 2 oz - 4½ lemons A.P.), 2/3 oz (3 tbsp) grated lemon rind and 1 lb 11 oz (3 cups) orange juice (3 lb 12 oz - 7½ oranges A.P.) or use 10 oz (1/3 - 32-oz cn) frozen orange juice combined with 1 lb (2 cups) water or 1 lb 9 oz (½ No.3 cyl cn) canned orange juice.  Follow Step 6.

Recipe.Name: Beets, spiced, hot
Method: STEP 1:
Drain beets; reserve 4-1/2 qt liquid for use in Step 2, beets for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Add reserved liquid and water (to make 4½ qt), vinegar, cinnamon, cloves, salt, pepper, and sugars; mix well.
STEP 3:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add beets and butter or margarine (optional); heat to serving temperature.
NOTE:  Beets may be served cold.  In Step 4, omit margarine or butter; DO NOT heat.  Serve well chilled.

Recipe.Name: Bread, banana
Method: STEP 1:
Cream shortening and sugar in mixer bowl at medium speed until light and fluffy.
STEP 2:
Add whole eggs (3½ cups is 19 eggs); continue beating at medium speed 1 minute.
STEP 3:
Add ripe, mashed bananas and unsalted, coarsely chopped nuts to egg mixture.  Mix until blended.
STEP 4:
Sift together flour, baking powder and salt.
STEP 5:
Add dry ingredients to banana mixtute; beat at low speed about ½ minute.
STEP 6:
Pour about 4-lb 12-oz (2 qt) batter into each well-greased pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 80 to 85 minutes or until done.
STEP 8:
Cool thoroughly before slicing (See Note 4).
STEP 9:
Cut 25 slices (5/8-inch thick) per loaf.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 9½ oz (2-1/3 cups) canned dehydrated egg mix combined with 2-7/8 cups water may be used.
2.  In Step 3, 12-lb 5-oz fresh bananas A.P. (37 bananas) will yield 8 lb peeled, mashed bananas.
3.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. about 70 to 75 minutes or until done on low fan, open vent.
4.  For best results, wrap in waxed paper and store overnight before slicing.

Recipe.Name: Bread, corn
Method: STEP 1:
Blend flour, cornmeal, dry milk, sugar, baking powder, and salt in mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Combine whole eggs (2.875 cups is 15 eggs) and water; add to ingredients in mixer bowl.  Blend at low speed about 1 minute.  Scrape down bowl.
STEP 3:
Add shortening; mix at medium speed until blended.
STEP 4:
Pour about 10 lb (1 gal) batter into each well greased pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 20 to 25 minutes.
STEP 6:
Cool; cut 6 by 9.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, omit sugar if southern-sytle corn bread is desired.
2.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 375°F. 20 minutes or until done on low fan, open vent.
VARIATIONS:

1.  CORN MUFFINS:  In Step 1, use 2-lb 10-oz (2-5/8 qt) sifted general purpose flour, 3-lb 6-oz (2¼ qt or 2¼ 24-oz pg) cornmeal, 9 oz (1-7/8 cups) nonfat dry milk, 6 oz (3/4 cup) granulated sugar, 4 oz (9 tbsp) baking powder, 1-1/8 oz (1½ tbsp) salt, 1-lb 3¼-oz (2¼ cups) or 12 whole eggs, 5-lb 12-oz (2-7/8 qt) water, and 1-lb 2-oz (2¼) melted shortening or salad oil.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  In step 4, grease nine 12-cup muffin pans.  Fill each cup 2/3 full (1 No.16 scoop).  In Step 5, bake 15 to 20 minutes or in 375°F. convection oven 15 minutes or until done on low fan, open vent.  Omit Stet 6.  EACH PORTION: 1 Muffin.
