Saute onions and peppers in melted shortening or salad oil or olive oil until tender.
STEP 6:
Combine sauteed vegetables, chopped meat, drained bean sprouts, and pepper; mix well.
STEP 7:
Add beaten eggs (11¼ cups is 60 eggs) to meat mixture; blend well.
STEP 8:
Place 1/3 cup mixture on well-greased griddle; cook about 3 minutes on each side or until well done.
STEP 9:
Pour 2 tbsp (1 Size 0 ladle) sauce over each omelet just before serving.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 5, 1 lb 6 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 4 oz finely chopped onions, and  10 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz finely chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 5, 2½ oz (2/3 cup plus 3 tbsp) dehydrated onions and 1½ oz (1¼ cups) dehydrated green peppers or 8 oz frozen, diced, green peppers may be use.  Thaw peppers.
3.  In Step 6, 7 lb (7 No.303 cn) canned drained bean sprouts may be used.
4.  In Step 6, beef, chicken, ham, pork, or veal may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, beef, minced
Method: STEP 1:
Cook 20 lb thawed beef with onions in its own fat until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Sprinkle flour over beef; contine cooking until flour is absorbed.
STEP 3:
Add tomatoes, 2 tablespoons mace or nutmeg (optional), salt and pepper.  Stir well.  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One No.6 scoop may be used.
4.  In Step 3, Minced Beef may be served over toast, biscuits, rice or pasta.

Recipe.Name: Dish, beef, rolls, stuffed
Method: STEP 1:
Slice partially thawed beef into 4 oz slices (¼ inch thick).  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 2:
Saute celery and onions in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until tender.
STEP 3:
Add celery and onions to cubed bread; toss lightly.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with boiling water.  Add poultry seasoning and pepper.  Add to bread mixture; mix lightly but thoroughly.  DO NOT OVERMIX.
STEP 5:
Place ¼ cup (1--No.16 scoop) stuffing in the center of each beef slice; roll tightly around stuffing.
STEP 6:
Dredge beef rolls in flour; grill on well-greased griddle 3 to 5 minutes or until browned on all sides.  Place 25 beef rolls in each pan.
STEP 7:
Prepare 1¼ recipes Brown Gravy (Recipe No. O-16).
STEP 8:
Pour about 1-3/4 qt gravy over beef rolls in each pan.
STEP 9:
Cover.  Bake 1½ hours or until tender.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, beef, boneless, frozen, top round will provide the most uniform slice and portion.
2.  In Step 2, 3 lb 7 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb 8 oz chopped celery; 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery.
3.  In Step 2, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 7, 1¼ recipes Brown Gravy (Recipe No. O-16) may be used.
5.  In Step 9, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 45 minutes or until tender on high fan, closed vent.
VARIATION:

1.  BEEF BROGUL:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, chop 3 lb 9 oz (1 qt--2 jumbo cn) canned, drained muchrooms; saute with celery and onions.  In Step 3, add 1 lb 8 oz (1½ qt) grated Parmesan cheese.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, place 1/3 cup (1--No.12 scoop) stuffing in center of each beef slice.  In Step 6, place 25 beef rolls in each pan.  In Step 7, omit gravy.  Combine 4 lb (4--No.2½ cn) basic tomato sauce mix and 2-2/3 tbsp crushed oregano, 1-2.3 tbsp crushed sweet basil and 1 tbsp ground thyme.  Add 3 qt cold water; mix until smooth.  Add to 1¼ gal boiling water, stirring constantly.  Cook at medium heat until sauce comes to a boil.  Simmer 1 minute, stirring as necessary.  In Step 8, pour about 2¼ qt tomato sauce over beef rolls in each pan.  Follow Step 9.  EACH PORTION:  1 Beef Roll (7 Ounces) plus ¼ Cup Sauce (2 Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Dish, beef, sukiyaki
Method: STEP 1:
Slice partially thawed beef into 1/8 inch thick slices.  Cut slices into strips 2 inches long and ½ inch wide.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 2:
Combine soy sauce, sugar, pepper and mushrooms. Set aside for use in Step 8.
STEP 3:
Add salad oil or melted shortening to steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 4:
Add celery (cut diagonally 1/8-inch thick) to hot salad oil or shortening; saute 1½ minutes, stirring constantly.
STEP 5:
Add beef strips; stir-fry 1½ minutes.
STEP 6:
Add onions (sliced thinly lengthwise); stir-fry 1½ minutes.
STEP 7:
Add green peppers (julienne, ¼ inch); stir-fry 1 minute.
STEP 8:
Add mushroom sauce mixture, green onions (cut in 1½ inch lengths) and bean sprouts (drained); stir-fry 30 seconds.  Remove from heat.
STEP 9:
Serve immediately.
NOTE:
1.  Prepare recipe in 50-portion batches.
2.  In Step 2, 2-8Z cn canned mushrooms may be used.
3.  In Step 3, a 350°F. tilting fry pan may be used.
4.  In Step 4, 11 lb fresh celery A.P. will yield 8 lb celery.
5.  In Step 6, 5 lb 9 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 5 lb onions.
6.  In Step 6, 10 oz (3-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
7.  In Step 7, 3 lb 11 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 3 lb peppers.
8.  In Step 7, 8 oz (1½ qt) dehydrated green peppers or 3 lb frozen diced green peppers may be used.
9.  In Step 8, 6 lb fresh green onions A.P. will yield 5 lb green onions.
10.  In Step 8, 7-No.300 cn canned bean sprouts may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, broccoli, polonaise
Method: STEP 1:

Add frozen broccoli to boiling salted (1-2/3 tablespoons) water; return to a boil; cook, UNCOVERED, 3 minutes.  Cover, reduce heat; cook 7 to 9 minutes or until just tender.  Drain; place an equal quantity in each pan.
STEP 2:
Brown crumbs in butter or melted margarine.  Sprinkle 1 cup crumbs over broccoli in each pan.
STEP 3:
Garnish with hard cooked chopped eggs (1 lb 8 oz is 9 eggs).
NOTE:  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  BRUSSELS SPROUTS POLONAISE:  In Step 1, add 20 lb frozen Brussels sprouts to salted water; return to a boil; cook, UNCOVERED, 7 to 9 minutes.  Cover; reduce heat; cook 3 minutes or until tender.  Drain.  Place an equal quantity of mixture in each of 2 pans.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  EACH PORTION: 1/2 Cup (4-6 Brussels sprouts).

2.  CAULIFLOWER POLONAISE:  In Step 1, add 20 lb frozen cauliflower to salted water; return to a boil.  Cover; reduce heat; allow cauliflower to simmer 4 minutes to until tender.  Drain.  Place an equal quantity in 2 pans.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  EACH PORTION: 1/2 Cup (3-4 Flowers or 3 Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Dish, broccoli, w/cheese & rice
Method: STEP 1:
Combine rice, 4-1/2 qt water, salt, salad oil, and onions in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; bring to a boil.  Stir occasionally.
STEP 2:
Cover tightly; reduce heat; simmer 20 to 25 minutes.  DO NOT STIR.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with 1 gal warm water.
STEP 4:
Blend in garlic, oregano, pepper and soup.  Combine with rice mixture, stirring well.  Bring to a boil stirring constantly.
STEP 5:
Add broccoli; bring to a boil, stirring constantly; simmer 5 minutes or until broccoli is almost tender.
STEP 6:
Reduce heat; add cheese, stirring constantly until cheese is melted.
STEP 7:
Pour 11 lb 10 oz (5¼ qt) mixture into each pan.
STEP 8:
Combine melted butter or margarine and bread crumbs.  Mix well.  Sprinkle 4½ oz (1½ cups) crumbs evenly over each pan.
STEP 9:
Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and crumbs are lightly browned.  DO NOT OVERBAKE.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 2 lb 13 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb 8 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 9, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 15 to 20 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and crumbs are lightly browned on high fan, closed vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, cabbage, Chinese, fried
Method: STEP 1:
Rehydrate onions and peppers 20 to 30 minutes; drain well.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions, peppers and chopped bacon together until bacon starts to brown, about 10 minutes.
STEP 3:
Add cabbage; mix lightly.  Cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
STEP 4:
Drain bean sprouts and pimientos; add to cabbage.
STEP 5:
Sprinkle pepper and garlic over cabbage; fold over several times to blend.
STEP 6:
Heat to steaming.  Place in oven.
STEP 7:
Pour whole beaten eggs (1 lb is 10 eggs) onto a greased sheet pan (18x26-inches); bake 6 to 8 minutes or until firm.
STEP 8:
Cut eggs into thin strips, 3 inches long; spread over cabbage.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 12 oz (2¼ cups) chopped dry onions (13 oz A.P.) and 12 oz (2¼ cups) chopped, fresh sweet peppers (14 oz A.P.) or 12 oz frozen, diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
2.  In Step 3, 20 lb fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 16 lb shredded cabbage.
3.  In Step 4, seven No.300 cn canned beans sprouts may be used.
4.  In Step 4, four 7-oz cn canned pimientos may be used.
5.  In Step 7, 5-oz (¼ No.3 cyl cn) canned, dehydrated egg mix combined with 1½ cups warm water may be used for whole eggs.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
7.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, carrots, amandine, w/celery
Method: STEP 1:

Add carrots (cut in ½-inch diagonal slices) and celery (cut in 3/4-inch diagonal slices) to3-3/8 gallons boiling salted (2-1/3 tablespoons) water.  Return to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Drain; reserve carrots and celery for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Spread almonds on pan in a thin layer.  Heat 12 to 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until almonds are lightly browned. Remove from oven.
STEP 4:
Add almonds, lemon juice and melted margarine to carrot and celery.  Toss or stir lightly.  Mix thoroughly.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 13 lb 1 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 10 lb 11 oz (2½ gal) carrot cut in diagonal slices; 10 lb 8 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 7 lb 10 oz (2 gal) celery cut in diagonal slices.
2.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, toast at 300°F. 12 to 15 minutes on high fan, open vent.
3.  In Step 4, 14 oz (4 lemons) fresh lemons A.P. will yield 3/4 cup lemon juice.
4.  In Step 4, 3 tbsp frozen lemon juice concentrate and 9 tbsp cold water may be used for juice.
5.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, carrots, lyonnaise
Method: STEP 1:
Add carrots (cut in 1/2 by 2-inch strips) to 2-1/4 gallons boiling water with 1 tablespoon salt.
STEP 2:
Bring to a boil; cook 10 minutes.
STEP 3:
Drain; reserve carrots for use in Step 6.
STEP 4:
Add pepper to melted butter or margarine in steam-jacketed kettle or tilting fry pan.
STEP 5:
Add onions (cut in half lengthwise, sliced thinly); saute' until tender, about 10 minutes.
STEP 6:
Add sugar, salt and reserved carrots to sauteed onions; mix lightly; cook 5 minutes, tossing occasionally.
STEP 7:
Garnish with parsley before serving.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 22 lb fresh carrots A.P. will yield 18 lb carrots cut in 1/2 inch by 2 inch strips.
2.  In Step 2, 26 lb (26 No.303 cn) or 26 lb 4 oz (Four No.10 cn) canned carrots may be used.  Omit Steps 1 and 2.
3.  In Step 1, 18 lb fresh, sliced, ready-to-use carrots or 18 lb frozen, sliced carrots may be used.
4.  In Step 5, 8 oz (2-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
5.  In Step 5, 4 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 lb thinly sliced onions.
6.  EACH PORTION:  1/2 Cup (8 to 9 Strips) (3 Ounces).
VARIATION:

1.  GLAZED CARROTS:  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  Omit Steps 4 and 5.  Melt 8 oz (1 cup) butter or margarine in steam-jacketed kettle or tilting fry pan; add 1/2 oz (3 tbsp) ground ginger (optional); stir until well blended.  Add 1 lb 3 oz (2-3/4 cups) granulated sugar; stir (mixture will resemble a thick roux).  In Step 6, toss lightly until well coated; cook 5 minutes, tossing occasionally.  Omit Step 7.

Recipe.Name: Dish, carrots, w/orange amandine
Method: STEP 1:
Add carrot strips, 1/2 x 2 inch, to 2 gallons boiling water with 2 teaspoons salt.  Return to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes.
STEP 2:
Drain; set aside carrots for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Add brown sugar, orange rind, orange juice, and almonds to melted margarine or butter.  Blend well.
STEP 4:
Add glaze to carrots; mix until carrots are well coated.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 20 lb fresh carrots A.P. will yield 16 lb carrots cut in 1/2 by 2 inch strips.
2.  In Step 3, 12 oz (2 oranges) fresh oranges A.P. will yield 1/3 cup juice and 3 tbsp rind.

Recipe.Name: Dish, catfish, Caribbean
Method: STEP 1:
Saute green peppers and onions in butter or margarine, 10 minutes or until onions are transparent.
STEP 2:
Combine onion mixture with bread cubes, lime juice, cilantro,
garlic powder, red pepper and oregano; mix well.
STEP 3:
Place 1¼ oz (1 - No.30 scoop) filling in center of each catfish fillet, skin side up.  Roll up and place, seam side down in staggered rows, 4 by 5, in steam table pans.
STEP 4:
Combine melted butter or margarine with lime juice.  Add garlic powder and red pepper.  Brush evenly over fish in each pan.  Sprinkle 1 tbsp grated lime rind over fish in each pan if desired.
STEP 5:
Bake 35 minutes or until done (150°F.).
NOTES:
1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers; 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 13 fresh limes (1 lb 12 oz) will yield 13 oz (1½ cups) lime juice.
3.  In Step 2, 2 cups fresh chopped cilantro may be used, (5-1/3 oz fresh cilantro will yield 2 cups chopped cilantro).
4.  In Step 4, 13 fresh limes (1 lb 12 oz) will yield 13 oz (1½ cups) lime juice.
5.  In Step 5, if a convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 25 to 30 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.
6.  In Step 5, fish is done when it flakes easily with a fork or when it reaches an internal temperature of 150°F.
7.  In Step 5, baking time will vary with thickness of fish.
VARITATION:

1.  CARIBBEAN FLOUNDER:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 30 lb (100) flounder fillets.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  In Step 6, bake 25 to 30 minutes or in a 350°F. convection oven 17-19 minutes or until done (150°F.) on high fan, closed vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chicken & rice, baked
Method: STEP 1:
Wash chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Place chicken in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; add 9 gallons water, 9 tablespoons salt and  1 tablespoon dehydrated garlic.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 2 hours or until tender.
STEP 3:
Remove chicken.  Strain; reserve stock for use in Step 7.
STEP 4:
Remove chicken from bones; cut chicken into 1 inch pieces. Set aside for use in Step 10.
STEP 5:
Combine rice, salt and 7-1/2 quarts water.  Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.  Cover tightly; reduce heat; simmer 20 to 25 minutes.  DO NOT STIR.  Set aside for use in Step 10.
STEP 6:
Blend salad oil or melted shortening and flour together; mix until smooth.
STEP 7:
Gradually add salad oil or shortening and flour mixture to stock, stirring constantly; heat to boiling point.  Boil 2 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent sticking.
STEP 8:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.
STEP 9:
Add miilk and pepper to stock mixture, stirring constantly.  Cook until smooth and thickened.
STEP 10:
Combine chicken and rice.  Place about 2 gal chicken-rice mixtrue into each greased pan.
STEP 11:
Pour about 2 gal sauce over chicken-rice mixture in each pan. Mix well.
STEP 12:
Combine crumbs and butter or margarine, melted.  Sprinkle crumbs over chicken and rice in each pan.
STEP 13:
Bake 45 minutes or until browned.
NOTE:
1.  In Steps 3 and 4, refrigerate stock and chicken if not used immediately.
2.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
3.  Two--No. 8 scoops may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKED CHICKEN AND RICE (CHICKEN, CANNED):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Use 18 lb 2 oz (10--29 oz cn) canned chicken: drain; cut chicken into 1 inch pieces.  Follow Steps 5 and 6.  In Step 7, use 8 oz (1¼ cups) Soup and Gravy base, chicken and 2 gal water for stock.  Follow Step 8.  Follow Step 9; add 1 tbsp dehydrated garlic.  Follow Steps 10 through 13.

2.  BAKED CHICKEN AND RICE (CHICKEN, DEHYDRATED, COOKED, DICED):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Use 4 lb 8 oz (3-3/5--No.10 cn) canned, dehydrated cooked chicken.  Bring 3¼ gal water to a boil.  Remove fron heat, add 12 oz (1½ cups) canned Soup and Gravy base, chicken and chicken.  Stir; cover; let stand 20 minutes or until chicken has rehydrated.  Follow Steps 5 and 6.  Drain chicken; reserve stock.  Follow Steps 7 and 8.  Follow Step 9; add 1 tbsp dehydrated garlic.  Follow Steps 10 through 13.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chicken, a la king
Method: STEP 1:
Wash thawed chickens thoroughly, inside and out, under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Place chicken in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; add 6 gallons water, salt and 9 bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 1 hour or until done (180°F.).
STEP 3:
Remove chicken; strain stock; reserve stock for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Remove bones and skin; cut chicken into 1 inch pieces.  Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk; add to reserved stock or 3-3/4 quarts water; mix thoroughly.  Heat to a simmer in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 6:
Blend salad oil, or melted shortening and flour together to form a roux; using a wire whip, stir until smooth.
STEP 7:
Gradually add milk and stock mixture to roux, stirring constantly.  Simmer 10 minutes or until thickened.  Stir as necessary.
STEP 8:
Add pepper, onions, and celery; bring to a boil, stirring constantly.  Cool until tender.
STEP 9:
Add chicken, peppers, and pimientos to sauce; heat to serving temperature.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 50 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 8, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; 6 lb 14 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 5 lb chopped celery.
3.  In Step 8, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 9, 1 lb 4 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped peppers.
5.  In Step 9, 2½ oz (1½ cups) dehydrated green peppers or 1 lb frozen, diced, green peppes may be used.  Thaw peppers.
6.  In Step 9, 2 - 7 oz cn canned pimientos may be used.
7.  On Size 3 ladle may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  CHICKEN A LA KING (CHICKEN, CANNED):      Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Use 18 lb 2 oz (10 - 29 oz cn) canned chicken; drain; dice into 1 inch pieces.  In Step 5, use 12 oz (1-7/8 cups) Soup and Gravy base, chicken and 3 gal water for stock.  Follow Steps 6 through 9.
2.  TURKEY A LA KING (TURKEY, BONELESS, FROZEN, RAW):  Omit Step 1.  In Step 2 use 26 lb turkey, boneless, frozen, raw; simmer 3 to 4 hours or until tender.  Follow Steps 3 through 9.
3.  TURKEY A LA KING (TURKEY, READY-TO-COOK, FROZEN):  In Step 1, use 45 lb turkey, RTC.  In Step 2, simmer 3 to 4 hours or until tender.  Follow Steps 3 through 9.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chicken, adobo
Method: STEP 1:
Wash thawed, cut up chicken thoroughly under cold running water; drain well.  Place equal quantity of chicken in each pan.
STEP 2:
Combine soy sauce, vinegar, water, garlic, pepper, ginger and 8 bay leaves.  Mix well.  Pour about 1-2/3 qt marinade evenly over chicken in each pan.  Marinate 45 minutes, turning occasionally.
STEP 3:
Add an equal quantity of onions and peppers to marinated chicken.  Bake 45 minutes or until done (180°F.).  Remove bay leaves.
STEP 4:
Remove chicken and vegetables from pans; place in steam table pans.  Mix cornstarch and water; add to sauce.  Simmer 10 minutes while stirring until sauce becomes clear.  Pour evenly over chicken.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eighths) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered, may be used.
2.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 1-1/3 tbsp (4 cloves) garlic, dry, minced, may be used.
4.  In Step 3, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb onions, sliced; 4 lb 14 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 4 lb peppers, sliced.
5.  One Size 1 ladle may be used to serve sauce.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chicken, cacciatore
Method: STEP 1:

Combine tomatoes, tomato paste, onions, sweet peppers, water, 6 bay leaves, sugar, salt, garlic, basil, oregano, thyme and pepper in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; cover.  Simmer 1 hour.  Remove bay leaves.  Keep hot for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Wash thawed, cut-up chicken thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.  Place chicken, skin side up, on sheet pans.
STEP 3:
Bake 70 minutes or until done (180°F.); remove from pans; place chicken, skin side up, in roasting pans.
STEP 4:
Pour 13 lb 6 oz (6¼ qt) sauce over chicken in each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 35 minutes or until thoroughly heated (165°F.).
STEP 6:
Serve with ½ cup sauce.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 8 oz (2-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions and 7 oz (5¼ cups) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb 11 oz (2 qt) frozen, diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 4 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 lb ¼-inch sliced onions and 3 lb 4 oz fresh sweet peppers will yield 2 lb 11 oz ¼-inch pepper strips.
3.  In Step 1, if convection oven is used, increase water to

1½ gal; in Step 3, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes or until done (180°F.) on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 4, pour 15 lb 14 oz (7½ qt) sauce over chicken in each pan.  In Step 5, bake at 350°F. 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated (165°F.) on high fan, closed vent.
4.  In Step 2, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut in quarters or eighths) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chicken, chow mein
Method: STEP 1:
Wash thawed chicken thoroughly, inside and out, under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.
STEP 2:
Place chicken in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot; cover with 6 gallonswater; add salt and 9 bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 1 hour or until done (180°F.).
STEP 3:
Remove chicken; strain stock; reserve stock (1-1/2 gallons prepared chicken stock used for nutritional analysis) for use in Step 6.
STEP 4:
Remove bones and skin; cut chicken into 1 inch pieces.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Saute sliced onions, celery and coarsely cut cabbage in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 5 minutes.
STEP 6:
Add chicken and sauteed vegetables to stock; cover; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 7:
Drain bean sprouts; set sprouts aside for use in Step 10 and liquid for use in Step 8.
STEP 8:
Combine reserved liquid with cornstarch to make a smooth paste; add ginger, pepper, soy sauce and molasses (optional).
STEP 9:
Add liquid mixture slowly to hot meat mixture, stirring constantly.  Cook 5 to 8 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 10:
Add bean sprouts; mix well; bring to a simmer.
STEP 11:
Serve chow mein over 1/3 cup noodles.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 50 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 5: 13 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. wil yield 12 lb sliced onions; 11 lb fresh celery A.P. will yield 8 lb celery pieces; 7 lb 8 oz fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 6 lb cabbage, coarsely cut.
3.  In Step 5, 1 lb 8 oz (7-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 7, 7 - No.303 cn, canned bean sprouts may be used.
5.  Two No.8 scoops may be used.
6.  Chicken Chow Mein may be served over Steamed Rice (Recipe No.E-5).  Omit Step 11.
VARIATION:

1.  CHICKEN CHOW MEIN (CHICKEN, CANNED):  Omit Steps 1 through 4.  Follow Step 5.  In Step 6, use 6 oz (7/8 cup) Soup and Gravy base, chicken, combined with 1½ gal water for chicken stock.  See Recipe No.A-12.  Add sauteed vegetables to stock.  Use 18 lb 2 oz (10 - 29 oz cn) canned chicken; drain; dice into 1 inch pieces; add to vegetables and stock.  Cover; simmer 10 minutes.  Follow Steps 7 through 11.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chicken, fiesta
Method: STEP 1:
Cut chicken breasts into ½-inch by 2-inch strips.  Keep refrigerated for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Saute green peppers and onions in oil 3 minutes in steam jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 3:

Add water, tomatoes, tomato paste, orange juice concentrate, pimientos, sugar, salt, chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, oregano, red pepper, and black pepper.  Bring to a boil, reduce heat; cover; simmer 20 to 25 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add chicken.  Return to a boil.  Reduce heat; cover; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 5:
Blend flour and water to make a smooth paste.  Add to chicken mixture.  Stir well.  Simmer 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 6:
Serve over 1 recipe Tossed Green Rice (Recipe No.E-5-2).
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb diced peppers.
2.  In Step 2, 5 lb 15 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 5 lb 5 oz chopped onions.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chicken, tetrazzini
Method: STEP 1:
Stir broken spaghetti into 3 gallons boiling water with 1-2/3 tablespoons salt.  Cook about 15 minutes stirring frequently.  Drain; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Saute onions and peppers in melted butter or margarine until tender.
STEP 3:
Add flour to sauteed vegetables.  Stir until well mixed.
STEP 4:
Combine boiling water with soup and gravy base.  Add to sauteed vegetable mixture; stirring constantly.  Cook 10 minutes or until smooth and thickened.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; add gradually to vegetable-sauce mixture, stirring constantly.  Bring to a simmer.
STEP 6:
Add spaghetti, chicken, mushrooms, pimientos, nutmeg and black pepper to vegetable-sauce mixture.  Combine thoroughly.
STEP 7:
Pour about 13 lb 12 oz (1½ gal) mixture into each pan.  Sprinkle 4 oz (1 cup) parmesan cheese over mixture in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 30 minutes or until lightly brown.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 1 oz (1/3 cup) dehydrated onions; 1¼ oz (1 cup) dehydrated green peppers or 8 oz (1½ cups) frozen, diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
2.  In Step 2, 9 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped onions; 10 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz
chopped peppers.
3.  In Step 2, 6 lb drained (12 - 8 oz cn) canned mushrooms may be used.
4.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 15 minutes or until lightly browned on high fan, open vent.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATION:
1.  TUNA TETRAZZINI:       Follow Steps 1 through 5.  In Step 6, use 12 lb 8 oz (3 - 66.5 oz cn) drained canned turna.
In Step 6, omit nutmeg.  In Step 7, use 13 lb 4 oz (1½ gal) mixture per pan.  Follow Step 8.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chicken, vega
Method: STEP 1:
Wash cut-up, thawed chicken pieces thoroughly under cold running water.  Drain well.  Remove excess fat.  Place chicken, skin side up, on sheet pans.
STEP 2:
Bake at 400°F. 70 minutes; remove from pans.  Keep hot for use in Step 8.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water; heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 4:
Add Soup and Gravy base and onion soup to milk; stir.
STEP 5:
Blend flour and cold water together; mix until smooth.
STEP 6:
Add flour mixture gradually to seasoned milk mixture; simmer 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly.  Keep hot for use in Step 9.
STEP 7:
Place 1 lb (2-1/3 cups) uncooked rice in each steam table pan.  Pour 2 lb 6 oz (4-3/4 cups) water over rice in each pan; stir well.
STEP 8:
Place 5 lb 6 oz (about 20-25 pieces) of prebaked chicken over rice in each pan.
STEP 9:
Pour 2 lb 11 oz (1¼ qt) sauce evenly over chicken in each pan.
STEP 10:
Cover; bake 40 minutes or until rice is tender.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, whole (cut into quarters or eights) or 82 lb chicken, broiler-fryer, quartered may be used.
2.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 40 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 10, bake 35 minutes or until rice is tender on high fan, closed vent.
3.  Two No.10 scoops may be used to serve rice.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chili & macaroni, f/cnd chili
Method: STEP 1:
Add macaroni slowly to 5-1/4 gallons boiling salted (2-2/3 tbsp) water; bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.  Boil 10 to 15 minutes.
STEP 2:
Drain; set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Saute onions in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 10 minutes or until tender.
STEP 4:
Heat chili to boiling.  Reduce heat; skim off excess fat.
STEP 5:
Add macaroni, sauteed onions, tomatoes, 2 qt water, salt, pepper, chili powder (optional) and cumin (optional); mix thoroughly.
STEP 6:
Pour 2¼ gal chili mixture into each pan.
STEP 7:
Sprinkle 1 qt cheese over mixture in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 45 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned and mixture is thoroughly heated.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 8 lb 14 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 3, 1 lb (5-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 20 to 30 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned and mixture is thoroughly heated on high fan, closed vent.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chili, conquistador
Method: STEP 1:
Cook 24 lb thawed beef with onions in its own fat until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Add chili powder, red pepper, salt, garlic and tomatoes to meat mixture; stir until blended; heat to simmer.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Add rice, salt, and salad oil or melted shortening to water.  Bring to a boil; stir occasionally.
STEP 4:
Cover; simmer 25 minutes.
STEP 5:
Combine rice with chili mixture; mix well.  Place 1¼ gal mixture in each pan.
STEP 6:
Prepare Corn Bread Mix according to instructions on container.
STEP 7:
Spread about 1-3/4 qt corn bread batter over chili mixture in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 45 minutes or until done.
STEP 9:
Cut 5 x 5.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb dry
chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 1 oz (3 tbsp - 9 cloves) minced dry garlic may be used.  Fry with beef and onions in Step 1.
4.  In Step 6, 3/4 recipe Corn Bread (Recipe No. D-14) may be used.  Spread about 1½ qt mixture in each pan.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
6.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 375°F. 30 minutes on high fan, open vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chilies rellenos
Method: STEP 1:
Put Chilies Rellenos (Cheese, frozen) in basket in single layer (See Note 1).
STEP 2:
Fry 5 minutes or until golden brown.
STEP 3:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
NOTE:
1.  Fry in single layers to prevent overcooking.
2.  DO NOT overcook as the filling will burst through sides.
3.  In Step 2, if beef or refried beans Chilies Rellenos are used, fry 7 minutes.  If chicken and cheese Chilies Rellenos are used, fry 6 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Dish, chop suey, pork
Method: STEP 1:
Brown diced pork in its own fat in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:
Sprinkle pork with pepper and ginger.
STEP 3:
Add water, soy sauce, and molasses; bring to a boil; cover; simmer 1 hour or until tender.
STEP 4:
Add sliced onions, ½-inch diagonal sliced celery, quartered cabbage to pork mixture; mix well; cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 5:
Combine cornstarch and water.  Stir slowly into hot mixture, stirring constantly.  Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 6:
Add drained bean sprouts; mix well; bring to a simmer.
STEP 7:
Serve with 1/3 cup chow mein noodles.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 35 lb pork butt A.P. diced in 1 to 1½ inch pieces may be used.  Trim to remove excess fat and gristle.
2.  In Step 5, 13 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 12 lb sliced onions; 10 lb 15 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 8 lb celery; 5 lb A.P. fresh cabbage will yield 4 lb cabbage.
3.  In Step 5, 1 lb 8 oz (2 qt) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 7, pork or shrimp suey may be served over steamed rice.  Follow Recipe Nos. E-5 or E-15.
VARIATION:

1.  SHRIMP CHOP SUEY:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 10 lb raw, peeled, deveined shrimp.  Cook according to directions in Step 1, Creole Shrimp (Recipe No. L-136).  Drain.  Set aside for use in Step 7.  In Step 3, combine water, molasses, 3½ cups soy sauce, 4 oz (10 tbsp) Chicken Soup and Gravy base, 1 tbsp black pepper and 3/4 tsp ground ginger.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, use 1 lb (3½ cups) cornstarch.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.  EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Dish, egg roll, w/meat, Chinese
Method: 1.  Place 50 frozen egg rolls on each pan.
2.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until browned.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 350° F., 20 to 25 minutes, on high fan, closed vent.
2.  Chinese and Philippine style egg rolls may be served with Sweet Sour Sauce (Recipe No. 0-8) and Chinese Mustand Sauce (Recipe No. 0-22).
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.  See Recipe No. A-25.
VARIATIONS:

1.  FRIED CHINESE EGG ROLLS:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Fry frozen Chinese egg rolls in 350° F., deep fat 7 minutes or until golden brown and heated through.  DO NO OVERCOOK.  (Note: egg rolls will rise to the surface when cooked.)  Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
2.  PHILIPPINE STYLE EGG ROLLS:  In Step 1, use 12 lb

8 oz (100) frozen Philippine style egg rolls.  In Step 2, bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and heated through or in 350° F. convection oven 10 to 15 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  EACH PORTION: 1 Egg Roll (2 Ounces).

3.  FRIED PHILIPPINE STYLE EGG ROLLS:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Fry 12 lb 8 oz (100) frozen Philippine egg rolls in 350° F. deep fat 4 to 5 minutes or until golden brown and heated through.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  EACH PORTION: 1 Egg Roll (2 Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Dish, eggplant, parmesan
Method: STEP 1:
Set Pizza Sauce aside for use in Step 8.
STEP 2:
Sprinkle eggplant with salt.  Let stand 30 minutes; drain.
STEP 3:
Dredge eggplant in flour; shake off excess.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with 2-3/4 cups warm water; combine with beaten eggs (1 lb is 10 eggs).
STEP 5:
Dip eggplant in milk and egg mixtrue; drain well.
STEP 6:
Dredge eggplant in crumbs; shake off excess.
STEP 7:
Fry 3 minutes or until golden brown. (2 cups frying shortening was used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 8:
Place 1 layer eggplant in each pan.  Pour 3 cups sauce evenly over eggplant.
STEP 9:
Add 2nd layer eggplant; cover with remaining sauce (3 cups per pan).
STEP 10:
Sprinkle Parmesan Cheese evenly over sauce in each pan.
STEP 11:
Sprinkle Mozzarella Cheese evenly over sauce in each pan.
STEP 12:
Bake 20 minutes or until cheese is melted.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 2¼ gal Spaghetti Sauce may be used.
2.  In Steps 10 and 11, 3 lb 2 oz canned pizza blend cheese may be used for all cheese.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.  EACH PORTION:  2 to 3 Slices (6½ Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Dish, enchiladas, beef
Method: STEP 1:
Prepare 1½ recipes Chili Gravy, Recipe No.O-16-3 (2¼ gal.).  Set aside for use in Steps 3, 4, and 7.
STEP 2:
Cook 18 lb  beef with onions in its own fat until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 3:
Add 2 qt gravy, chili powder, red pepper, salt, and garlic to beef.  Blend well; simmer slowly about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 4:
Spread 2 cups gravy in each pan.
STEP 5:
Dip each tortilla in deep fat until soft and pliable, about 3 seconds.  Drain well. (2 cups cottonseed oil used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 6:
Place 3 level tbsp meat filling in center of each tortilla.  Roll tortilla tightly around filling; place seam-side down in pan (50 per pan).
STEP 7:
Pour 1¼ qt gravy evenly over enchiladas in each pan.
STEP 8:
Bake 25 minutes or until thoroughly heated.  Remove from oven.
STEP 9:
Sprinkle 1 qt cheese and 1½ cups onions over enchiladas in each pan.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 2 tbsp (6 cloves) dry minced garlic may be used. Cook with onions.
4.  In Step 5, 11½ - 11 oz cn canned tortillas may be used.
5.  In Step 9, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  ENCHILADAS (FROZEN ENCHILADAS):  In Step 1, 50 lb (200) frozen cheese or beef enchiladas with sauce may be used.  Omit Steps 1 through 8.  In Step 9, sprinkle an equal quantity of cheese and onions over enchiladas in each pan.  Follow directions on container for heating.  EACH PORTION: 2 Enchiladas.

Recipe.Name: Dish, enchiladas, chicken
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions and garlic in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until tender.
STEP 2:

Combine onions, garlic, chicken, 6¼ qt enchilada sauce, chili powder and red pepper.  Blend well.  Set remaining enchilada sauce aside for use in Steps 3 and 6.  Set chicken mixture aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Spread 3/4 cup enchilada sauce in each pan.
STEP 4:
Dip each tortilla (200 each) in deep fat until soft and pliable, about 3 seconds.  Drain well.
STEP 5:
Place 1/3 cup (1 No.12 scoop) chicken filling in center of each tortilla.  Roll tortilla tightly around filling; place seam-side down in pan (50 per pan).
STEP 6:
Pour 3 qt enchilada sauce evenly over enchiladas in each pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 25 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
STEP 8:
Sprinkle 1¼ qt cheese over enchiladas in each pan.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 5 lb 10 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 5 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 10 oz (3-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 1, 3½ oz (10 tbsp) garlic, dry, minced may be used.
4.  In Step 4, 11½ - 11 oz cn canned tortillas may be used.

5.  In Step 5, 10 - 12x20x2½-inch steam table pans may be used.  In Step 3, spread 1/3 cup enchilada sauce in each pan.  Place 20 enchiladas in each pan.  In Step 6, pour 4-3/4 cups enchilada sauce over enchiladas in each pan.  In Step 8, sprinkle 2 cups cheese over enchiladas in each pan.
6.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 25 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
7.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, fajitas, beef
Method: STEP 1:
Refrigerate Salsa for use in Step 9.
STEP 2:
Cut beef into ¼ inch thin slices; cut slices into ¼ inch strips, 2 to 3 inches long.
STEP 3:
Pour lemon juice over beef.
STEP 4:
Combine salt, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, cumin and red pepper; sprinkle over beef; mix thoroughly; cover; marinate in refrigerator 1 hour.
STEP 5:
Layer stacks of 4 to 5 totillas in 1 - 12x20x2½-inch steam table pan.  Cover tightly; steam at 5 lb PSI 8 to 10 minutes or until hot and pliable.  Cover; keep warm for use in Step 8.
STEP 6:

Saute onions and pepper (cut in ¼ inch strips, 2 to 3 inches long) in salad oil, olive oil or melted shortening in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot about 8 to 10 minutes or until onions are almost transparent.  Keep hot for use in Step 8.
STEP 7:
Brown beef strips, turning frequently, 1 to 2 minutes on lightly greased griddle.  See Note 7.
STEP 8:
Place 3 to 6 beef strips (about 1 oz) and ½ oz (1½ tbsp) onions and sweet peppers on each tortilla.  Roll up.
STEP 9:
Serve with 1 oz (2 tbsp) salsa.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1 recipe Taco Sauce, Recipe No. O-7 may be use for Salsa.
2.  In Step 1, 1 recipe Salsa, Recipe No.O-7-2 may be used.
3.  In Step 1, 8 lb 6 oz (3½ qt) Picante Sauce may be used.
4.  In Step 2, 1 lb 8 oz fresh lemons (6 lemons A.P.) will yield 1 cup lemon juice.
5.  In Step 6, 5 lb 9 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 5 lb onion strips; 6 lb 1 oz sweet peppers A.P. will yield 5 lb sweet pepper strips.
6.  In Step 8, fajitas may be secured with a toothpick.
7.  In Step 7, brown beef strips in batches of no more than 25 portions.
8.  In Step 9, salsa may be placed on serving line for self service.
9.  In Step 9, fajitas may be served with guacamole.  Prepare 1 recipe Guacamole (Recipe No. M-52);  EACH PORTION:
2 Tbsp (1 Ounce).
VARIATIONS:

1.  CHICKEN FAJITAS:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 18 lb 12 oz (100--3 oz) precooked unbreaded chicken fillets.  Cut into 2 to 3 inch chicken strips 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick.  In Step 3, use 10 oz (1¼ cups) lemon juice (2 lb - 8 lemons A.P.).  In Step 4, use 2-1/3 oz (3-2/3 tbsp) salt, 2 oz (6-1/3 tbsp) garlic powder, 7/8 oz (3-2/3 tbsp) onion powder, 2/3 oz (2-2/3 tbsp) black pepper, 1/2 ox (1-1/3 tbsp) ground cumin and 1/6 oz (2½ tsp) ground red pepper.  Follow Steps 5 and 6.  In Step 7, brown chicken strips 2 to 3 minutes or until thoroughly heated. In Step 8, use 5 to 6 strips.  Follow Step 9.

2.  TURKEY FAJITAS:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 18 lb boneless turkey roll, tempered.  Remove netting and skin.  Cut into ¼ inch thin slices; cut slices into ¼ inch strips, 2 to 3 inches long.  Follow Steps 3 through 6.  In Step 7, brown strips 2 to 3 minutes or until turkey loses its pink color, turning frequently on a lightly greased griddle.  In Step 8 use ¼ cup trukey strips (about 1-1/3 oz) per tortilla.  Follow Step 9.

Recipe.Name: Dish, fish, stuffed, baked
Method: STEP 1:
Saute celery and onions in melted butter or margarine until tender.
STEP 2:
Combine cracker crumbs, pepper, and thyme; add to vegetables.
STEP 3:
Add water to vegetable-crumb mixture; toss mixture but DO NOT pack.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Separate thawed fillets; cut into 2¼ oz pieces.  Place 50 pieces on each greased pan.
STEP 5:
Place ¼ cup (1 No.16 scoop) vegetable-crumb mixture on each piece.  Cover with second fish piece.
STEP 6:
Combine lemon juice and melted butter or margarine; pour over fish in each pan.
STEP 7:
Sprinkle salt and paprika over fish.
STEP 8:
Bake about 25 minutes or until lightly browned.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery; 1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 6, 1 lb fresh lemons A.P. (4 lemons) will yield 3/4 cup juice.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, frankfurters, w/sauerkraut, bkd
Method: STEP 1:
Heat sauerkraut to a simmer.  Drain excess liquid.
STEP 2:
Place 3 qt sauerkraut in each pan.  Arrange 50 frankfurters on top of sauerkraut in each pan.
STEP 3:
Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until frankfurters reach an internal temperature of 170°F.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 20 to 25 minutes or until frankfurters reach an internal temperature of 170°F. on low fan, open vent.
2.  Sauerkraut and frankfurters may be layered.  Place 1½ qt sauerkraut in each pan; arrange frankfurters on top; cover with remaining sauerkraut.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  BAKED KNOCKWURST WITH SAUERKRAUT:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 20 lb (100 each) knockwurst.  Arrange 25 knockwurst to top of sauerkraut in each pan.  Follow Step 3.  EACH PORTION:  1 Knockwurst and ½ cup sauerkraut.

Recipe.Name: Dish, frittata, potatoes
Method: STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare vegetables as directed on Recipe No.A-31.
STEP 2:

Add ½-inch diced potatoes to 2 gallons boiling water salted with 1-1/2 tablespoons salt, bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 8 minutes or until tender.  Drain, well.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Add broccoli to 2-1/2 gallons boiling water salted with 2-1/3 teaspoons salt.  Return to a boil; reduce heat.  Simmer 5 minutes until just tender; cool.
STEP 4:
Combine potatoes, broccoli, tomatoes, onions, and Parmesan cheese.  Toss lightly.  Place 8 lb 6 oz (1½ gal) mixture in each well-greased pan.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with 3½ qt warm water.
STEP 6:
Combine milk, thawed eggs, parsley, salt, pepper (white or black), garlic, paprika and basil.  Mix well.
STEP 7:
Pour 4 lb 4 oz (2 qt) egg mixture over potato mixture in each pan.  Stir to distribute evenly.
STEP 8:
Bake 1 hour 50 minutes or until eggs are set.  Cut 3 by 5.
NOTES:
1.  In Step 2, 19 lb 11 oz white potatoes A.P. will yield `6 lb diced potatoes.
2.  In Step 3, 27 lb 1 oz fresh broccoli A.P. will yield 16 lb 8 oz fresh, chopped broccoli.  In Step 3, 16 lb 8 oz frozen chopped
broccoli may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 19 lb 8 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 19 lb
1 oz diced tomatoes; 6 lb 11 oz oniona A.P. will yield  6 lb chopped onions.
4.  In Step 4, 12 oz (3-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
5.  In Step 4, 30 lb 5 oz (4-3/4 - No.10 cn) drained, canned diced tomatoes may be used.
6.  In Step 6, 21 lb 7 oz (2½ gal - 215 eggs) whole eggs may be used or 2½ gal reduced cholesterol eggs.
7.  In Step 6, 5¼ oz fresh parsley A.P. will yield 5 oz chopped parsley.
8.  In Step 6, ½ oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated parsley may be used.
9.  In Step 8, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 45 to 50 minutes or until set, low fan, closed vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, frittata, rice
Method: STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare vegetables as directed on Recipe No. A-31.
STEP 2:
Combine rice, 1-1/4 gallons water, salt and salad oil.  Bring to a boil.  Stir occasionally.  Cover tightly; simmer 20 to 25 minutes.
STEP 3:
Combine diced tomatoes, cheese, mushrooms, peppers, onions, and rice.  Mix well.  Place 8 lb (5¼ qt) in each well greased pan.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.
STEP 5:
Combine milk, thawed egg whites, thawed eggs, pepper (white or black), and salt.  Mix well.
STEP 6:
Pour 3 lb 6 oz (1½ qt egg mixture over rice mixture in each pan.  Stir to distribute evenly.
STEP 7:
Bake 1 hour 40 minutes or until eggs are set.  Cut 3 by 5.
NOTES:
1.  In Step 3, 15 lb 12 oz tomatoes A.P. will yield 15 lb 7 oz diced tomatoes; 6 lb 2 oz green peppers A.P. will yield 5 lb diced green peppers; 5 lb 9 oz onions A.P. will yield 5 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 3, shredded American or Monterey Jack cheese may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 11 lb low fat or reduced fat chedder cheese may be used.
4.  In Step 3, 10 oz (3 cups) dehydrated onions and 10 oz (7½ cups) dehydrated green peppers, or 5 lb (3-3/4 qt) frozen diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
5.  In Step 3, 25 lb 6 oz (4 - No.10 cn) canned diced tomatoes may be used.  Drain thoroughly.
6.  In Step 5, 17 lb 2 oz (2 gal - 172 eggs) whole eggs may be used or 2 gal reduced cholesterol eggs.
7.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 45 minutes or until completely set on low fan, closed vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, goulash, Hungarian
Method: STEP 1:
Brown thawed, diced beef well in hot salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil.
STEP 2:
Add finely chopped onions and garlic; saute until tender.
STEP 3:
Add paprika, thyme, pepper and Soup and Gravy base.  Continue to cook 5 minutes stirring frequently.  Place an equal quantity of mixture in each pan.
STEP 4:
Slowly add 1 gal hot water to each pan, stirring constantly.  Bake 1½ to 2 hours or until beef is tender.
STEP 5:

Mix flour and 2 qt cold water, forming a paste.  Pour an equal quantity paste slowly over beef mixture in each pan, stirring constantly until all flour is absorbed.  Simmer 5 to 10 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 6:

Add 1/4 cup salt and 1/4 cup salad oil to 8 to 12 gallons boiling water.  Slowly add noodles, while stirring constantly until water boils again.  Cook about 15 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Drain thoroughly.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1. 30 lb beef, pot roast, diced in1 to 1½ inch pieces may be used.  Trim beef to remove excess fat and gristle.
2.  In Step 1, veal or pork, diced, can be used for ½ beef.
3.  In Step 2, 6 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 6 lb finely chopped onions.
4.  In Step 2, 12 oz (1 qt) dehydrated chopped onions may be used.
5.  In Step 2, 2 tbsp (6 cloves) dry minced garlic may be used. Fry with onions.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
7.  Goulash may be served over Steamed Rice (Recipe No. E-5.

Recipe.Name: Dish, green peppers, stuffed
Method: STEP 1:
Prepare Tomato Sauce (Recipe No. O-15).  Set aside for use in Steps 5 and 8.
STEP 2:
Wash 50 peppers.  Cut each pepper in half lengthwise; remove core.
STEP 3:
Place peppers is boiling water to cover.  Return to a boil; cook 1 minute.  Drain well.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 4:
Prepare rice according to Recipe No. E-5 or E-6.
STEP 5:
Combine cooked rice, 24 lb thawed ground beef, onions, salt, pepper, Worcestershire sauce and water with 2 qt tomato sauce.  DO NOT OVERMIX.
STEP 6:
Fill each pepper with 3/4 cup beef mixture.  Place filled peppers in roasting pans.
STEP 7:
Pour 1 cup water around peppers in each pan.
STEP 8:
Pour remaining sauce over peppers in each pan.  Cover pans.
STEP 9:
Bake about 1½ hours or until tender.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, Sauce Mix, Tomato, Basic may be used.  Prepare 6½ qt according to directions on container.
2.  In Step 2, if peppers are small, use 100; core and use whole peppers.
3.  In Step 2, 21 lb fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 17 lb 4 oz fresh sweet peppers, cored and cut in half lengthwise.
4.  In Step 4, 3 lb (1-3/4 qt) uncooked long grain rice may be used.  In Step 6, fill each pepper with 2/3 cup beef mixture; increase cooking time to 2 hours.
5.  In Step 5, 3 lb 1 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 12 oz chopped onions.
6.  In Step 5, 5¼ oz (1-2/3 cups plus 4½ tsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
7.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  STUFFED GREEN PEPPERS (FROZEN STUFFED PEPPERS):  In Step 1, 50 lb frozen stuffed peppers may be used.  Omit Steps 2 through 9.  Follow directions on container for cooking.  EACH PORTION:  1 Pepper with Sauce (8 Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Dish, ham & noodles, scalloped
Method: STEP 1:
Drain ham chucks; reserve 1½ qt liquid for use in Step 3.  Cut ham into bite-sized pieces; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Add noodles slowly to 4 gal water.  Bring to a boil; stirring occasionally.  Boil 15 minutes.  Drain; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with 1½ gal warm water; add reserved stock (1-1/2 qt); heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 4:
Blend butter or melted margarine and flour together until smooth.  Add to hot milk, stirring constantly.  Simmer 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 5:
Add onions and peppers to sauce.
STEP 6:
Arrange layers of noodles, ham and sauce in each pan.
STEP 7:
Combine butter or melted margarine, bread crumbs, and paprika.
STEP 8:
Sprinkle crumb mixture over each pan.
STEP 9:
Bake 30 minutes or until top is browned and mixture is thoroughly heated.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 5, 1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions; 1 lb 4 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 5, 3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions; 2½ oz (1-7/8 cups) dehydrated green peppers or 1 lb (3 cups) frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
VARIATION;
1.  SCALLOPED HAM AND MACARONI:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit noodles; use 6 lb (1½ gal) macaroni.  Follow Steps 3 thr

Recipe.Name: Dish, ham & potatoes, scalloped
Method: STEP 1:
Drain ham chucks.  Reserve 1¼ qt liquid for use in Step 3.  Cut ham into bite-sized pieces; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Add potatoes to 2-3/4 gallons water (3/4 gallon water used for nutritional analysis).  Cover.  Bring quickly to a boil; simmer 15 minutes.  Drain; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.  Add reserved stock (1¼ qt); heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 4:
Blend melted butter or margarine and flour together until smooth.  Add to hot milk, stirring constantly.
STEP 5:
Add onions; simmer sauce 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 6:
Combine ham, potatoes, and sauce.  Place 6¼ qt ham-potato mixture in each pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 25 minutes.
STEP 8:
Sprinkle 2 cups cheese (Cheddar or American) evenly over mixture in each pan.
STEP 9:
Bake an additional 10 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 14 lb 10 oz potatoes, fresh, white, sliced (19 lb 9 oz A.P.) may be used.  Prepare according to instructions on Recipe No. Q-G-2 omitting the salt.  Drain.
2.  In Step 5, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.
3.  In Step 5, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 8, 12 oz (3¼ cups) canned, cheese, American, dehydrated may be used.  See Recipe No. A-28.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, jaegerschnitzel, veal, w/sauce
Method: STEP 1:
Saute finely chopped peppers, mushrooms, pimientos and garlic in butter or melted margarine 3 minutes.  Add pepper and parsley.  Cook 2 minutes.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Prepare 4/5 recipe (1¼ gal) Brown Gravy (Recipe No.O-16).  Add tomato paste; mix well.  Bring to boil, stirring constantly.
STEP 3:
Add gravy mixture to mushroom mixture. Stir.  Keep hot for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Place steaks on pans.  Bake 20 minutes. Turn steaks.  Bake 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated and browned.
STEP 5:
Serve each steak with 2 oz (¼ cup or 1 Size-1 ladle) hot mushroom sauce.
NOTE:
1.  Jaegerschnitzel is traditionally served with French fries, peas and carrots.
2.  In Step 1, 1 lb 8 oz peppers, sweet, fresh, A.P. will yield
1 lb 4 oz peppers, sweet, fresh, finely chopped.
3.  In Step 1, 3 oz (2¼ cups) dehydrated green peppers may be used; or 1 lb 4 oz (3-3/4 cups) frozen peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
4.  In Step 1, 2-2/3 cups chopped fresh parsley may be used for dehydrated parsley.
5.  In Step 1, 1 - 7 oz cn canned pimientos, drained may be used.
6.  In Step 1, 5 cloves dry minced garlic may be used.  Saute with peppers, mushrooms and pimientos.
7.  In Step 2, 12 oz (1/3 - 36 oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
8.  In Step 2, Brown Gravy mix may be used.  Prepare 4/5 recipe (1¼ gal) according to Recipe No. O-16-1.
9.  In Step 4, if convection oven is used, bake at 400°F. 10 minutes.  Turn steaks.  Bake 6 to 8 minutes or until thoroughly heated and browned on high fan, closed vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, Jambalaya
Method: STEP 1:
Saute onions, celery, sweet peppers and garlic in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until vegetables are tender.
STEP 2:
Add tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, marjoram, thyme, oregano, red pepper, 8 bay leaves, Soup and Gravy base and 7½ qt water.  Blend well.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 3:

Place 2½ qt rice and about 4-3/4 qt ham (diced in 3/4-inch cubes) in each roasting pan.  Add about 2 gal sauce to each pan.  Cover; bake 1 hour or until rice is tender. (2-1/4 qt water  absorbed by rice.)
STEP 5:
Add 5 lb shrimp to each pan.  Mix well; continue to bake 10 to 15 minutes or until done.  Remove bay leaves.
NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  13 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 12 lb chopped onions.  2 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yeild 1 lb 12 oz chopped celery.  2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers.  1lb 8 oz (2 qt) dehydrated onions and 5-1/3 oz (1 qt) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb frozen, diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.  5 cloves (1-2/3 tbsp) garlic, dry, minced may be used.  Fry with onions in Step 1.
2.  In Step 2, 1 lb 11 oz (3/4 - 36 oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
3.  Recipe may be prepared in steam-jacketed kettle.  In
Step 3, reduce cooking time to 30 minutes.
4.  In Step 4, other types of unbreaded shrimp may be used.  See Guidelines for Using Shrimp, Recipe No.L-G-2.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
6.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 30 minutes or until rice is tender.  Follow Step 4.  Bake 10 to 15 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Dish, lasagna
Method: MEAT SAUCE:
STEP 1:
Cook 12 lb thawed beef in its own fat until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Add tomatoes, tomato paste, water, onions, sugar, salt, oregano, thyme, pepper, basil, garlic powder and red pepper. Blend well; simmer 1 hour.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
FILLING:
STEP 3:
Combine slightly beaten eggs (3 lb is 30 eggs), cheeses, and parsley.  Mix well; place in shallow pans, refrigerate for use in Step 4.
STEP 4:
Follow panning instructions.
STEP 5:
Cover.  Bake 1 hour.  Uncover; bake 10 to 15 minutes.
STEP 6:
Let stand 10 to 15 minutes before cutting to allow cheeses to firm.
PANNING INSTRUCTIONS:

Arrange in layers in each pan.  NOTE:  During panning, remove small amounts of filling from refrigeration at a time.  Ensure entire panning procedure does not exceed 4 hours total time between temperatures of 40°F. to 140°F.
Layer:
1.  2½ cups meat sauce
2.  Noodles, placed in rows
3.  3½ cups chilled filling
4.  1 qt meat sauce
5.  Noodles, placed in rows
6.  3½ cups chilled filling
7.  1 qt meat sauce
8.  Noodles, placed in rows
9.  1 qt meat sauce
10. Sprinkle 1 oz (5 tbsp) Parmesan Cheese over each pan
11. Cut 4x5
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 7 lb 14 oz (3½--35 oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used to replace the tomato paste.
2.  In Step 2, 4 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped onions.
3.  In Step 2, 8 oz (2-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 2, 1-3/4 oz (5 tbsp - 15 cloves) minced dry garlic may be used.
5.  In Step 3, 5 lb 2 oz (1¼ No.10 cn) canned pizza blend cheese may be used for Parmesan and Mozzarella cheese in Step 3.
6.  In Step 3, 1 lb 8 oz frozen whole table eggs and 1 lb 8 oz frozen egg whites or 3 lbs reduced cholesterol eggs may be used.  Thaw eggs.
7.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 55 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  Uncover; bake 5 minutes.
VARIATIONS:
1.  LASAGNA (GROUND TURKEY):  In Step 1, omit beef pattie mix or gound beef, bulk.  Use 12 lbs thawed ground turkey.  Follow Steps 2 through 6.

2.  LASAGNA (FROZEN):  In Step 1, use 50 lb frozen lasagna.  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  In Step 5, fold lid to form tent-like cover.  Bake at 475°F. 1 hour 50 minutes or in 325°F. Convection oven 1 hour 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated on high fan, closed vent.  Cut 2 by 5.  EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (7½ Ounces).

3.  LASAGNA (PIZZA SAUCE, CANNED):  Follow Step 1.  Omit Step 2.  Use 32 lb 13 oz (3-3/4 gal--5 No.10 cn) canned pizza sauce.  Stir ¼ oz (¼ cup) crushed oregano, 1/10 oz (2 tsp) ground thyme, ¼ oz (1 tbsp) black pepper, ¼ oz (2¼ tsp) crushed basil, 1/5 oz (2 tsp) garlic powder, 1/21 oz (3/4 tsp) ground red pepper into pizza sauce.  Add to meat mixture.  Bring to boil, reduce heat.  Simmer 5 mintues.  Follow Steps 3 through 6.

Recipe.Name: Dish, lasagna, w/spinach
Method: STEP 1:
Saute onions in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until tender.
SAUCE:
STEP 2:
Combine sauteed onions with crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, water, 4 bay leaves, garlic, oregano, basil, thyme, red pepper, sugar, and salt; mix well.
STEP 3:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 1 hour or until thickened, stirring occasionally.  Remove bay leaves.  Set aside for use in Step 8.
FILLING:
STEP 4:
Drain thawed spinach.  Press out excess water.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 5:
Add nutmeg to slightly beaten eggs (3 lb is 30 eggs); blend well.
STEP 6:
Combine eggs with cheese; mix well.
STEP 7:
Stir spinach into egg-cheese mixture.  Mix lightly but thoroughly; place in shallow pans; refrigerate for use in Step 8.
STEP 8:
Follow panning instructions (see below).
STEP 9:
Cover.  Bake 1½ hours.  Remove cover; bake 10 to 15 minutes.
STEP 10:
Cut and serve immediately.
PANNING INSTRUCTIONS:

Arrange in layers in each pan.  NOTE:  During panning; remove small amounts of filling from refrigeration at a time.  Ensure entire panning procedure does not exceed 3 hours total time between temperatures of 40°F. to 140°F.
Layer:
1.  2 cups sauce
2.  Noodles, flat and in rows
3.  5½ cups chilled spinach-cheese filling
4.  1 qt sauce
5.  Noodles, flat and in rows
6.  5½ cups chilled spinach-cheese filling
7.  Noodles, flat and in rows
8.  1½ qt sauce
Sprinkle with 1½ cups (6 oz) Parmesan cheese.  Follow Steps 9 and 10.  Cut 5 by 4.  EACH PORTION:  1 Piece (9½ Ounces).
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 3 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 2½ oz (7-2/3 tbsp--23 cloves) minced dry garlic may be used.  Fry with onions in Step 1.
4.  In Step 2, 7 lb 8 oz (3-1/2--36 oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used for canned tomato paste.
5.  7 lb 6 oz (1-3/4--No.10 cn) canned pizza blend cheese may be used for all Parmesan and Mozzarella cheese in recipe.  Use only in panning.
6.  In Step 9, when convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 1 hour 15 minutes on closed vent, high fan.  Remove cover; bake 10 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Dish, liver, w/onions, braised
Method: STEP 1:
Dredge sliced liver in mixture of flour, salt, pepper and paprika; shake off excess.  Brown on well-greased griddle.
STEP 2:
Overlap about 50 slices in each pan.
STEP 3:
Saute thinly sliced onions in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until tender; spread an equal quantity over liver in each pan.
STEP 4:
Pour approximately 1 gallon hot water over liver and onions in each pan; cover.
STEP 5:
Bake 30 minutes or until liver is fork-tender.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 8 lb 14 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 lb thinly sliced onions.
2.  In Step 3, 1 lb (5½ cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  GRILLED LIVER:  Follow Step 1.  Brown evenly on both sides.  Omit Steps 2 through 5.  Serve immediately.  If desired, Onion Gravy (Recipe No.O-16-6) or Onion and Mushroom Gravy (Recipe No. O-16-9) may be served with liver.

Recipe.Name: Dish, macaroni & cheese, baked
Method: STEP 1:
Add elbow macaroni slowly to 6 gal boiling salted (2-2/3 tbsp) water; cook 8 to 10 minutes or until tender; stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
STEP 2:
Drain.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with 2½ gal warm water; heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 4:
Combine flour and 1 qt cold water to make a smooth mixture.  Add mixture to hot milk, stirring constantly.
STEP 5:
Add salt and pepper.  Bring mixture to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes or until thickened.  Stir frequently to prevent scorching.
STEP 6:
Add shredded cheese (Cheddar or American) to sauce; stir just until smooth; remove from heat.
STEP 7:
Combine sauce and macaroni; mix well.
STEP 8:
Place about 6-1/3 qt mixture in each well-greased pan.
STEP 9:
Combine bread crumbs and melted butter or margarine; sprinkle 1-3/4 cups over mixture in each pan.
STEP 10:
Bake 25 minutes or until browned.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 6, 3-lb (1 No.10 cn) cheese, American, dehydrated, combined with 3-lb (1½ qt) warm water may be used.
2.  In Step 10, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 15 to 20 minutes or until browned on high fan, open vent.
3.  In Step 10, if microwave-convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 10 minutes or until browned with 50% microwave power throughout.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
5.  Two No. 8 scoops may be us

Recipe.Name: Dish, macaroni, creole
Method: STEP 1:

Combine tomato paste, tomatoes, hot water, onions, sweet peppers, salt, pepper, sugar, basil, garlic powder, red pepper and thyme in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Mix well; bring to a boil; reduce heat; cover; simmer 10 to 15 minutes
or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Brown 11 lb thawed beef in its own fat until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain or skim off excess fat.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Add elbow macaroni to 4 gallons boiling water with 1-2/3 tbsp salt and 2 tbsp salad oil added; bring to a boil.  Cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally; drain well.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.
STEP 4:
Combine beef, tomato sauce mixture, and macaroni.  Mix well.
STEP 5:
Pour about 17 lb (8¼ qt) macaroni mixture in each pan.
STEP 6:
Sprinkle 5-1/3 oz (1-1/3 cups) cheese (American or Cheddar) over macaroni mixture in each pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 30 minutes or until bubbling and cheese is melted.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 5 oz chopped onions; 1 lb 13 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 2-2/3 oz (3/4 cup) dehydrated onions and 3-3/4 oz (2½ cups) dehydrated green peppers or 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups) frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
3.  In Step 1, 9 lb (4 - 36 oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
4.  In Step 3, other types of macaroni may be used.
5.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 20 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATION:
1.  CREOLE MACARONI (GROUND TURKEY):     Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 12 lb ground turkey, thawed.  Follow Steps 4 through 7.

Recipe.Name: Dish, macaroni, w/ham & tomatoes, bkd
Method: STEP 1:
Add macaroni slowly to 3 gallons boiling water with 1-2/3 tbsp salt added; stir occasionally, until water returns to a boil.  Boil 10 to 15 minutes.
STEP 2:
Drain.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Saute onions, peppers, mushrooms and garlic in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until tender.
STEP 4:
Combine sauteed vegetables, tomatoes, sugar, and oregano.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 5:
Combine diced ham (½-inch cubes), vegetables and macaroni.
STEP 6:
Place about 1½ gal in each pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 25 minutes.
STEP 8:
Sprinkle 3 cups cheese (American or Cheddar) evenly over mixture in each pan.  Bake 10 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 4 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped onions; 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 3, 8 oz (2-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions and 5¼ oz (1 qt) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb (1½ qt) frozen diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
3.  In Step 3, 4 - 8-Z cn canned mushrooms may be used.
4.  In Step 3, 1 tbsp (3 cloves) dry minced garlic may be used.
Fry with peppers.
5.  In Step 5, ham, cooked, boneless, thawed may be used.
6.  In Step 7, 1 lb 4 oz (1/3 - No.10 cn) canned cheese, American, dehydrated and 1 cup water may be used.  See Guidelines for Cheeses (Recipe No.A-28).
7.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
8.  Two No. 8 scoops may be used.
VARIATIONS:
1.  BAKED LUNCHEON MEAT, MACARONI AND CHEESE: Follow Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, use 10 lb canned luncheon meat diced into ½ inch cubes.  Follow Steps 6 through 8.
2.  BAKED HAM, MACARONI AND TOMATOES (CANNED HAM CHUNKS):  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, use 20 lb (11 - 29 oz cn) canned ham chunks.  Drain.  Follow Steps 6 through 8.

Recipe.Name: Dish, manicotti/cannelloni, beef
Method: STEP 1:
Spread 1½ cups pizza sauce in thin layer over bottom of each pan.
STEP 2:
Place 20 frozen Manicotti (cannelloni) in each pan.
STEP 3:
Pour 4½ cups pizza sauce over manicotti in each pan.
STEP 4:
Cover pans.
STEP 5:
Bake 1 hour; remove cover; bake 15 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 51 lb 10 oz (300 - 2-3/4 oz) beef or cheese manicotti may be used.  In Step 2, place 30 manicotti in each pan.  Follow Steps 3 through 5.
EACH PORTION:  3 Manicotti.
2.  If convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. on high speed, closed vent 30 minutes in Step 5; uncover; bake 5 minutes.
VARIATION:
1.  CHEESE MANICOTTI:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, use 46 lb 14 oz (200 - 3-3/4 oz) manicotti, frozen, cheese, without sauce.  Place 20 manicotti in each pan.  Follow Steps 3 through 5.

Recipe.Name: Dish, meatballs, Swedish
Method: STEP 1:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.
STEP 2:
Blend in slightly beaten eggs (9-2/3 oz is 6 eggs), salt, nutmeg, allspice and pepper.
STEP 3:
Place dry broken bread in mixer bowl; mix at medium speed 5 minutes or until crumbs are formed.  Pour milk mixture over bread; mix at low speed ½ minute; let stand 10 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add 20 lb thawed beef and onions to bread mixture.  Mix at low speed 1 minute.  DO NOT OVERMIX.
STEP 5:
Shape into 300 balls weighing 1-1/3 oz each (1--No.24 scoop); place 100 meatballs on each sheet pan.
STEP 6:
Bake at 400°F. 20 minutes or until browned and done (160°F.).  Remove meatballs; keep hot for use in Step 10.
STEP 7:

Sprinkle flour evenly over melted shortening or salad oil in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Blend well with wire whip. Cook roux at low heat until flour is a medium color. Stir frequently to avoid overbrowning.
STEP 8:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base.  Add to roux stirring constantly.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly.
STEP 9:
Add garlic, nutmeg and pepper; stir well.
STEP 10:
Pour 2-3/4 qt gravy over meatballs in each roasting pan.
STEP 11:
Bake at 350°F. 30 to 35 minutes or until heated thoroughly.
STEP 12:
Sprinkle with paprika before serving.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 4, 12 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 10-2/3 oz chopped onions.
2.  In Step 4, 1-1/3 oz (6-1/3 tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 6, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 8 to 10 minutes or until browned and done on high fan, closed vent; in Step 11, 15 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
4.  In Step 9, 1 tbsp minced dry garlic (3 cloves) may be used.
5.  In Step 12, 1--Size 1 ladle may be used to serve sauce.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  SWEDISH MEATBALLS (BEEF AND VEAL):  Follow Steps 1 through 3.  In Step 4, use 10 lb beef pattie mix and 10 lb ground veal.  Follow Step 5.  In Step 6, bake 30 minutes or until browned and done (160°F.).  Follow Steps 7 through 12.
(Note: In Step 6, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 12 minutes on high fan, closed vent; in Step 11, 15 minutes on high fan, closed vent.)

Recipe.Name: Dish, meatloaf
Method: STEP 1:
Combine 30 lb thawed beef with bread crumbs, salt, pepper and garlic powder, mix until well blended.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with water.
STEP 3:
Add milk, celery, onions, 1 lb sweet peppers (optional), slightly beaten eggs (2½ lb is 24 eggs), and tomato juice.  Mix lightly but thoroughly. DO NOT OVERMIX.
STEP 4:
Place 11 lb 6 oz meat mixture into each pan and divide into 2 loaves per pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 2 hours or until meat thermometer registers an internal temperature of 165°F.  Skim off excess fat and liquid during cooking.
STEP 6:
Let stand 20 minutes before slicing.  Cut 13 slices per loaf.
NOTE:

1.  In Step 3, 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery; 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; 1 lb 4 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped sweet peppers.
2.  In Step 3, 2 oz (9-2/3 tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 2 lb 8 oz (4-2/3 cups) frozen egg whites, thawed, or 2 lb 8 oz (4-2/3 cups) frozen egg substitute, thawed or 2 lb 8 oz frozen or chilled reduced cholesterol eggs may be used.
4.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 1 hour 15 minutes or until meat thermometer registers an internal temperature of 165°F. on high fan, closed vent.
5.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  TURKEY LOAF:  In Step 1, omit beef pattie mix or ground beef.  Use 30 lb ground turkey.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.  In Step 5, bake 2 hours or in 300°F. convection oven 1 hour 15 minutes or until meat thermometer registers an internal temperature of 170°F. on high fan, closed vent.
2.  TOMATO MEAT LOAF:  In Step 1, reduce salt to 2½ oz

(¼ cup).  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, omit tomato juice.  Use 3 lb 2 oz (1--No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed tomato soup and 1½ oz (3 tbsp) Worcestershire sauce.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  In Step 6, combine 1 lb 4 oz (2½ cups) water and 4 lb 11 oz (1½ - No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed tomato soup.  Bring to a boil.  Pour 1 lb 6 oz (2-3/4 cups) hot soup mixture over baked meat loaf slices.

3.  CAJUN MEAT LOAF:  In Step 1, increase black pepper to 1 oz (¼ cup) and garlic powder to 3/4 oz (2-1/3 tbsp).  Add ½ oz (2 tbsp) ground red pepper, 1/8 oz (2 tbsp) crushed oregano, 1/5 oz (2 tbsp) crushed sweet basil, 1/3 oz (2 tbsp) ground thyme and ½ oz (2 tbsp) onion powder.  Follow Step 2. In Step 3, omit tomato juice.  Add 3 lb 10 oz (1½ qt) catsup and 8 oz (1 cup) Worcestershire sauce.  Follow Steps 4 through 6.  Serve with 1 recipe Cajun Creole Sauce (Recipe No.O-5-2).

Recipe.Name: Dish, noodles, Jefferson
Method: STEP 1:
Add 3 tbsp salt and 3 tbsp oil to 6 to 9 gallons hot water, heat to a rolling boil.
STEP 2:
Slowly add noodles; stirring constantly, until water boils again. Cook about 15 minutes or until tender.  Drain thoroughly.
STEP 3:
Add melted butter or margarine, salt and pepper to noddles.  Stir well.
STEP 4:
Add cheese; toss well.  Serve immediately.

Recipe.Name: Dish, peppers, stuffed
Method: STEP 1:
Trim, wash and prepare vegetables as directed on Recipe No.A-13.
STEP 2:
Prepare 2 recipes Tomato Sauce (Recipe No. O-15).  Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 3:
Cut each pepper in half lengthwise; remove core.
STEP 4:
Place peppers in 10 gallons boiling water.  Return to a boil; cook 1 minute.  Drain well.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 5:
Drain corn and beans.  Rinse beans.  Drain well.
STEP 6:
Combine corn, beans, cooked rice, ½-inch diced tomatoes, onions, garlic powder, parsley, salt, peppers (black and red), cumin, chili powder, oil and cheese (chedder or American). Mix lightly.
STEP 7:
Fill each pepper with ½-cup (1 - No.8 scoop) vegetable-rice mixture.  Place peppers in pans.
STEP 8:
Pour 4 oz (½-cup) water around peppers in each pan.
STEP 9:
Pour 1 lb 14 oz (3½ cups) tomato sauce over peppers in each pan.  Cover.
STEP 10:
Bake about 1 hour 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated (160°F.).
NOTES:
1.  In Step 2, Sauce Mix, Tomato, Basic may be used.  Prepare 3½ gal according to directions on container.
2.  In Step 3, 42 lb fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 34 lb 8 oz fresh sweet peppers, cored and cut in half lengthwise.
3.  In Step 5, 12 lb (5¼ qt - 12 - No.300 cn) canned pinto beans or black beans may be used.  Drain beans.
4.  In Step 5, 9 lb 2 oz frozen corn may be used.  Cook according to Q-G-3.  Drain.
5.  In Step 6, 3 lb (1-3/4 qt) long grain rice will yield 9 lb (1½ gal) cooked rice.  Cooking according to Recipe No. E-5 or E-6.
6.  In Step 6, 9 lb cooked brown rice may be used.  Use about 3 lb 2 oz (2 qt) parboiled brown rice.  Cook according to Recipe No.E-5-5.
7.  In Step 6, 2 lb 13 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 2 lb 12 oz diced tomatoes.
8.  In Step 6, 3 lb dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb 10 oz chopped onions.
9.  In Step 6, 5-1/3 oz (1½ cups) dehydrated chopped onions may be used.
10.  In Step 6, 4¼ oz parsley A.P. will yield 4 oz chopped parsley.
11.  In Step 6, low fat or reduced fat cheddar or American cheese may be used.
12.  In Step 10, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 40 minutes or until thoroughly heated (160°F.) on high fan, closed vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, pie, beef & corn, w/potatoes
Method: STEP 1:
Cook 30 lb thawed beef with onions and peppers until beef loses its pink color, stirring to break apart.  Drain and skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Add salt, pepper and garlic.  Mix well
STEP 3:
Place an equal quantity of beef mixture in each pan.
STEP 4:
Spread 2 qt corn with liquid on top of beef mixture in each pan.
STEP 5:
Prepare 1 recipe Mashed Potatoes (Recipe No. Q-57).  Spread 5½ qt mashed potatoes over beef mixture and corn in each pan.
STEP 6:
Bake 20 minutes or until potatoes are evenly browned.
STEP 7:
Cut 5 by 7.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb dry chopped onions; 2 lb 12 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions and 5 oz (3-3/4 cups) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb (1½ qt) frozen diced green peppers may be used.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  In Step 6, if convection oven is used, bake at 300°F. 20 minutes on high fan, open vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, pie, cnd beef, w/biscut
Method: STEP 1:
Simmer carrots 10 to 15 minutes.  Add onions and potatoes. Cook 20 minutes or until just tender.
STEP 2:
Drain vegetables.  Reserve liquid for use in Step 5; vegetables for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Drain beef chunks; reserve juices for use in Step 5.
STEP 4:
Combine salad oil or melted shortening and flour; brown lightly at low heat.
STEP 5:
Add beef juices, vegetable liquid or water gradually.  Cook 15 minutes or until thickened.  Stir constantly.  Add pepper.
STEP 6:
Add beef; continue cooking until simmering.  Add vegetables; simmer until temperature reaches 180°F.
STEP 7:
Pour about 6½ qt meat mixture into each pan.
STEP 8:
Add 3 cups peas to each pan.  Stir lightly.
STEP 9:
Prepare 1 recipe Baking Powder Biscuits (Recipe No.D-1-1).  Place 25 biscuits on top of mixture in each pan.
STEP 10:
Bake 15 minutes or until biscuits are browned.
NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, 6 lb 2 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 5 lb sliced carrots; 5 lb 9 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 5 lb quartered onions; and 6 lb 2 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 5 lb potato pieces.
2.  In Step 1, 10 pz (3-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 6, stew must reach 180°F. or raw dough on bottom of biscuits will result.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
5.  In Step 10, if convection oven is used, bake at 400°F. 10 to 15 minutes or until biscuits are browned on  low fan, open vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, porcupine balls, beef
Method: STEP 1:
Prepare 1½ recipes tomato sauce (See Recipe No. O-15).  Set aside for use in Step 6. (Use appt 3-1/2 qt cold water)
STEP 2:
Cook rice according to directions in Recipe No. E-5 - Steamed Rice.  Cool.
STEP 3:
Thoroughly combine cooled rice with 24 lb ground beef, onions, peppers, pepper, salt, garlic powder and Worcestershire sauce.  DO NOT OVERMIX.
STEP 4:
Shape into 200 balls weighing about 3-2/3 oz each (1 - No.16 scoop).
STEP 5:
Place an equal quantity of balls on each pan.  Bake 30 minutes or until brown and internal temperature of 165°F. is reached.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 6:
Place approximately 40 meatballs in each steam table pan.  Pour 8-1/3 cups (4 lb 5 oz) sauce over balls in each pan.
STEP 7:
Cover, bake 45 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions and 1 lb 13 oz fresh sweer peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopper peppers.
2.  In Step 3, 3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onins and 4 oz (3 cups) dehydrated green peppers or 1 lb 8 oz frozen diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
3.  In Step 3, 3 tbsp (12 cloves) minced dry garlic may be used.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

5.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 15 minutes on high fan, closed vent, or until internal temperature of 165°F. is reached.  In Step 7, bake at 325°F. 30 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.
VARIATION:

1.  TURKEY PORCUPINES:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3 use 24 lb ground turkey.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, bake 45 minutes or if convection oven is used 325°F. for 15 minutes or until internal temperature of 170°F. is reached on high fan, closed vent.  Follow Step 7.  Bake 1 hour or in 325°F. convection oven for 30 minutes on high fan, closed vent.

Recipe.Name: Dish, pork, adobo
Method: STEP 1:
Place thawed, diced pork in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:

Combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic powder, ginger, 4 bay leaves, and pepper.  Pour over pork; mix well.  Cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes.  Skim off excess fat.  Remove bay leaves.
STEP 3:
Dissolve cornstarch in cold water; stir into pork mixture.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; cook 5 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 4:
Add onions and peppers; cook until tender, about 20 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 35 lb pork butt A.P. diced into 1 to 1½ inch pieces may be used.  Trim to remove excess fat and gristle.
2.  In Step 2, 1-1/3 tbsp (4 cloves) dry minced garlic may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb onions sliced ¼ inch thick.
4.  In Step 4, 4 lb 14 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 4 lb sliced ½ inch by 2 inches.
5.  One No.6 scoop may be used.

Recipe.Name: Dish, pork, sweet & sour
Method: STEP 1:
Drain bean sprouts and pineapple (chunks or tidbits); reserve juice for use in Step 2 (appx 14-1/2 cups).  Set aside bean sprouts and pineapple for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Combine reserved juices or water (to make 14½ cups); sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, ginger and garlic.  Blend well.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Cook diced pork in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot about 10 minutes or until tender.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.
STEP 4:
