1.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used bake at 325°F. 9 minutes on high fan, closed vent or until internal temperature reasches 170°F.
VARIATION:
1.  GRILLED TURKEY SAUSAGE PATTIE:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Omit Step 5.  Grill patties on 350°F., ungreased griddle, 3 minutes on each side or until internal temperature reaches 170°F.

Recipe.Name: Biscuits, bkg pwd
Method: STEP 1:
Sift together flour, dry milk, baking powder and salt into mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Blend shortening at low speed into dry ingredients until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal.
STEP 3:
Add water; mix at low speed only enough to form a soft dough.
STEP 4:
Place dough on lightly floured board.  Knead lightly, about 1 minute or until dough is smooth.
STEP 5:
Roll or pat out to a uniform thickness of ½ inch.
STEP 6:
Cut with 2½ inch floured biscuit cutter.  Place 50 biscuits on each pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
NOTE:
1.  For browner tops:  In Step 1, add 3½ oz (½ cup) granulated sugar to ingredients.
2.  In Step 7. if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 15 minutes or until lightly browned on low fan, open vent.
VARIATIONS:

1.  BAKING POWDER BISCUITS (BISCUIT MIX):  Omit Steps 1 through 7.  Use 7 lb 14 oz (1-3/4 - No.10 cn) canned Biscuit Mix.  Prepare according to instructions on container.  For convection oven see, Note 2.
2.  CHEESE BISCUITS:  In Step 1, add 1 lb (1 qt) grated Cheddar cheese to sifted dry ingredients.  Follow Steps 2 through 7.

3.  DROP BISCUITS: Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, increase water to 4 lb 12 oz (2-1/3 qt).  Omit Steps 4 through 6.  Drop dough by heaping tbsp, 1 inch apart, on greased sheet pans in rows 6 by 9.  Follow Step 7.

Recipe.Name: Scallops, baked
Method: STEP 1:
Wash thawed scallops thoroughly; cut large ones in half.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Marinate scallops in lemon juice 5 to 10 minutes.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Mix bread crumbs, salt, pepper, paprika, basil and garlic.
STEP 4:
Drain scallops.  Dredge scallops in seasoned bread crumbs.  Place an equal quantity of scallops in each pan.
STEP 5:
Drizzle ½ cup melted butter or margarine over scallops in each pan.  Bake 30 minutes.
STEP 6:
Remove from oven; sprinkle each pan with 2 tbsp parsley.  Serve immediately.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 2 lb lemons A.P. (8 lemons) will yield 1-1/3 cups juice.
2.  In Step 2, 1/3 cup frozen lemon juice concentrate and 1 cup cold water may be used for juice.
3.  In Step 4, other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 20 minutes on high fan, closed vent.
5.  In Step 6, 4¼ oz (2 cups) chopped fresh parsley A.P. may be used.

Recipe.Name: Scallops, creole
Method: STEP 1:
Prepare 2 recipes Creole Sauce (Recipe No.O-5).  Keep hot for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Wash thawed scallops thoroughly; cut large ones in half.  Drain well.
STEP 3:
Cook scallops in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot using 3-1/2 gallons water for 3 to 4 minutes.  DO NOT OVERCOOK. Drain well immediately.
STEP 4:
Add cooked scallops to sauce; bring to simmer; cook 2 to 3 minutes.
STEP 5:
Serve immediately.
VARIATIONS:

1.  CREOLE FISH:  In Step 1, prepare 3/4 recipe Creole Sauce (Recipe No.O-5).  Omit Steps 2 through 5.  Use 25 lb fish portions, frozen, raw, breaded.  Fry in 350°F. deep fat 3 minutes or until lightly browned.  Drain well on absorbent paper.  Ladle 2 oz (¼ cup - 1 Size-1 ladle) over each fish portion just before serving.  EACH PORTION:  1 Fish Portion (3½ Ounces) plus ¼ Cup Sauce (2 Ounces).
2.  CREOLE FISH FILLETS:  In Step 1, prepare 3/4 recipe

Creole Sauce (Recipe No.O-5).  Omit Steps 2 through 5.  Use 30 lb fish fillets, thawed.  Separate fillets; cut into 4½ ounces. Arrange in single layer in 7 (12x20x2½-inch) steam table pans. Ladle 2 oz (¼ cup - 1 Size-1 ladle) over each fish fillet.  Bake in 375°F. oven 25 minutes or in 325°F. convection oven 15 minutes or until done on high fan, closed vent.  NOTE: if flounder, sole or cod fillets are used, bake 15 minutes or in convection oven 7 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  EACH PORTION:  1 Piece with Sauce (5 Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Sauce, creole
Method: STEP 1:
Saute chopped onions, peppers, and celery in melted shortening, salad oil, or olive oil 10 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Add tomatoes, salt, pepper, sugar, and Worcestershire sauce to vegtables.  Bring to a boil;  reduce heat;  cover;  simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 3:
Blend flour and water to make a smooth paste;  add to sauce. Stir to combine.  Simmer 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly.
NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions;  1 lb 13 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped peppers;  2 lb 1 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped celery.
2.  In Step 1, 3-1/3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions and 4 oz (3 cups)  dehydrated green peppers (see Recipe No. A-11)  or 1 lb 8 oz (4½ cups)  frozen, diced green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
VARIATIONS:

1.  SPANISH SAUCE:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, add ¼ tsp hot sauce, 1 bay leaf, 1 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp dehyrated garlic or 1-1/3 tbsp (4 cloves)  minced dry garlic, and 1 lb 13 oz (1-jumbo or 2-8Z cn)  canned sliced drained mushrooms.  Follow Step 3.  Remove bay leaf.

2.  CAJUN CREOLE SAUCE:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, increase pepper to 1-1/3 tbsp;  add 2 tsp ground red pepper, 2-2/3 tbsp crushed oregano, 2-2/3 tbsp crushed sweet basil, 2-2/3 tbsp ground thyme, 1 tbsp dehydrated garlic or 1-1/3 oz (¼ cup-12 cloves)  minced dry garlic and 1 tbsp ground paprika.  Follow Ste

Recipe.Name: Scallops, fried
Method: STEP 1:
Wash thawed scallops thoroughly; cut large ones in half.  Drain well.
STEP 2:
Dredge scallops in mixture of flour, salt, pepper & paprika; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute milk; add beaten eggs.
STEP 4:
Dip floured scallops in milk and egg mixture.  Drain.
STEP 5:
Dredge scallops in crumbs until well coated.
STEP 6:
Fry 3 minutes or until golden brown.
STEP 7:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 6 oz (1½ cups) dehydrated egg mix combined with scant 2 cups warm water may be used.

Recipe.Name: Shortcake, strawberry, f/biscut mix
Method: STEP 1:
Place mix, sugar and contents of pouches in mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Blend with paddle at low speed 1 minute; add water gradually while mixing at low speed 30 seconds.
STEP 3:

Divide dough into 4 pieces, about 3 lb 8 oz each.  Place dough on lightly floured working surface; fold over 2 or 3 times; press down.  Roll each piece into squares, about 16x16 inches and 3/8-inch thick.
STEP 4:
Brush 2 pieces of dough with melted butter or margarine.  Place pieces of dough on top of the 2 buttered ones.  Cut with 2½-inch floured biscuit cutter.
STEP 5:
Place biscuits on pans in rows 6 by 9.  Brush top of biscuits with remaining butter or margarine.
STEP 6:
Bake 25 minutes or until golden brown.
STEP 7:
Split baked biscuits while still hot.  Cool thoroughly.
STEP 8:
Prepare 1¼ recipes Whipped Topping Recipe.
STEP 9:
Place ¼ cup (1 Size-1 ladle) strawberries on bottom half of each biscuit; top with other half biscuit.  Top with ¼ cup strawberries and ¼ cup (1 Size-1 ladle) whipped topping.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 15 minutes or until golen brown, on low fan, open vent.
2.  In Step 9, 30 lb 6 oz (13½ qt - 4½ No.10 cn) canned, quartered or sliced peaches may be used for strawberries.  Add 4½ oz (½ cup - 1 Size-2 ladle) peaches over each portion.
3.  In Step 9, a pastry bag may be used to pipe whipped topping on each portion.
VARIATION:
1.  STRAWBERRY SHORTCAKE (CAKE MIX):  Omit Steps 1 through 7.  Use 10 lb (2 No.10 cn) Yellow or White Cake Mix.

Prepare according to instructions on container.  See Recipe Yellow Cake or White Cake for preparation instruction.  When cakes are cool, but 6 by 9.  Follow Step 8.  In Step 9, place 4¼ oz (½ cup - 1 Size-2 ladle) strawberries on each piece of cake.  Top with whipped topping.

Recipe.Name: Shrimp, cocktail
Method: Step 1.  Place shimp in 3 qt boiling water; cover; return to boil; uncover; reduce heat, simmer 2 to 3 minutes.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Drain immediately.
Step 2.  Place shrimp in single layer on 2 sheet pans (18x26 inches).  Refrigerate for use in Step 5.
Step 3.  Prepare 1 recipe Seafood Cocktail, Recipe No.0-11.  Cover; refrigerate for use in Step 6.
Step 4.  Line individual serving dishes with lettuce.
Step 5.  Arrange 4 shrimp on lettuce in each dish.
Step 6.  Place 2 tbsp (1-No.30 scoop) sauce in each souffle
cup.  Serve with shrimp.
NOTE:
1.  For other types of unbreaded shrimp,see Guidelines for Using Shrimp,  Recipe No. L-G-2.
2.  In Step 3, 8 lb 4 oz (11-12 oz bt) prepared seafood cocktail sauce may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 4 lb 5 oz lettuce A.P. will yield 4 lb shredded lettuce.
4.  In Step 6, shrimp may be served with 1 lemon wedge.  Use 13 (3 lb 4 oz) fresh lemons A.P.  Cut 8 wedges per lemon.
VARIATION:

1.  SPICED SHRIMP:  In Step 1, reduce water to 1 qt; add 2 qt vinegar, 1 oz (6 tbsp) ground red pepper; 1-1/5 oz (6 tbsp) mustard flour, 1 oz (¼ cup) whole celery seed, 1 oz (2 tbsp) ground paprika, 1 tbsp ground ginger, 1 tbsp ground mace, 1 tbsp ground cinnamon, 2 tsp ground cloves and 12 bay leaves; mix well.  Proceed with remainder of Step 1.  Follow Step 2.  Omit Step 3.  Follow Steps 4 and 5.  Omit Step 6.
EACH PORTION:  4 Shrimp (1 ounce).

Recipe.Name: Sauce, seafood cocktail
Method: STEP 1:
Combine catsup, horseradish, and hot sauce;  blend well.
STEP 2:
Cover;  refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1¼ oz (5 tbsp)  dehydrated horseradish (See Recipe No. A-17) or 1 lb (1½ cups)  frozen horseradish may be used.  Thaw horseradish.
2.  In Step 1, add 1 or 2 tsp additional hot sauce for hotter sauce.
3.  Seafood Cocktail Sauce may be served with French Fried shrimp, shrimp cocktail, fried oysters, scallops, fish fillets, portions or nuggets.
4.  In Step 1, 7 lb 8 oz (10-12 oz bt)  prepared Seafood Cocktail Sauce may be used.  Omit Step 2.
5.  One Size 0 ladle may be used.  See Recipe No. A-4.

Recipe.Name: Shrimp, curry
Method: STEP 1:
Place shrimp in 3 gallons boiling water; cover, return to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer 3 to 5 minutes; drain.
STEP 2:
Set aside for use in Step 9.
STEP 3:
Saute onions and peppers in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 10 minutes or until tender.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 4:
Add flour to salad oil or melted shortening; blend thoroughly.
STEP 5:
Cook until well browned, stirring frequently.
STEP 6:
Gradually add hot water to flour mixture; cook until thick and smooth, stirring constantly.
STEP 7:
Add sauteed vegetables.
STEP 8:
Add apples, celery, curry powder, ginger, red pepper, garlic, horseradish and salt; simmer 20 minutes.
STEP 9:
Add shrimp, mushrooms and lemon juice; simmer 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 14 oz (3½ - No.10 cn) canned, dehydrated, cooked shrimp may be used.  Rehydrate according to Recipe No.L-G-2.
2.  In Step 1, 25 lb shrimp, raw, unpeeled may be used.  See Guidelines for Steam Cooking Shellfish, Recipe No.L-G-4.
3.  In Step 3, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions; 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers.
4.  In Step 3, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions and 5¼ oz (1 qt) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb (1½ qt) frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
5.  In Step 8, 5 lb 2 oz fresh apples A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped pared apples; 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery will yield 2 lb chopped celery.
6.  In Step 8, 10 tbsp (30 cloves) dry minced garlic may be used.  Saute with onions and pepper.
7.  In Step 9, 3 - 8Z cn canned mushrooms may be used.
8.  In Step 9, 1 lb 2 oz lemons A.P. (4 lemons) will yield 3/4 cup juice.

Recipe.Name: Shrimp, French fried
Method: STEP 1:
Wash shrimp; drain well.
STEP 2:
Dredge shrimp in mixture of flour, salt, pepper and paprika; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Combine beaten eggs (2 lb is 20 eggs) and water.  Dip shrimp in egg mixture; drain well.
STEP 4:
Dredge shrimp in crumbs until well coated; shake off excess.
STEP 5:
Fry 2 minutes or until golden brown. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 6:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, other types of shrimp may be used.  See Guidelines of Using Shrimp, Recipe No.L-G-2.
2.  In Step 3, 10 oz (2½ cups) dehydrated egg mix combined with 3 cups warm water may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  TEMPURA SHRIMP:  Follow Step 1.  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  Prepare 1½ gal Tempura Batter (Recipe No.D-38). Dip shrimp into batter.  In Step 5, deep fat fry 2½ minutes or until golden brown.  Follow Step 6.

2.  FRENCH FRIED SHRIMP (BREADED, FROZEN):  In Step 1, use 38 lb shrimp, breaded, frozen.  DO NOT allow frozen breaded shrimp to thaw before cooking.  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  In Step 5, fry 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown. Follow Step 6.  EACH PORTION:  7 to 10 Shrimp.

Recipe.Name: Shrimp, scampi
Method: STEP 1:
Rinse shrimp; drain.  Place 7 lb 8 oz shrimp on each pan.
STEP 2:
Add 15 oz (1-7/8 cups) diced tomatoes to each pan.
STEP 3:
Combine melted margarine or butter, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, parsley, and pepper.  Blend well; mixture will separate.
STEP 4:
While stirring, ladle about 14 oz (1-3/4 cup) scampi sauce over the shrimp and tomatoes in each pan.  Toss lightly but thoroughly.
STEP 5:
Cover, bake 20 minutes; uncover, stir; bake 10 minutes or until shrimp are done.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Remove from oven.
STEP 6:
Sprinkle 4 oz (1 cup) bread crumbs evenly over the top of each pan.  Stir to blend crumbs with liquid to thicken sauce.  Serve immediately.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, other sizes and types of pans may be used.
2.  In Step 1, 37 lb 3 oz IQF shrimp A.P. will yield 30 lb thawed shrimp.
3.  In Step 1, dehydrated shrimp may be used.  See Guidelines for Using Shrimp, L-G-2.
4.  In Step 2, 3 lb (8-3/4 cups) chopped fresh tomatoes (3 lb
1 oz A.P.) may be used.
5.  In Step 2, 2 lb 8 oz fresh lemons A.P. (10 lemons) will yield 2 cups lemon juice.
6.  In Step 3, 5-7/8 oz (1¼ cups) garlic powder may be used.
7.  In Step 3, 8 oz (1 qt) chopped fresh parsley (8½ oz A.P.) may be used.
8.  In Step 5, if a convection oven is used, cover; bake at 350°F. 15 minutes on high fan, closed vent.  Uncover; stir, bake 5 minutes or until shrimp are done.  DO NOT OVERCOOK.  Remove from oven.
9.  Shrimp Scampi may be served with steamed pasta, Recipe No.E-4 or steamed rice, Recipe No.E-5.
10.  No.6 Scoop may be used.

Recipe.Name: Soup, beef, w/vegetables & barley, cnd
Method: STEP 1:
Place soup in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:
Add water to soup.  Mix well.
STEP 3:
Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.
NOTE:
One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATIONS:
1.  BEAN WITH BACON SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed bean with bacon soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
2.  BEEF NOODLE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed beef noodle soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
3.  CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed chicken noodle soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
4.  CHICKEN WITH RICE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed chicken with rice soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
5.  MANHATTAN CLAM CHOWDER (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed Manhattan Clam Chowder.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
6.  MINESTONE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed minestrone soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
7.  SPLIT PEA SOUP WITH HAM (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed split pea soup with ham.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
8.  TOMATO SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned tomato soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
9.  VEGETABLE SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed vegetable soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
10.  VEGETABLE WITH BEEF SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use, 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed vegetable with beef soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

Recipe.Name: Soup, chicken gumbo
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions in butter or margarine until tender.
STEP 2:
Blend flour with onion-fat mixture to form a roux using wire whip; add garlic powder.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 4½ gal boiling water to make stock.  Add stock to roux, stirring constantly.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.
STEP 4:
Add tomatoes, celery, okra, peppers, rice, 5 bay leaves,
paprika, pepper, and thyme; mix well.
STEP 5:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes.  Remove bay leaves.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery; 1 lb 13 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped peppers.
4.  In Step 4, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated green peppers or 1 lb 8 oz frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
5.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:
1.  SHRIMP GUMBO:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  In Step 5, bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 27 minutes.  Add 3 lb raw, peeled, deveined shrimp cut into quarters.  Cook an additional 2 to 3 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Soup, chicken mushroom, cnd, condensed
Method: STEP 1:
Add soups to steam-jackted kettle or stock pot; mix well.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with water; stir into soup.
STEP 3:
Add 3/4 tsp nutmeg (optional); mix well.
STEP 4:
Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.
NOTE:  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  DOUBLEY GOOD CHICKEN SOUP (CANNED):      In Step 1, omit mushroom soup.  Use 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed chicken and rice soup.  In Step 2, reduce nonfat dry milk to 8-3/4 oz (2 cups).  Follow Steps 3 and 4.

2.  LOGGING SOUP (CANNED):  Omit Step 1.  Use 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed bean with bacon soup and 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed vegetable beef soup.  Mix well.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Add 22 lb (2-3/4 gal) water.  Mix well.  Follow Step 4.

3.  TOMATO NOODLE SOUP (CANNED):  Omit Step 1.  Use 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed tomato soup and 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed beef noodle soup.  Mix well.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Add 22 lb (2-3/4 gal) water.  Mix well.  Follow Step 4.

4.  VEGETABLE BEEF SUPREME SOUP (CANNED)  Omit Step 1.  Use 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed vegetable with beef soup and 15 lb 10 oz (5 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed tomato soup.  Omit Steps 2 and 3.  Add 22 lb (2-3/4 gal) water.  Mix well.  Add 1/6 oz (2½ tsp) ground ginger (optional).  Mix well.  Follow Step 4.

Recipe.Name: Soup, chicken rice
Method: STEP 1:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 7½ gal water to make stock.
STEP 2:
Add celery (optional), onions (optional), carrots (optional), 2 bay leaves and pepper.  Cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes.
STEP 3:
Add rice.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 15 minutes or until rice is tender.  Remove bay leaves.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery; 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; 1 lb 4 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped carrots.
2.  In Step 2, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 1 lb spaghetti, vermicelli or egg noodles.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 15 minutes or until noodles are tender.  Remove bay leaves.

Recipe.Name: Soup, chicken vegetable/Mulligatawny
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions and peppers in butter or margarine until tender. Remove from fat; set aside for use in Step 4.  Reserve fat for use in Step 2.
STEP 2:
Blend fat and flour to form a roux.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base to make stock.  Add roux to stock, stirring constantly.  Cook until blended.
STEP 4:
Add sauteed onions and peppers, tomatoes, carrots, celery, apples, curry powder, cloves and pepper.
STEP 5:
Simmer 45 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; 1 lb 11 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb 6 oz chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions and 3-3/4 oz (3 cups) dehydrated green peppers or 1 lb 6 oz frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
3.  In Step 4:
-  1 lb 4 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb diced carrots.
-  1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery.
-  1 lb 15 oz fresh cooking apples A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz       sliced or diced cooking apples.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

Recipe.Name: Soup, corn chowder
Method: STEP 1:
Cook chopped bacon.  Drain.  Set bacon aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Saute' celery, onions, and peppers in salad oil 3 minutes or until tender.
STEP 3:

Add water, potatoes, salt, pepper and bacon to steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Add sauteed vegetables. Mix thoroughly.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
STEP 4:
Add corn.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes; stirring occasionally.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with 1½ gal warm water.  Add milk and butter or margarine to mixture.  Heat slowing to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 11 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped celery; 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions; and 10 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 2, 2 oz (9-2/3 tbsp) dehydrated onions and 1¼ oz (1 cup) dehydrated green peppers or 8 oz frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 4 lb 5 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 4 lb diced potatoes.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  CHICKEN CORN CHOWDER:  Omit Steps 1 through 5.  Combine 25 lb (8 No.3 cyl cn) Soup, condensed, Cream of Chicken and 17 lb 8 oz (8-3/4 qt) water; mix well.  Add 19 lb 14 oz (3 No.10 cn) canned, whole kernel corn, drained, and
1/8 oz (1½ tsp) black pepper.  Heat slowly to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.

Recipe.Name: Soup, cream of broccoli, cnd
Method: STEP 1:
Place soup in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with water.  Stir into soup.
STEP 3:
Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.
NOTE:  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATIONS:
1.  CREAM OF CHICKEN SOUP (CANNED):  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed cream of chicken soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.
2.  CREAM OF MUSHROOM SOUP (CANNED);  In Step 1, use 31 lb 4 oz (10 No.3 cyl cn) canned, condensed cream of mushroom soup.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

Recipe.Name: Soup, cream of mushroom
Method: STEP 1:
Drain and chop mushrooms.  Reserve liquid for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions and mushrooms in butter or margarine until onions are tender.  Remove from fat.  Set aside for use in Step 5.
STEP 3:
Blend fat, flour, and pepper to form a roux.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with reserved mushroom liquid and enough hot water to make 4 gal.  Gradually blend hot stock mixture into roux stirring constantly until smooth.
STEP 5:
Add mushroom-onion mixture.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes,
STEP 6:
Reconstitute dry milk with 1-3/4 gal warm water.  Add to soup.
STEP 7:
Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 14 No.8Z cn canned mushrooms may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 13 oz dry onions will yield 12 oz chopped onions.
3.  In Step 2, 1½ oz (½ cup) dehydrated onions may be  used.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP:  Omit Step 1.  Use 10 lb frozen broccoli.  Thaw; chop.  Set aside for use in Step 5.  In Step 2, use 1 lb 6 oz (2-3/4 cups) butter or margarine.  DO NOT REMOVE onions from fat.  In Step 3, use 1 lb 12 oz (1-3/4 qt) general purpose flour, sifted and 1 tbsp black pepper.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, add broccoli.  In Step 6, use 2 lb 7 oz (2¼ qt) nonfat dry milk and 1½ gal water.  Follow Step 7.

Recipe.Name: Soup, cream of potato, f/dehyd slices
Method: STEP 1:
Combine potatoes, onions, warm water, pepper and Soup and Gravy base.  Bring to a boil.  Simmer 1 hour or until potatoes are mushy.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute dry milk with 2 gal warm water.
STEP 3:
Stir milk into soup.  Heat to serving temperature.  DO NOT BOIL.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 3 lb (2¼ qt) dry chopped onions (3 lb 5 oz A.P.) may be used.
2.  In Step 1, 5 lb (1 gal - 2¼ No.10 cn) potatoes, white, dehydrated, diced, may be used.
3.  In Step 2, ½ cup dehydrated parsley may be added.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  CREAM OF POTATO SOUP (POTATOES, WHITE, FRESH):  In Step 1, 23 lb 13 oz (4½ gal) potatoes, white, fresh, diced (29 lb 5 oz A.P.) may be used for dehydrated sliced potatoes; decrease water to 3-3/4 gal; follow remainder of Step 1.  Follow Steps 2 and 3.

Recipe.Name: Soup, cream of potato, f/inst potatoes
Method: STEP 1:
Cook chopped bacon.  Drain.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions in butter or margarine until onions are tender.
STEP 3:
Add pepper, dill weed (optional) and bacon; mix well.
STEP 4:
Add water; bring to a boil.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk and Soup and Gravy base with 2-3/4 gal warm water; add to bacon mixture.  Bring to a simmer.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 6:
Stir potatoes rapidly into hot liquid.  Mix until smooth.
STEP 7:
Simmer 5 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 4, ½ cup dehydrated parsley may be added.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

Recipe.Name: Soup, creole
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions and peppers in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 5 minutes in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Stir occasionally.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 6 gal water to make stock.
STEP 3:
Add stock to sauteed peppers and onions.  Add pepper, spaghetti (2-inch pieces) and tomato paste.  Stir; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions; 2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions and 5½ oz (1 qt) dehydrated green peppers or 2 lb frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 1 lb 8 oz vermicelli may be used for spaghetti.
4.  In Step 3, 2 lb 13 oz (1¼ - 36-oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
5.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

Recipe.Name: Soup, Manhattan clam chowder
Method: STEP 1:
Cook bacon until crisp.  Remove bacon; drain; reserve ½ cup bacon fat for use in Step 2.  Finely chop bacon.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions and celery in bacon fat about 7 minutes or until tender crisp.
STEP 3:
Drain clams.  Reserve clam liquid for use in Step 4 and clams for use in Step 8.
STEP 4:

Combine bacon, sauteed vegetables, tomatoes, carrots, potatoes, salt, pepper, thyme, Worcestershire sauce, 2 bay leaves, catsup, water with reserved clam liquid (clam liquid plus water to make 2¼ gallons).
STEP 5:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
STEP 6:
Blend flour and 1 qt cold water to form a smooth paste.  Stir into chowder.
STEP 7:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 8:
Add clams; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer until clams are
hot.  Remove bay leaves.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, (2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions; 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 2, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 1 lb 13 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz diced carrots; 6 lb 2 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 5 lb diced potatoes.
4.  In Step 4, 1 lb 2 oz (½ No.10 cn) dehydrated diced potatoes or 1 lb 1 oz (3/4 gal) dehydrated sliced potatoes may be used.  Increase water and clam liquid to 2-3/4 gal.
5.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

Recipe.Name: Soup, navy bean
Method: STEP 1:
Pick over beans, removing discolored beans and foreign matter.  Wash thoroughly in cold water.
STEP 2:
Cover with 2 gal cold water; bring to a boil; boil 2 minutes.  Turn off heat.  Cover; let stand 1 hour.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base to make stock.
STEP 4:
Add beans to stock; bring to a boil; cover; simmer 2 hours or until beans are tender.
STEP 5:
Add shredded carrots, chopped onions and pepper to bean mixture.  Simmer 30 minutes.
STEP 6:
Blend flour and water to form a smooth paste.  Stir into soup; cook 10 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 5, 1 lb 4 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb shredded carrots; 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 5, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATIONS:

1.  BEAN SOUP WITH SMOKED, CURED HAM HOCKS:  Follow Steps 1 through 4.  Place 2 lb 8 oz thawed, smoked, cured pork hocks in water to cover.  Simmer 1 hour; remove from heat; cool.  Remove lean meat; chop into small pieces.  In Step 5, add chopped ham hocks.  Follow Step 6.

2.  KINCKERBOCKER SOUP (BEAN, TOMATO, AND BACON):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, reduce water to 3¼ gal.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, lightly brown 1 lb (3 cups) chopped raw bacon.  Add carrots, onions, pepper and 5 lb (3-3/4 qt) diced, fresh, white potatoes (6 lb 2 oz A.P.).  Cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally; add to bean mixture.  Add
6 lb 6 oz (1 - No.10 cn) canned, crushed tomatoes; simmer 25 minutes or until vegetables are tender.  Omit Step 6.
3.  OLD FASHIONED BEAN SOUP:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, reduce water to 4¼ gal.  Follow Step 4.  In Step 5, add 6 lb 6 oz (1 No.10 cn) canned, crushed tomatoes.  Follow Step 6.

Recipe.Name: Soup, New England fish chowder
Method: STEP 1:
Cook bacon until crisp.  Drain; finely chop and set aside for use in Step 6.  Reserve 1/3 cup bacon fat for use in Step 2.
STEP 2:
Saute onions and celery in bacon fat about 7 minutes or until tender crisp.
STEP 3:
Add potatoes and 2 gal water to onion-celery mixture; cook about 10 minutes or until potatoes are almost tender but still firm.
STEP 4:
Blend butter or margarine and flour to form a roux; set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with 2-3/4 gal warm water; add to potato mixture.  Heat to just below boiling.  DO NOT BOIL.
STEP 6:
Add roux and cooked bacon to milk and potato mixture.  Cook about 10 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 7:
Add fish fillets (skinless, cut in 2-inch pieces), pepper, thyme, parsley, and salt.  Simmer 10 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 2 lb 4 oz dry onins A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions; 1 lb 6 oz fresh celery will yield 1 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 2, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated chopped onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 8 lb 10 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 7 lb diced potatoes.
4.  In Step 3, 1 lb 11 oz (3/4 No.10 cn) dehydrated diced potatoes or 1 lb 8 oz (1 gal) dehydrated sliced potatoes may be used.  Increase water to 3½ gal.
5.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  NEW ENGLAND CLAM CHOWDER:    Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, drain 12 lb (four, 49 to 51 oz cn) canned, minced clams; add water to drained clam liquid to make 2 gal. Combine with potato mixture; reserve drained clams for use in Step 7.  Follow Steps 4 through 6.  In Step 7, omit fish; add clams; reduce salt to 1 oz (1-2/3 tbsp).

Recipe.Name: Soup, onion
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until lightly browned.
STEP 2:
Blend flour and pepper with onions.  Blend well.  Add Soup and Gravy base and water; stir well.  Simmer 15 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 16 lb 10 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 15 lb thinly sliced onions.
2   In Step 1, 1 lb 14 oz (2½ qt) dehydrated onions may be used..
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:
1.  FRENCH ONION SOUP:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, add
¼ cup Worcestershire sauce.  Prepare 1 recipe Parmesan Croutons.  Place 8 croutons in each soup bowl; pour soup over croutons just before serving.

Recipe.Name: Soup, pepper pot
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' vegetables in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 10 minutes.  DO NOT brown.  Remove vegetables from fat; set fat aside for use in Step 3; vegetables for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base (beef or chicken) with 5 gal boiling water to make stock.
STEP 3:
Blend fat and flour to form a roux; stir until smooth.  Add roux to stock, stirring constantly.  Cook until blended.
STEP 4:
Add sauteed vegetables, potatoes and pepper.  Cook about 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
STEP 5:
Reconstitute dry milk with 1½ qt warm water.
STEP 6:
Just before serving, remove soup from heat; slowly add milk, stirring constantly.
STEP 7:
Add pimientos.
NOTE:

1.  In Step 1: 9 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped onions.  1 lb 13 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped peppers. 2 lb 1 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz sliced celery.
2.  In Step 1, 1 oz (1/3 cup) dehydrated onions and 3 oz (2¼ cups) dehydrated green peppers;  or 1 lb 2 oz frozen, diced, green peppers may be used.
3.  In Step 4, 7 lb 3 oz fresh potatoes A.P. will yield 6 lb chopped potatoes.
4.  In Step 4, 6 lb frozen diced potatoes may be used.
5.  in Step 7, One 7-oz cn canned, drained pimientos may be used.
6.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.

Recipe.Name: Soup, rice w/beef
Method: STEP 1:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 7 gal water to make stock.
STEP 2:
Add carrots (optional), celery (optional), onions (optional), bay leaves and pepper.  Cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer about 30 minutes.
STEP 3:
Add rice.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 15 minutes or until rice is tender.  Remove bay leaves.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2: 1 lb 4 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped carrots.  1 lb 6 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped celery. 1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 3, 2 oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATIONS:
1.  BEEF BARLEY SOUP:      Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 3 lb (1½ qt) barley.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 20 minutes or until barley is tender.
2.  BEEF NOODLE SOUP:    Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 1 lb spaghetti, vermicelli, or egg noodles.  Simmer, stirring frequently, about 15 minutes or until noodles are tender.

Recipe.Name: Soup, Spanish, f/dehyd onion soup mix
Method: STEP 1:
Stir soup mix into 4½ gal boiling water.
STEP 2:
Cook chopped sausage until thoroughly browned.  Drain well.
STEP 3:
Mix peppers, tomatoes, 2 bay leaves and sausage.  Add to soup mixture.
STEP 4:
Return to a boil.  Reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 20 minutes.  Remove bay leaves.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 10 oz fresh peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped peppers.
2.  In Step 3, 1¼ oz (1 cup) dehydrated green peppers or 8 oz frozen, diced green peppers may be used.
3.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATIONS:
1.  ONION SOUP:  In Step 1, increase water to 50 lb (6¼ gal). Omit Steps 2 through 4.  Simmer 20 minutes.

2.  MEXICAN ONION CORN SOUP:  Follow Step 1; increase water to 42 lb (5¼ gal).  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  Use 13 lb 4 oz (two No.10 cn) canned whole kernel corn.  Drain; add corn to soup mixture.  Add 14 oz (two 7-oz can of ½ No.2½ cn) canned chopped pimientos and 1/3 oz (2¼ tsp) hot sauce.  Stir.  Simmer 20 minutes.

Recipe.Name: Soup, split pea
Method: STEP 1:
Pick over peas, removing any foreign matter.  Wash thoroughly in cold water.
STEP 2:
Cover peas with 3 gal cold water.  Bring to a boil.
STEP 3:
Add Soup and Gravy base, 4 gal boiling water, ham (optional), onions, carrots, 4 bay leaves, sugar and pepper to peas.
STEP 4:
Bring soup mixture to a boil; reduce heat; simmer about 2½ hours or until peas are mushy.  Remove bay leaves.
STEP 5:
Whip until mixture is smooth.  Add boiling water, if needed, for a thinner consistency.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, peas may be cooked 2 minutes, removed from heat, covered and allowed to stand 1 hour.  In Step 4, cook 1½ hours.
2.  In Step 3, 1 lb 13 oz (one 29-oz cn) canned ham chunks , drained may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb minced onions; 1 lb 6 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 1 lb 2 oz grated carrots.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:
1.  PUREE MONGOLE (SOUP, CONDENSED, TOMATO):  Prepare ½ recipe Split Pea Soup.  Blend with 12 lb 8 oz (4 No.3 cyl cn) canned condensed tomato soup and 14 lb (1-3/4 gal) water.  Heat to a simmer.

Recipe.Name: Soup, tomato
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions and celery in salad oil, melted shortening, or olive oil 5 minutes in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Stir frequently.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base to make stock.  Add stock to sauteed onions and celery.
STEP 3:
Add 3 bay leaves, pepper and sugar.  Stir.
STEP 4:
Cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
STEP 5:
Add tomatoes, mix well.  Cover; bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minute.  Remove bay leaves.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions; and  2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped celery.
2.  In Step 1, 2 oz (9-2/3 tbsp) dehydrated onions may be used.
3..  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  TOMATO RICE SOUP:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, add an additional 2 lb (1qt) boiling water.  Follow Step 3.  In Step 4, add 1 lb 8 oz (3½ cups) long grain rice.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 25 minutes or until rice is tender.  Follow Step 5.

Recipe.Name: Soup, tomato bouillon
Method: STEP 1:
Combine 4 lb chopped celery, 4 lb chopped onions and 2 gallons boiling water.  Simmer 30 minutes; strain; discard vegetables; reserve broth for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base to make stock.
STEP 3:
Combine vegetable broth, stock, tomato juice and pepper.  Heat to serving temperature.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 5 lb 8 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped celery; 4 lb 7 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 8 oz (2-2/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, 2½ - 36-oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate and 7½ qt water may be used for tomato juice.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
5.  May be served with croutons.  Prepare ½ recipe Croutons.

Recipe.Name: Soup, tomato/vegetable, f/dehyd mix
Method: STEP 1:
Stir 4 lb dehydrated VegTomato Soup w/noodles soup mix into  6-1/4 gallons boiling water.
STEP 2:
Return to a boil.  Reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender stirring occasionally.
NOTE:   One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATIONS:
1.  BEEF-NOODLE SOUP WITH VEGETABLES (DEHYDRATED):  In Step 1, use 3 lb 9 oz (3 No.2½ cn) dehydrated beef-noodle with vegetables soup.  Follow Step 2.

2.  CHICKEN-NOODLE SOUP (DEHYDRATED):  In Step 1, use 4 lb 12 oz (4 No.2½ cn) dehydrated chicken-noodle soup. Increase water to 6½ gal.  In Step 2, return to a boil.  Reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 7 minutes.

3.  CHICKEN-NOODLE VEGETABLE SOUP (DEHYDRATED):  In Step 1, use 4 lb 12 oz (4 No.2½ cn) dehydrated chicken-noodle soup.  Increase water to 6½ gal.  Add 5 lb frozen mixed vegetables.  In Step 2, return to a boil.  Reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 7 minutes or until vegetables are tender.

Recipe.Name: Soup, vegetable
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' gralic and onions in salad oil, shortening or olive oil until tender.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base with 4½ gal boiling water to make stock.
STEP 3:
Add carrots and celery.  Bring to a boil. Cover; reduce heat; simmer 15 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add sauteed garlic and onions, peppers, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, and pepper;  bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1 oz (1-1/3 tbsp - 4 cloves) dry minced garlic may be used.  Fry with onions.
2.  In Step 1, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped onions.
3.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 3, 2 lb 7 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped carrots; 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped celery.

5.  In Step 4, 10 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped peppers; 3 lb 10 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 3 lb diced potatoes; 2 lb 8 oz fresh cabbage A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped cabbage.
6.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION

1.  MINESTRONE SOUP:  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, decrease stock to 4 gal.  In Step 4, decrease potatoes to 2 lb (1½ qt - 2 lb 8 oz A.P.) and tomatoes to 6 lb 6 oz (3 qt - 1 No.10 cn).  Add 2 lb 1 oz (1 qt - 1/3 No.10 cn) canned, drained, green beans, 3 lb 7 oz (1½ qt - ½ No.10 cn) canned, drained, kidney beans, and 1 lb 8 oz (1½ qt) maca

Recipe.Name: Soup, zesty bean
Method: STEP 1:
Drain beans.
STEP 2:

Combine beans, 3¼ gal  water (2-3/4 gal used above for nutritional analysis), tomatoes, onions, celery, Soup and Gravy base, pepper, paprika, thyme, and 6 bay leaves in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; stir well.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 45 minutes or until vegetables are tender.  Remove bay leaves.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions.
2.  In  Step 2, 6 oz (1-3/4 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 2, 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb thinly sliced celery.
4.  One Size-3 ladle may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  ZESTY BEAN SOUP (DRY BEANS):  Omit Step 1.  Use 2 lb (4½ cups) dry kidney beans, 2 lb (4½ cups) dry white beans and 2 lb (4½ cups) dry pinto beans.  Pick over beans, removing discolored beans and foregin matter.  Wash thoroughly in cold water.  Cover with 16 lb (2 gal) cold water in stock pot or steam-jacketed kettle; bring to a boil; boil 2 minutes.  Turn off heat.  Cover; let stand 1 hour. In Step 2, increase water to 30 lb (3-3/4 gal); add Soup and Gravy base and bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; cover; simmer 3 hours or until beans are tender.  Stir occasionally.  Add tomatoes, onions, celery, pepper, paprika, and thyme; stir well.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover; simmer 45 minutes.  Remove bay leaves.

Recipe.Name: Spinach, club
Method: STEP 1:
Drain spinach; chop coarsely; place about 7 lb 8 oz (3-3/4 qt) in each pan.
STEP 2:
Cover spinach in each pan with 1 lb 4 oz (1¼ qt) cheese.
STEP 3:
Combine cracker crumbs and melted butter or margarine; sprinkle about 10 oz (3 cups) crumbs over cheese in each pan.
STEP 4:
Cook bacon; drain fat.  Finely chop bacon.  Sprinkle about
1½ oz (1/3 cup) bacon over mixture in each pan.
STEP 5:
Bake 45 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 27 lb frozen spinach may be used.  Cook spinach according to Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3; place about 3 qt chopped, drained spinach in each pan.
2.  In Step 3, DO NOT substitute bread crumbs for cracker crumbs.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
4.  One No.8 scoop may be used.
5.  In Step 5, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated on low fan, open vent.

Recipe.Name: Spinach, tangy
Method: STEP 1:
Cook spinach according to Guidelines for Cooking Frozen Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-3.  Drain.
STEP 2:
Saute' onions in oil, melted shortening or olive oil until tender.
STEP 3:
Stir in vinegar, salt and pepper; simmer 3 minutes.
STEP 4:
Pour vinegar-onion mixture over spinach.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 24 lb 8 oz (4 No.10 cn) canned spinach may be used for frozen spinach.  Heat according to Guidelines for Heating Dehydrated, Compressed Vegetables, Recipe No. Q-G-1.
2.  In Step 2, 1 lb 14 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 11 oz chopped onions.

Recipe.Name: Squash, Hubbard, baked
Method: STEP 1:
Cut squash in half; remove seeds.  Cut into 4½ oz pieces.
STEP 2:
Place squash cut side up in pans.
STEP 3:
Add 1½ cups warm water to each pan.  Cover pans.
STEP 4:
Bake 1 hour or until tender.
STEP 5:
Combine melted butter or margarine, 1 cup water, brown sugar, 1 tbsp cinnamon (optional), and salt; mix well.  Simmer about 5 minutes or until heated thoroughly in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 6:
Pour brown sugar sauce over squash in each pan.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 32 lb 8 oz fresh hubbard squash A.P. will yield 29 lb squash.

2.  In Step 1, 34 lb 12 oz acorn squash (40 lb A.P.) may be used.  Cut in half, lengthwise; remove seeds.  In Step 2, place cut side up in 10 steam table pans.  Follow Steps 3 through 6. EACH PORTION:  1 Squash Half (5 Ounces).
3.  In Step 4, in convection oven is used, bake at 350°F. 1 hour or until tender on high fan, closed vent.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

Recipe.Name: Squash, Louisiana/smothered
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions, peppers and celery in buttter or margarine until tender.  Set aside for use in Step 3.
STEP 2:
Add squash to boiling water; cook, covered in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot about 5 minutes or until just tender.
STEP 3:
Add sugar, salt and pepper to squash.  Add sauteed vegetables; mix lightly.
STEP 4:
Cook, covered, about 5 minutes, or until just heated through, stirring occasionally.
NOTE:
1.  Prepare in 25-portion batches.
2.  In Step 1, 1 lb 7 oz onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 5 oz chopped onions; 7 oz fresh, sweet peppers A.P. will yield 6 oz chopped peppers; and 8 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 6 oz chopped celery.
3.  In Step 1, 2½ oz (3/4 cup plus 1-1/3 tbsp) chopped dehydrated onions and 1 oz (3/4 cup) dehydrated green peppers may be used.
4.  In Step 2, 25 lb 3 oz fresh summer squash A.P. will yield 24 lb sliced summer squash.  Any variety of summer squash may be used.  DO NOT PARE SQUASH.
5.  In Step 2, 24 lb frozen, sliced summer squash may be used for fresh squash.
VARIATION:

1.  SAVORY SUMMER SQUASH:  In Step 1, omit green peppers, celery and butter.  Use 2 lb 8 oz (2 qt) sliced dry onions (2 lb 12 oz A.P.) and 2½ oz (5 tbsp) salad oil  or melted shortening to saute' onions.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, use 3½ oz (½ cup) granulated sugar; add 2 tbsp crushed sweet basil (optional).  Follow Step 4.

Recipe.Name: Squash, summer, creole
Method: STEP 1:
Saute' onions in butter, margarine or salad oil until tender.
STEP 2:
Combine sauteed onions, squash, and water.
STEP 3:
Bring to a boil.  Cover; reduce heat; simmer 10 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add tomatoes, salt, sugar, pepper, garlic, and parsley.
STEP 5:
Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 2, 21 lb fresh summer squash A.P. will yield 20 lb sliced summer squash.
3.  In Step 2, 20 lb frozen sliced summer squash may be used. In Step 3, simmer 5 minutes.
4.  In Step 4, 3 tsp (3 cloves) dry garlic, minced may be used.
5.  In Step 4, ¼ cup dehydrated parsley may be used.
6.  In Step 4, 3 oz fresh parsley A.P. will yield 2 oz chopped parsley.
7.  One No.6 scoop may be used.

Recipe.Name: Stew, beef
Method: STEP 1:

Place thawed, diced beef, water, tomatoes, salt, pepper, garlic, thyme and 4 bay leaves in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; cover.  Simmer 1 hour 40 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Add carrots (½-inch rings) to beef mixture. Cover; simmer 15 minutes.
STEP 3:
Add celery (1-inch pieces), onions (quartered), and potatoes.  Stir.  Cover; simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
STEP 4:
Remove bay leaves.  Thicken gravy, if desired.  Combine flour and water.  Add to stew while stirring.  Cook 5 minutes or until thickened.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 30 lb beef, pot roast, diced in 1 to 1½-inch pieces may be used.  Trim beef to remove excess fat and gristle.
2.  In Step 2, 9 lb 12 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 8 lb carrot rings.
3.  In Step 2, 13 lb 2 oz (2--No.10 cn) canned carrots, drained, or 8 lb frozen carrots may be used.
4.  In Step 3, 5 lb 8 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 4 lb celery cut into 1 inch pieces; 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb onions cut in quarters.
5.  In Step 3, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
6.  In Step 3, 12 lb 5 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 10 lb potatoes cut into 1 to 1½ inch pieces.
VARIATIONS:

1.  BEEF STEW (CANNED):  In Step 1, 66 lb 14 oz (10 - No.10 cn) canned Beef Stew With Vegetables may be used.  Omit Steps 2 through 4.  Heat to a serving temperature.  EACH PORTION:  1¼ Cups (10 Ounces).

2.  EL RANCHO STEW:  In Step 1, reduce water to 8 lb (1 gal) and salt to 3 oz (4-2/3 tbsp); omit tomatoes, garlic powder, thyme, and bay leaves.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, omit celery; increase onions to 4 lb (3½ qt).  Add 2 lb (1½ qt) frozen peas, simmer 10 minutes or until peas are tender.  In Step 4, use 1 lb (1 qt) flour and 2 lb (1 qt) water.  NOTE:  3 lb (3--No.303 cn) or 3 lb 5 oz (½--No.10 cn) drained canned peas may be used.  Add canned peas after thickening.  EACH PORTION:  1 Cup (8½ Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Stew, beef chunks, w/juices & veg, cnd
Method: STEP 1:
Place canned, drained beef chunks (raw beef substituted above), pepper and garlic in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 2:
Add water, tomatoes, thyme and 4 bay leaves.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.
STEP 3:
Add carrots to beef mixture.  Cover; simmer 15 minutes.
STEP 4:
Add celery, onions and potatoes to beef mixture.  Mix well.  Cover; simmer 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
STEP 5:
Thicken gravy, if desired.  Combine flour and 1½ qt cold water.  Add to stew while stirring; cook 5 minutes or until thickened.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 9 lb 12 oz fresh carrots A.P. will yield 8 lb carrot rings.
2.  In Step 4, 5 lb 8 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 4 lb celery cut into 1 inch pieces; 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb onions cut in quarters.
3.  In Step 4, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 4, 12 lb 5 oz fresh white potatoes A.P. will yield 10 potatotes cut into 1 to 1½ inch pieces.
5.  In Step 4, 8 lb (1¼ - No.10 cn) canned, drained whole potatoes may be used.  Quarter potatoes.  Simmer potatoes 10 minutes.
6.  One Size 3 ladle may be used.

Recipe.Name: Stew, chuck wagon/beans, w/beef
Method: STEP 1:
Cook l5 lb thawed beef in its own fat with onions and peppers until it loses its pink color, stirring to break apart in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Add catsup and beans to beef, onion and pepper mixture.  Stir well.
STEP 3:
Simmer 20 minutes
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 6 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 6 lb chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 12 oz (4 cups) dehydrated, chopped onions may be used.
3.  In Step 1, 3 lb 11 oz peppers, sweet A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped sweet peppers.
4.  In Step 1, 8 oz (6 cups) peppers, green, dehydrated may be used.

Recipe.Name: Stuffing, corn bread
Method: STEP 1:
Saute finely choppped celery and onions (finely chopped) in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil until tender.
STEP 2:
Combine breads, pepper, and poultry seasoning.  Toss lightly.
STEP 3:
Pour sauteed vegetables over bread mixture;  toss lightly.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute (with boiling water)  Soup and Gravy base to make stock.
STEP 5:
Mix stock and eggs together;  pour over bread and vegetable mixture;  mix lightly but thoroughly.
STEP 6:
Place 1-3/4 gal mixture in each well greased pan.
STEP 7:
Bake 1 hour or until top is lightly browned.
STEP 8:
Cut each pan 5 by 10.
NOTE :
1.  In Step 1, 4 lb 2 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 3 lb finely chopped celery; and 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb finely chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 2 cups dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, amount of liquid may vary with dryness of bread.
4.  In Step 7, if convection oven is used, bake at 300° F. 1 hour or until lightly browned on high fan, open vent.
5.  Corn bread may be prepared the day before.  Prepare 1/2 recipe Corn Bread.

Recipe.Name: Stuffing, savory bread
Method: STEP 1:
Saute chopped celery and chopped onions in margarine or butter until tender.
STEP 2:
Pour sauteed vegtables over bread;  toss lightly.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute (with boiling water)  Soup and Gravy base to make stock.
STEP 4:
Combine stock, poultry seasoning, pepper, and thyme;  add to bread mixture.  Mix lightly.  DO NOT OVERMIX.
STEP 5:
Place about 1-3/4 gal mixture in each well greased pan.
STEP 6:
Bake 1 to 1-1/2 hours or until top is lightly browned.
STEP 7:
Cut each pan 5 by 10.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 2 lb 12 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 2 lb finely chopped celery;  2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 lbs chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 6, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 40 to 60 minutes or until lightly browned on low fan, open vent.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.  See Recipes No A-25.
5.  Dressing may be served with fish, pork, beef, and veal.
VARIATIONS:

1.  APPLE DRESSING:  In Step 1, saute 4 lb 13 oz (1-1/2 gal)  peeled, diced, cooking apples (6 lb 3 oz A.P.)  with celery and onions.  Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, use 3 oz (1/2 cup)  Soup and Gravy base, chicken and 8 lb (1 gal)  boiling water.  In Step 4, omit thyme.  In Step 5, place about 2 gal mixture in each pan.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.

2.  SAUSAGE DRESSING:  In Step 1, reduce margarine or butter to 8 oz (1 cup).  Combine sauteed vegtables with 3 lb cooked, chopped, drained pork sausage (3 lb 9 oz A.P.).  Follow Steps 2 and 3.  In Step 4, if hot sausage is used, omit pepper.  In Step 5, place about 2 gal mixture in each pan.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.

3.  OYSTER DRESSING:  Thaw 6 lb (2-3/4 qt)  frozen oysters.  Drain;  reserve liquid;  chop oysters.  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  In Step 3, use 2-1/2 oz (6-1/3 tbsp)  Soup and Gravy base, chicken and 6 lb (3 qt)  boiling water.  In Step 4, add oysters and reserved oyster liquid.  In Step 5, place 1-3/4 gal mixture in each pan.  Follow Steps 6 and 7.

Recipe.Name: Syrup, maple
Method: STEP 1:
Combine brown sugar (6-lb is 12-3/4 cups), water, salt and cornstarch.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat; simmer about 10 minutes or until thickened.
STEP 2:
Remove from heat; add 1-1/3 tbsp maple flavoring.
NOTE;
1.  Hot syrup will be thin but will thicken upon cooling.
2.  Serve over pancakes, French toast, or waffles.

Recipe.Name: Tacos, f/ground beef
Method: STEP 1:
Prepare 1 recipe Taco Sauce (Recipe No. O-7).  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Cook 22 lb beef in its own fat until beef loses its pink color; stir to break apart.  Drain fat.
STEP 3:
Combine salt, red pepper, cumin (optional), garlic powder, chili powder, and flour; add to beef.  Saute 5 minutes.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 4:
Arrange 200 taco shells on sheet pans.  Bake 5-7 minutes until just heated.
STEP 5:
Place ¼ cup (1- No.16 scoop) meat filling in each taco; line up next to each other in steam table pan.  Cover; keep warm.
STEP 6:
Just before serving, top each taco with ½ oz (2 tbsp) cheese, ½ oz (2-1/3 tbsp) lettuce, ¼ oz (2 tsp) onions, and 2/3 oz (1 tbsp) taco sauce.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 7 lb 8 oz (17 - 7 oz bt) prepared taco sauce may be used.
2.  In Step 3, 1 3/4 oz (5 tbsp - 15 cloves) dry garlic, minced may be used.  Cook with beef in Step 2.
3.  In Step 4, if convection oven is used, bake at 325°F. 2-3 minutes on high fan, open vent.
4.  In Step 4, 8 lb 5 oz (200) frozen corn tortillas may be used. Thaw.
5.  In Step 6, 6 lb 8 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 6 lb shredded lettuce; 3 lb 5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 3 lb chopped onions.
6.  In Step 6, ingredients may be placed on serving lines for self-service.
VARIATIONS:
1.  TACOS (GROUND TURKEY):  Follow Step 1.  In Step 2, omit ground beef or beef pattie mix.  Use 22 lbs thawed ground turkey.  Follow Steps 3 through 6.  EACH PORTION:
2 Tacos (6½ Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Tea, hot, brewed
Method: STEP 1:
Place 8 oz loose tea in a cloth bag large enough to hold three times the amount.
STEP 2:
Tie top of bag with cord long enough to facilitate removal; tie cord to handle of urn or kettle.
STEP 3:
Place tea bag in urn or kettle.
STEP 4:
Pour 6½ gal briskly boiling water over tea bag.  Cover.  Steep 3 to 5 minutes.  DO NOT agitate or stir.
STEP 5:
Remove tea bag.
STEP 6:
Cover; keep hot, but DO NOT boil.
NOTE:
1.  If loose tea, not enclosed in a cloth bag, is placed in the urn or kettle, strain tea after it has steeped 5 minutes.
2.  Tea must never be boiled as this produces a bitter flavor.
3.  Schedule preparation so not more than 15 minutes will elapse between preparation and service; hold tea at temperatures 175°F. to 180°F.
4.  For 5 oz portions, use 5 oz (1-3/4 cups) tea, black, loose and 4 gal water.
5.  8 oz (100) individual tea bags may be used.  Place on serving line for self-service.

Recipe.Name: Tea, iced, f/instant
Method: STEP 1:
Add tea to water; stir until dissolved.
STEP 2:
Serve over crushed or cubed ice.
NOTE:
1.  YIELD: 8 gal strong tea.
2.  For each 8 oz glass, use about 5 oz strong tea.  Fill glass with crushed ice.  Serve two 8 oz glasses per portion.
VARIATIONS:

1.  ICED TEA (INSTANT, FOR DISPENSER)  Omit Step 1.  Place 6-3/4 oz jr. Tea Mix, Instant, on dispenser.  Follow manufacturer's directions for preparation, dispensing of tea and cleaning.  YIELD: 9 gal strong tea.  Follow Step 2.

2.  ICED TEA (INSTANT WITH LEMON AND SUGAR, FOR DISPENSER):  Omit Step 1.  Place 24 oz jr Tea Mix, Instant, with Lemon and Sugar, on dispenser.  Follow manufacturer's directions for perparation and dispensing.  YIELD: 1-1/2 gal strong tea.  For 100 portions (8 gal) strong tea, use 5-1/3 24 oz jr instant tea.  Follow Step 2.

Recipe.Name: Tomatoes, stewed
Method: STEP 1:
Combine tomatoes, onions, peppers, celery, and pepper.  Mix well.
STEP 2:
Bring to a boil to blend flavors.
NOTE:

1.  In Step 1:  5 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 4 oz chopped onions; 3 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2½ oz finely chopped peppers; and 5 oz fresh celery A.P. will yield 4 oz finely chopped celery.
2.  In Step 1, ½  oz (3 tbsp) dehydrated onions and ½ oz
(½ cup) dehydrated green peppers or 2½ oz (½ cup) frozen, diced green peppers may be used.
3.  Stewed tomatoes may be served chilled.
VARIATION:
1.  STEWED TOMATOES WITH CROUTONS:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Combine 1 lb 8 oz bread, cut in ½-inch cubes, with
8 oz (1 cup) melted butter or margarine.  Toast in 325°F. oven 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.  Add to stewed tomatoes just before serving.

Recipe.Name: Topping, orange/coconut
Method: STEP 1:
Cream softened butter or margarine and sugar together at medium speed in mixer bowl.
STEP 2:
Add flour, orange juice, orange rind, and coconut; blend.
STEP 3:
Spread over sweet rolls or coffee cakes after proofing.
NOTE:
1.  2-lb fresh oranges A.P. (4 oranges) will yield 1 cup juice and 6-tbsp orange rind.
2.  Topping may be used for coffee cake.

Recipe.Name: Topping, streusel
Method: STEP 1:
Place flour, sugars, and cinnamon in mixer bowl; blend thoroughly at low speed 2 minutes.
STEP 2:
Add butter or margarine to dry ingredients; blend at low speed 1½ to 2 minutes or until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal.  DO NOT OVERMIX.
STEP 3:
Sprinkle over sweet rolls and coffee cakes before baking.
NOTE:
If butter or margarine is too soft, a mass will form and mixture will not be crumbly.
VARIATION:

1.  PECAN TOPPING:  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Combine 8-oz (1 cup) butter or margarine, 2-lb (4¼ cups) packed brown sugar and 1-lb 8-oz (1½ qt) chopped pecans.  In Step 3, use as a topping for Pecan Rolls.  YIELD: 2½ Quarts.

Recipe.Name: Topping, whipped
Method: STEP 1:
Place cold water in mixer bowl;  add topping, milk, and vanilla.  Using whip at low speed, whip 3 minutes or until well blended.  Scrape down bowl.
STEP 2:
Whip at high speed 5 to 10 minutes or until stiff peaks form.  Cover;  refrigerate until ready to serve.
NOTE:
When topping is used for icing cakes, fold 8 oz (2 cups) sifted powdered sugar into whipped topping.
VARIATION:

WHIPPED TOPPING (TOPPING, DESSERT, AND BAKERY PRODUCTS, FROZEN):  Omit Steps 1 and 2.  Use 3 lb 6 oz (1-1/2 qt, 1/2, 6-1/2 to 7 lb cn)  topping, dessert, and bakery products, frozen.  Thaw topping in chilled mixer bowl.  Using whip at medium speed, whip topping 10 to 20 minutes or until stiff peaks form.  Cover;  refrigerate until ready to serve.  EACH PORTION:  About 3 tbsp (1/2 oz)

Recipe.Name: Topping, whipped cream
Method: STEP 1:
Pour cream into chilled mixer bowl.  Using whip, whip 3 to 7 minutes at medium speed or until slightly thickened.
STEP 2:
Gradually add sugar and vanilla.  Whip 7 to 8 minutes or until stiff.  DO NOT OVERWHIP.
STEP 3:
Cover;  refrigerate until ready to serve.
NOTE:
1.  Keep cream chilled before and during serving period.
2.  Whip cream in small batches of not more than 1 gal cream (measured before whipping) at one time.
3.  In Step 1, DO NOT use a mixer bowl larger than 20 qt.

Recipe.Name: Tostadas, beef & bean
Method: STEP 1:
Prepare ½ recipe Taco Filling (Recipe No. L-34) using 11 lb ground beef. Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Prepare ½ recipe Taco Sauce (Recipe No. O-7).  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 3:
Wash, trim & prepare vegetables.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 4:
Fry each tortilla 1½ minutes.  Drain on absorbent paper.  DO NOT FOLD.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 5:
Heat beans in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.
STEP 6:
Follow Assembly Instructions below.
STEP 7:
Serve immediately.
ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS:
1.  One tostada shell
2.  ¼ cup (1--No.16 scoop) refried beans, spread evenly
3.  ¼ cup (1--No.16 scoop) shredded cheese (American or Cheddar)
4.  ¼ cup (1--No.16 scoop) taco filling, spread evenly
5.  ¼ cup shredded lettuce
6.  2 tbsp (1--No.30 scoop) chopped tomatoes
7.  2 tsp chopped onions (optional)
8.  1 tbsp Taco Sauce
9.  1 tbsp sour cream (optional)
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 2--9oz bt prepared taco sauce may be used.

2.  In Step 3, 6 lb 8 oz fresh lettuce A.P. will yield 6 lb finely shredded lettuce; 5 lb 2 oz fresh tomatoes A.P. will yield 5 lb finely chopped tomatoes; and 1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz chopped onions.
3.  In Step 4, OVEN METHOD:  Place tortillas in rows, 4 by 6 (5 pans) on sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Bake in 425°F. oven 8 to 10 minutes or until crisp or in 375°F. convection oven 6 minutes.
4.  In Step 4, tortillas, corn, thawed may be used.  Deep fat fry 20 seconds.  OVEN METHOD:  Place tortillas in rows 3 by 5 (7 pans) on sheet pans (18x26-inches).  Follow remainder Note 3.
5.  In Step 5, 14 lb 2 oz (15--15 to 16 oz cn) canned refried beans may be used.
6.  In Step 5, ½ recipe Refried Beans (Recipe No. Q-38-1) may be used.
7.  In Steps 1, 2, 3 and 6, ingredients may be placed on serving line for self-service.
8.  Tostadas may be served with ½ recipe Guacamole (Recipe No. M-52).  Add 1 tbsp guacamole prior to sour cream in assembly of tostadas.

Recipe.Name: Sauce, taco
Method: STEP 1:
Combine tomatoes, chopped onions, peppers, salt, and sugar;  blend well.
STEP 2:
Cover;  refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, a milder sauce may be prepared by removing seeds from jalapeno peppers.
2.  In Step 1, 6 oz (2 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 1, 8-3/4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 oz chopped onions.
4.  One Size 0 ladle may be used.
5.  7 lb 10 oz (16-7 oz bt)  prepared taco sauce may be used.  Omit Steps 1 and 2.
VARIATION:

SALSA:  In Step 1, use coarsely chopped canned tomatoes or 6 lb 6 oz (3¼ qt)  finely chopped fresh tomatoes (6 lb 8 oz A.P.).  Follow Step 2.  Note:  For a hotter sauce, increase jalapeno peppers to 1 lb (1¼ cups).

Recipe.Name: Trout, baked, whole
Method: STEP 1:
Place single layer of thawed fish on well-greased pans, in rows, 2 by 6.
STEP 2:
Combine melted butter or margarine, dill weed, and pepper; add lemon juice.  Use 1 cup lemon-butter mixture for each pan.  Lightly brush inside and top of each fish.
STEP 3:
Combine bread crumbs and salt.  Use 1 cup bread crumbs per pan; evenly sprinkle on inside and outside of fish.
STEP 4:
Bake 15 minutes.
STEP 5:
Serve immediately.
NOTE:
1.  Since trout does not hold well in serving lines for long periods of time, prepare by progressive cooking methods in small batches.
2.  Heads may be removed in Step 1, if desired.
3.  In Step 2, 6 lb (24 lemons) fresh lemons A.P. will yield 1 qt juice.
4.  In Step 2, 1 cup frozen lemon juice concentrate and 3 cups cold water may be used for juice.
VARIATION;

1.  BAKED TROUT FILLETS:  In Step 1, use 32 lb (100 - 5 oz fillets) trout, thawed; place in rows 2 by 9, on 6 greased sheet pans, skin side down.  In Step 2, use 1 lb 11 oz (3-1/3 cups) butter or margarine, melted; 1½ tsp black pepper; and 2-2/3 cups lemon juice (4 lb - 16 lemons A.P.).  Evenly brush top of fish with 1 cup lemon-butter mixture per pan.  In Step 3, use 1 lb 8 oz (1½ qt) bread crumbs, dry and 3/4 oz (1-1/3 tbsp) salt; evenly sprinkle 1 cup mixture per pan over top of each fish.  In Step 4, bake 9 minutes.  Follow Step 5.  EACH PORTION: 1 Fillet (5½ Ounces).

Recipe.Name: Turkey, cutlet
Method: STEP 1:
Cook turkey (boneless, netted, thawed) according to Step 2, Recipe No. L-147 except simmer turkey 3 to 4 hours or until tender.  Drain.  Cool.  Remove netting.
STEP 2:
Slice turkey into slices, about 4 ounces each.  Dredge slices in mixture of flour, pepper and poultry seasoning; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Combine bread crumbs and paprika.
STEP 4:
Dip floured slices into beaten eggs (2.5 lb is 24 eggs).  Dredge in seasoned bread crumbs until well coated; shake off excess.
STEP 5:
Fry 2 minutes or until evenly browned.
STEP 6:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.

Recipe.Name: Turkey, nuggets/scallops
Method: STEP 1:
Cook turkey according to Step 2, Recipe No. L-147 except simmer turkey 3 to 4 hours or until tender.  Drain.  Remove netting.  Dice into 1-inch pieces.
STEP 2:
Dredge turkey in mixture of flour, salt, pepper and paprika; shake off excess.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute dry milk with warm water.  Add beaten eggs (1½ lb is 14 eggs).  Mix well.
STEP 4:
Dip floured turkey in milk and egg mixture.  Drain well.
STEP 5:
Roll in crumbs until well coated; shake off excess.
STEP 6:
Fry 2 minutes or until well browned. (2 cups frying shortening used for nutritional analysis.)
STEP 7:
Drain well in basket or on absorbent paper.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 3, 7 oz (1-3/4 cups) dehydrated egg mix combined with 1-3/4 cups warm water may be used for whole eggs.
2.  Serve with sweet and sour sauce, barbecue sauce, mustard sauce or Chicken Gravy (Recipe No. O-16-2).

Recipe.Name: Turkey, pattie, grilled
Method: STEP 1:
Combine thawed turkey, bread crumbs, onions, parsley, salt, garlic powder, white pepper and mustard; mix thoroughly.
STEP 2:
Shape into oval patties ½-inch thick weighting approximately
5 oz each.
STEP 3:
Grill patties on lightly greased griddle 8 minutes on each side or until an internal temperature of 170°F. is reached.
NOTES:
1.  In Step 1, 3 lb 2 oz A.P. dry onions will yield 2 lb 13 oz finely chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 3-3/4 oz A.P, fresh parsley A.P. will yield 3½ oz chopped parsley.  In Step 1, ½ oz (2/3 cup) dehydrated parsley may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  BAKED TURKEY PATTIE (OVEN METHOD):  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Omit Step 3.  Use 4 sheet pans.  Place 25 patties on each pan.  Bake at 375°F. 30 minutes or in a 325°F. convection oven 20 to 25 minutes or until an internal temperature of 170°F. is reached on high fan, open vent.

Recipe.Name: Turkey, roast
Method: STEP 1:
Ready-to-cook, thawed turkeys:  Remove bands from legs; open turkey cavity.  Cut off wing tips.
STEP 2:
Wash turkey thoroughly inside and out, under cold running water.  Drain well.
STEP 3:
Rub cavity with salt (optional) using approximately 3/4 cup total.
STEP 4:
Tuck legs and tail into cavity.  Place in roasting pans, breast side up.  Turkeys should not touch each other.
STEP 5:
Rub skin with salad oil or melted shortening.  DO NOT ADD WATER.
STEP 6:
Insert meat thermometer in center of inside thigh muscle of smallest bird.
STEP 7:
Roast uncovered until meat thermometer registers 180°F. to 185°F.  (See timetable.)
STEP 8:
Baste frequently with drippings.
NOTE:
1.  If desired, wing tips may be used in making stock for gravy, dressing or soup.
2.  Place frozen turkey in refrigerator to permit gradual thawing:  large turkeys, 16 lb and over - 2 to 3 days; small turkeys, under 16 lb - 1 to 2 days.
3.  If V-shaped racks are available, place in roasting pans to support birds.
4.  If no thermometer is available, to test for doneness, move the leg by grasping bone; if joint moves easily, the ligaments are tender and meat is done.
5.  If turkey begins to brown too quickly, cover with loose tent of food service aluminum foil.
6.  Omit Steps 5 and 8 if self-basting turkeys are used.
TIMETABLE FOR ROASTING TURKEYS (UNSTUFFED):
Weight          Oven      Cooking       Convection   Convection
of Turkeys     Temp.    Time (hrs)     Oven Temp   Oven Time
For best results in slicing, allow to stand 30 minutes.
SERVINGS PER TURKEY:
Ready-to-Cook Weight                   Number of Servings
8 to 12 lb                                        10 to 20
12 to 15 lb                                       20 to 32
16 to 24 lb                                       33 to 50
(about 2 servings per pound)

Recipe.Name: Turkey, roast, boneless
Method: STEP 1:
Remove casing; place netted, thawed turkey in pans.
STEP 2:
Roast 3 to 4½ hours (baste occasionally with drippings) uncovered or until meat thermometer registers a temperature of 170°F. to 175°F.
NOTE:
1.  Arrange roasts with similar diameters together.  Cooking time will vary depending on diameter of roasts.
2.  When roasted, remove from oven; let stand 15 to 20 minutes to absorb juices and for ease in slicing.
3.  Remove netting or bag.  Skin may be removed before slicing.  Slice turkey about ¼-inch thick.  Cover slices until served.
4.  Frozen turkeys will require 1 to 2 hours longer cooking time.
5.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, roast at 325°F. 2½ to 3½ hours or until meat thermometer registers 170°F. to 175°F. on high fan, closed vent.  Allow 15 to 17 minutes per pound.

6.  In Step 1, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 4 half sheet pans (13x18-inches) with racks.  Place 1 roast on each rack.  Cap ends of each roast with food service aluminum foil covering 3 inches of sides.  In Step 2, roast at 325°F. 70 minutes with 50% microwave power.  Roast 50 minutes without microwave power or until meat thermometer registers 170°F. to 175°F.  Insert meat thermometer; remove foil.  Allow 10 minutes per pound with 6 minutes per pound for microwave power.
VARIATION:

1.  ROAST TURKEY WITH BARBECUE SAUCE:  Follow Steps 1 and 2.  Use 15 lb 12 oz (1-3/4 gal) prepared Barbecue Sauce or 1 recipe Barbecue Sauce (Recipe No.0-2).  Bring sauce to a boil; reduce heat; cover; simmer about 5 minutes or until heated thoroughly.  Follow Note 3.  Serve ¼ cup (1 Size-1 ladle) sauce over turkey slices.  EACH PORTION:  1 to 2 Slices Turkey (3½ Ounces) plus ¼ Cup (2 Ounces) Barbecue Sauce.

Recipe.Name: Turnips, w/bacon
Method: STEP 1:
Add chopped bacon to1-1/2 gallons boiling water; simmer 30 minutes.
STEP 2:
Add 2 tbsp salt, pepper and pared, sliced ¼-inch crosswise, halved turnips to bacon and water.
STEP 3:
Cover; bring to a boil.  Remove cover; simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until just tender.
NOTE:
1.  In Setp 2, 24 lb 10 oz turnips A.P. will yield 20 lb pared sliced turnips.
2.  One No.8 scoop may be used.

Recipe.Name: Veal, parmesan
Method: STEP 1:
Prepare 1 recipe Tomato Sauce (Recipe No.O-15).  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 2:
Place steaks on pans.  Bake at 425°F. 20 minutes.  Turn steaks.  Bake 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated and browned.
STEP 3:
Cut cheese slices in half.  Place ½ slice cheese on each steak.
STEP 4:
Pour 2 lb 11 oz (1¼ qt) sauce over steaks in each pan.
STEP 5:
Sprinkle about 6 tbsp Parmesan cheese over steaks in each pan.
STEP 6:
Bake at 375°F. 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 10 lb 14 oz (1-2/3 No.10 cn) canned pizza sauce may be used.

2.  In Step 2, if convection oven is used, bake at 400°F. 10 minutes.  Turn steaks.  Bake 6 to 8 minutes or until thoroughly heated and browned on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 6, bake at 325°F. 6 to 8 minutes or until cheese is melted on high fan, closed vent.
3.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
VARIATION:

1.  VEAL STEAK:  Omit Steps 1 through 6.  Use 37 lb 8 oz frozen breaded veal steaks.  Fry in 350°F. deep fat until golden brown, about 5 minutes.  Serve immediately or hold partially covered until served.

Recipe.Name: Sauce, tomato
Method: STEP 1:
Saute finely chopped onions in melted shortening, salad oil, or olive oil in steamjacketed kettle or stock pot 5 minutes or until tender.
STEP 2:
Add flour to sauteed mixture;  stir until well blended.  Cook 5 minutes.
STEP 3:
Combine hot water, tomato paste, sugar, salt, pepper, red pepper, and garlic powder.  Add to flour-onion mixture.
STEP 4:
Bring to a boil;  reduce heat;  simmer 15 minutes.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1, 1 lb 11 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb 8 oz finely chopped onions.
2.  In Step 1, 3 oz (1 cup) dehydrated onions may be used.
3.  In Step 3, two 36 oz cn canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.
4.  Sauce may be served over sliced meat loaf, roast beef, roast pork, or veal cutlets.
5.  One Size 1 ladle may be used.

Recipe.Name: Veal, parmesan, cubes
Method: STEP 1:
Brown thawed veal roast, diced into 1-inch pieces in steam-jacketed kettle or stock pot.  Drain or skim off excess fat.
STEP 2:
Add finely chopped onions; saute until tender.
STEP 3:
Mix salt, sugar, red pepper, garlic, oregano dried, basil, tomato paste and hot water.  Add to veal; bring to a boil.  Reduce heat; cover; simmer 1 hour 15 minutes or until veal is tender.
STEP 4:
Place 4¼ qt veal mixture in 4 steam table pans (12x20x2½ inches).
STEP 5:
Sprinkle 1 cup cheese over mixture in each pan.  Serve immediately.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 2, 4 oz (1-1/3 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
2.  In Step 2, 2 lb 4 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 2 finely chopped onions.
3.  In Step 3, 1-1/3 tbsp (2 cloves) minced dry garlic may be used.  Fry with onions in Step 2.
4.  In Step 3, 4 lb 8 oz (2 - 36 oz cn) canned tomato juice concentrate may be used.

Recipe.Name: Veal, roast
Method: STEP 1:
Place thawed roasts fat side up in pans without crowding.  Sprinkle roasts with pepper.
STEP 2:
Insert meat thermometer into roasts.  DO NOT ADD WATER; DO NOT COVER.
STEP 3:
Roast 3 to 5 hours or until meat themometer registers 160°F. for medium and 170°F. for well done.
STEP 4:
Let stand 20 minutes.  Remove netting before slicing.
NOTE:
1.  In Step 1 racks may be used.

2.  In Step 1, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 6 half sheet pans (13"x18") with racks.  Place 1 roast on each rack.  Roast at 325°F. 20 minutes with 50% microwave power. Follow Step 2.  In Step 3, roast 1 hour 20 minutes without microwave power.  Note 1: Allow about 15 minutes per poind for medium. Note 2: If roasts are frozen, roast at 325°F. 45 minutes with 50% microwave power.  In Step 3, roast 1 hour 30 minutets with microwave power.  Allow about 22 minutes per pound with 8 minutes per pound with microwave power.

3.  In Step 3, if convection oven is used, roast at 325°F. 3½ hours on high fan, closed vent or until meat thermometer registers 160°F. - medium; 170°F. - well done.  Note: Allow about 28 minutes per pound for medium.
4.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.
5.  Frozen roasts will requrie 30 minutes to 1 hour longer cooking time.
VARIATION:

1.  ROAST VEAL WITH HERBS:  In Step 1, reduce pepper to 1/3 oz (1-1/3 tbsp); add ¼ oz (1-2/3 tbsp) ground thyme, 1/8 oz (1¼ tsp) garlic powder. 1/6 oz (1 tbsp) ground tarragon and 1/9 oz (1 tbsp) dillweed.  Follow Steps 2 through 4.

Recipe.Name: Veal, steak paprika
Method: STEP 1:

Place steaks on pans.  Bake at 425°F. 20 minutes.  Turn steaks.  Bake 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated and browned.  Turn steaks; place steaks in single layer in each steam table pan.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 2:
Saute onions in salad oil, melted shortening or olive oil 10 minutes.  Set aside for use in Step 7.
STEP 3:
Combine flour and water; mix until smooth.
STEP 4:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base in boiling water.  Add paprika and garlic powder.  Gradually add flour mixture, stirring constantly.
STEP 5:
Return to a boil; reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes or until thickened.  Remove from heat.
STEP 6:
Carefully blend sour cream with 1 qt gravy.  Combine with remaining gravy.  Mix well.
STEP 7:
Place about 13 oz (2-3/4 cups) onions over steaks in each pan.
STEP 8:
Pour about 1 lb 15 oz (3-2/3 cups) gravy over steaks in each pan.  Sprinkle about 1 tsp paprika over steaks in each pan.
STEP 9:
Bake at 375°F. 20 to 25 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, if convection oven is used, bake at 400°F. 10 minutes.  Turn steaks.  Bake 6 to 8 minutes or until thoroughly heated and browned on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 9, bake at 325°F. 10 to 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
2.  In Step 2, 8 lb 14 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 8 lb thinly sliced onions.
3.  In Step 2, 1 lb (4-7/8 cups) dehydrated onions may be used.
4.  In Step 4, 8 cloves dry minced garlic may be used.  Saute with onions in Step 2.
5.  In Step 6, Sour Cream Sauce Mix may be used for sour cream.  Mix according to instructions on container.
6.  Other sizes and types of pans may be used.

Recipe.Name: Veal, steak, Italian style
Method: STEP 1:

Place 20 steaks on each pan.  Bake at 425°F. 20 minutes.  Turn steaks.  Bake 15 minutes or until thoroughly heated and browned.  Place steaks in single layer in each steam table pan.  Set aside for use in Step 6.
STEP 2:
Saute onions and peppers in salad oil, shortening or olive oil 10 minutes.  Set aside for use in Step 4.
STEP 3:
Reconstitute Soup and Gravy base in boiling water.
STEP 4:
Add sauteed vegetables, tomatoes, parsley, sugar, salt, oregano and garlic powder to stock.  Mix well; bring to a boil. Reduce heat.  Simmer 5 minutes.
STEP 5:
Pour about 1 lb 3 oz (1 qt) sauce over steaks in each pan.
STEP 6:
Bake at 375°F. 15 minutes or until hot.
NOTE:

1.  In Step 1, if convection oven is used, bake at 400°F. 10 minutes.  Turn steaks.  Bake 6 to 8 minutes or until thoroughly heated and browned on high fan, closed vent.  In Step 6, bake at 325°F. 15 to 20 minutes or until hot.

2.  In Step 1, if microwave-convection oven is used, use 11 half sheet pans (13x18-inches).  Place 9 steaks on each pan. Bake at 450°F. 8 minutes with 80% microwave power throughout.  Turn steaks, bake 4 minutes.  In Step 5, pour about 3 cups sauce over steaks in each pan.  In Step 6, bake 1 minute or until hot with 80% microwave power throughout.
3.  In Step 2:  1 lb 2 oz dry onions A.P. will yield 1 lb chopped onions.  2 lb 7 oz fresh sweet peppers A.P. will yield 2 lb chopped peppers.
4.  In Step 4, ½ cup (24 cloves) dry minced garlic may be used.  Saute with onions and peppers in Step 2.
5.  In Step 2, 2 oz (9-2/3 tbsp) dehydrated onions and 5 oz (3 cups) dehydrated green peppes may be used; or 2 lb (1½ qt) frozen diced peppers may be used.  Thaw peppers.
6.  In Step 4, 4¼ oz fresh parsley A.P. will yield 4 oz chopped parsley.
7.  Other types of pans may be

Recipe.Name: Wash, cornstarch
Method: STEP 1:
Combine cornstarch and water.  Bring to a boil; cook until clear.
STEP 2:
Brush on bread and rolls before and immediately after baking.
NOTE:
Keep wash warm.  Reheat, if necessary.

Recipe.Name: Wash, egg
Method: STEP 1:
Combine eggs (15 tbsp is about 5 eggs),  dry milk and water, mix well.
STEP 2:
Brush over shaped dough before or after proofing.
NOTE:
1.  Keep washes cool until used.
2.  In Step 1, 2½ oz (1/2 cup plus 2 tbsp) canned dehydrated egg mix combined with 3/4 cup warm water may be used for whole eggs.
VARIATION:
